article_snippet: Aston Villa midfielder Jack Grealish has emerged as a transfer target for Manchester City with Pep Guardiola already planning for next season at the Etihad, Metro.co.uk understands.

Manchester City are close to agreeing a £100m deal to sign Jack Grealish from Aston Villa.City submitted their £100m offer on Friday and it is understood Villa are willing to let Grealish leave for the Premier League champions.
Jack Grealish has completed a medical at Manchester City ahead of his proposed £100m transfer from Aston Villa.
Manchester City are delighted to announce the signing of Jack Grealish on a six-year deal.

Manchester City will consider Jack Grealish as a summer target should they receive their asking price from Bayern Munich for Leroy Sane.Grealish is expected to be the subject of bids when the Premier League season ends, with Manchester United also watching his situation at Aston Villa as they battle to avoid Premier League relegation. Pep Guardiola is a huge admirer of Grealish, describing him as “one of the best players in the league” before facing Villa in the League Cup final this season. “I’m a big fan of him,” said the City manager.

Manchester City are weighing up a swoop for Aston Villa midfielder Douglas Luiz - as they also target the club's star man Jack Grealish.And City could launch a £100m double raid to land the two midfielders as they look to wrest the Premier League title from reigning champions Liverpool.

Manchester City have made Jack Grealish their No1 midfield target and are prepared to make the Aston Villa star English football's first £100million player. (...)Grealish has long been admired by Pep Guardiola and City's manager wants the 25-year-old at the hub of what he hopes he will become the second great team of his reign in Manchester.

Pep Guardiola wants Jack Grealish as part of Manchester City's summer squad strengthening programme, with sources telling ESPN that the City manager regards the Aston Villa midfielder as important a target as Tottenham forward Harry Kane.{...] Sources have told ESPN that City believe they can win the race for the 25-year-old, who is rated at £100 million by Villa.

Manchester City have expressed strong interest in Jack Grealish but Aston Villa are determined not to sell and have opened talks with the forward over a new contract.Grealish [...] is understood to have been identified as one of City’s main targets, along with Tottenham’s Harry Kane.Their resolve would be tested if Grealish asked for a transfer, and City plan to bid for him. [...] Any fee for Grealish would likely be at least £100m.

Manchester City have stepped up their pursuit of Jack Grealish by opening negotiations with Aston Villa. The England playmaker is a key target for City, along with Tottenham’s Harry Kane, and a decision on whether a deal can be struck is expected within days.

Manchester City have made an English record £100m bid for Aston Villa captain Jack Grealish.City manager Pep Guardiola has made the 25-year-old English midfielder one of his major targets.It is understood there has been communication between the two Premier League clubs throughout the summer.

Manchester City's £100m bid for Jack Grealish is expected to be accepted by Aston Villa.While Villa are yet to formally respond to City's offer - which was made on Friday - it is understood they are now willing to allow their captain to leave.

Manchester United have identified Jack Grealish as their top summer target.Manchester United will have to act quickly if they want to sign Jack Grealish in the summer transfer window as Aston Villa chiefs draw up a new contract for their talisman. Grealish has scored seven goals and provided five assists in the Premier League this season to thrust him up the list of many European heavyweights’ transfer targets.

M.E.N. Sport understands that despite the financial uncertainty surrounding the world of football in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, United plan to press ahead with their summer transfer strategy.It's understood that United have prioritised the signing of Aston Villa captain Jack Grealish in the position rather than another target in Leicester City's James Maddison.United expressed their interest in Grealish in February to try and get ahead of the competition and it's believed he could be available at a cheaper price should Villa be relegated [...]

Manchester United will step up their bid to sign Jack Grealish in a £75m deal - after being told to wait another 12 months to land Jadon Sancho. [...]Woodward will now look to negotiate a deal with Aston Villa for Grealish, who has also been on United's radar for the last 12 months.

The Athletic has been told that when this interrupted season is finally over, the 24-year-old is expected to leave in search of a brighter and bigger future at the elite end of the Premier League, with Manchester United leading the chase for his signature. [...]Manchester United are favourites to sign him but it’s understood that a number of clubs on the continent will also come into contention if it gets to that point, as the asking price of around £80 million is likely to be lower than it would be if Villa stay up.

Jack Grealish’s agent has dismissed speculation that Jack Grealish has reached an agreement with Manchester United but admits it would be ‘great’ for the midfielder to playing Champions League football next season.
Crystal Palace have identified Jack Grealish as one player capable of helping fill the attacking void if they lose Wilfried Zaha.

Chelsea are ready to re-sign Romelu Lukaku this summer as Thomas Tuchel plots a Premier League title challenge.The Blues want a new centre forward ahead of next season — with the Inter Milan hitman viewed as the most realistic target by club recruitment staff.Lukaku is now viewed as one of Europe's premier centre forwards and, at 28, is entering his prime. Inter are understood to value Lukaku at £100m but Chelsea will be keen to negotiate a lower price given Inter's need to sell.

Roman Abramovich is personally driving the push to bring Romelu Lukaku back to Chelsea.The Blues owner is ready to back Thomas Tuchel this summer with improvements being considered in defence, midfield and attack - and Abramovich is getting involved personally over a potential return of Lukaku. It is understood he is convinced the Inter Milan forward is the ideal player to improve their chances of kicking on to a Premier League title challenge next season.

Romelu Lukaku confirms he is ‘staying at Inter’ and has ‘already spoken to the new coach,’ ending speculation of a Premier League move.The striker had been linked with a possible return to the Premier League for Chelsea or Manchester City.However, he just had the best campaign of his career when helping Inter win the Serie A title and has no intention of moving on.“I am staying at Inter,” Lukaku told VTM this evening.

Chelsea have had an offer for Romelu Lukaku worth £85m rejected by Inter Milan.Chelsea's proposal would have also seen left-back Marcos Alonso move to Inter, according to Sky in Italy.The offer came after the Premier League club were warned it would take an offer of more than €100m (£85m) to tempt the Italian champions to sell Lukaku.

Chelsea target Romelu Lukaku has told Inter Milan he wants to leave the club if they receive a suitable offer.The Blues had an £85m bid for the 28-year-old rejected by the Serie A champions earlier this week.

Romelu Lukaku is waiting on the go-ahead to seal a return to Chelsea, with Inter Milan now prepared to let the Belgium international go.Chelsea are poised to make a renewed bid for the striker in the region of £100-110million, which the Italian champions are expected to accept.

Chelsea have agreed in principle a club-record deal worth £97.5m (€115m) to re-sign striker Romelu Lukaku from Inter Milan.The paperwork is now with club lawyers and once that is formalised, Lukaku will undergo a medical and sign a five-year contract.

Inter Milan striker Romelu Lukaku is scheduled to undergo his medical in Belgium on Sunday ahead of his €115 million move to Chelsea.The Athletic understands that Lukaku, 28, should then arrive in London within 24 hours.

One of the most prolific strikers in European football, Lukaku has returned to the club he supported as a young boy (...). The Belgian has signed a five-year contract and will add attacking firepower to Thomas Tuchel’s squad of European champions.
ROMELU LUKAKU is set to feature at the centre of a tug of war this summer between Paris Saint-Germain and Inter Milan.
Romelu Lukaku to join Inter after Manchester United accept £70m bid

Inter Milan are preparing a £9m offer to sign Manchester United striker Romelu Lukaku on a two-year loan deal.The deal would also include an obligation to buy the Belgium international for another £54m.
Manchester United are likely to reject Inter Milan’s proposed £62.7 million deal to first loan and then buy Romelu Lukaku.
Inter Milan officials are due to arrive in the UK this week as they step up talks with Manchester United over a potential deal for Romelu Lukaku, Sky Sports News understands.

Belgium forward Romelu Lukaku looks increasingly likely to be staying at Manchester United.It had been expected Inter Milan would try and sign Lukaku, 26, following the appointment of long-time admirer Antonio Conte as manager.However, there has been no bid tabled so far. Even if one were to be, United would want in excess of the £75m they paid Everton for him two years ago.
Inter Milan are expected to make a new offer of £60m plus bonuses for Manchester United striker Romelu Lukaku this week, Sky Sports News has been told.

Inter Milan hope to offer Romelu Lukaku £41m over five years, including bonuses, if they can convince Manchester United to sell the Belgian striker.Inter's latest proposal for Lukaku would guarantee United £63m, including add-ons, but structured over two or three years. It is believed that is still short of United's expectations with the club wanting more than the £79m they paid Everton in 2017.

Manchester United have rejected a 60m euro (£53.9m) bid from Inter Milan for striker Romelu Lukaku.The bid falls well below United's valuation of the 26-year-old Belgium international, who joined them from Everton two years ago for £75m.
Inter Milan are set to make a new offer for Manchester United striker Romelu Lukaku, according to Sky sources.Their imminent new bid is expected to be less than United's minimum asking price of £79m.
Inter Milan have made a fresh bid for Romelu Lukaku and are confident Manchester United will accept the offer, Sky Sports News understands.

Manchester United’s Ed Woodward will meet with Inter Milan chiefs ‘in the coming days’.The executive vice-chairman is reportedly set for talks with Inter CEO Giuseppe Marotta and director of football Piero Ausilio over the future of United striker Romelu Lukaku .Inter are said to be interested in the Belgian, with United currently demanding a fee of between 70 and 80 million euros for his services.Manchester United’s Ed Woodward will meet with Inter Milan chiefs ‘in the coming days’.The executive vice-chairman is reportedly set for talks with Inter CEO Giuseppe Marotta and director of football Piero Ausilio over the future of United striker Romelu Lukaku .Inter are said to be interested in the Belgian, with United currently demanding a fee of between 70 and 80 million euros for his services.

Manchester United striker Romelu Lukaku is worried he will be priced out of a move to Inter Milan this summer.The Red Devils forward only started 15 of 29 games under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and now wants to move on. Executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward wants £70million in order to be persuaded to sell.Inter are willing to meet Lukaku's £175,000-a-week wage but value the Belgium international at £50m.
Manchester United star Romelu Lukaku flew to Italy to hold talks with Inter Milan representatives and has agreed a deal to join the Serie A giants.
Manchester United will allow Romelu Lukaku to join Inter Milan this summer — but only for a fee of around £80 million.

Manchester United forward Romelu Lukaku has reportedly agreed personal terms with Inter Milan.According to Gazzetta dello Sport, Lukaku and Inter have agreed a deal over personal terms which could see the former Everton star earn £6.6m in bonuses until 2024. However, the Serie A giants are yet to reach an agreement with the Red Devils over Lukaku’s price, with the Premier League giants holding out for an offer of £62m.
Internazionale would like to sign the Manchester United striker Romelu Lukaku this summer but would have to offload Mauro Icardi first to have any chance of financing the deal.

Romelu Lukaku's agent Federico Pastorello was in Milan on Tuesday for talks with Inter amid reports linking the Manchester United striker with a move to Italy.Pastorello was in Milan to discuss other clients but also on the agenda for the next few days is the future of the United striker, who has been linked with a move to Inter.
Juventus are favourites to sign Romelu Lukaku despite claims from Inter Milan that they are "still working" for the Manchester United striker, Sky Sports News understands.

Manchester United have refused to meet Paulo Dybala's exorbitant wage demands to leave Romelu Lukaku in limbo as deadline day looms.Lukaku, 26, had agreed to join Juventus in a potential swap deal involving Dybala, 25, but United have ended their pursuit of the Argentina international.
Romelu Lukaku will be soon in London to sign his contract as new Chelsea player.

Manchester United believe they can convince Borussia Dortmund to sell Jadon Sancho this summer.The England international has been identified as one of Man Utd’s top targets in the next transfer window, with a source claiming: “They are doing everything they can to sign him.”And despite Dortmund’s public stance that their teenage star is not for sale at any price – a bid in excess of £80m is expected to be enough to lure him to Old Trafford.

Manchester United have agreed a fee in principle of 85m euros (£73m) with Borussia Dortmund for Jadon Sancho.The 21-year-old England winger, who is yet to have a medical or agree personal terms, is expected to sign a five-year contract with the option of a sixth.

Manchester United is delighted to announce it has reached agreement in principle with Borussia Dortmund for the transfer of Jadon Sancho.The signing is subject to contractual terms and a medical, which will be completed after Jadon’s involvement in the UEFA European Championship.
Manchester United is delighted to announce the signing of Jadon Sancho, subject to international clearance, keeping him at the club until June 2026, with an option of a further year.

Manchester United remain in talks with Jadon Sancho's representatives over a potential transfer this summer.Sky Sports News has been told that "as it stands, United represents the most realistic destination" for Sancho.Personal terms are not expected to be a problem as United negotiated terms when they tried to sign Sancho last summer.
Manchester United are moving closer to reaching an agreement with Borussia Dortmund to sign Jadon Sancho after the asking price fell to £80 million plus add-ons.- subscription required -

Manchester United have had a £67m bid for England winger Jadon Sancho turned down by Borussia Dortmund.The German club want about £77.5m for the 21-year-old, with an additional £4.25m bonus payment on top.BBC Sport also understands that in addition to the fee not being high enough, United wanted to pay it over five years when Dortmund are only willing for it to extend to four.

Talks continue between Manchester United and Borussia Dortmund for Jadon Sancho, who is with the England squad ahead of their Euro 2020 opener against Croatia on Sunday; United proposed a deal worth around £75m but Dortmund are thought to want closer to £86m including add-ons

Jadon Sancho has agreed terms in principle to join Manchester United from Borussia Dortmund.The Manchester Evening News understands Sancho 's camp expect the winger to join United even though their opening offer was rejected by Dortmund last week. United's bid of £67million was around £10m shy of Dortmund's demand for an up-front fee for Sancho but Sancho's representatives are confident the transfer will still go through.

Manchester United have submitted an improved second offer for the Borussia Dortmund winger Jadon Sancho.United were knocked back with their opening bid of £67million plus £8million in add-ons last week, but have returned to the German club with a revised offer, understood to be worth more than £75million.The new offer would see United pay a higher amount up front, with the rest of the fee in achievable add-ons. Dortmund are considering the offer but reportedly value Sancho at more than £80million.

Manchester United have indicated to Borussia Dortmund that they are prepared to raise their offer for Jadon Sancho to £73m (€85m) as they close in on the signing of the England forward.Negotiations with Dortmund have been ongoing for several weeks after United refused to match the German club’s valuation last summer, with the 21-year-old former Manchester City player thought to be available for £77.5m (€90m). But with Sancho already having agreed personal terms on a five-year deal worth about £350,000 a week, it is understood that United’s latest offer could tempt Dortmund into doing business for a player who has two years left on his contract.

Manchester United are getting closer to agreeing a deal to sign Jadon Sancho from Borussia Dortmund.A proposed deal for the England winger is worth in the region of £77m, with the clubs in the process of finalising the payment structure and potential add-ons.
Jadon Sancho to Manchester United... HERE WE GO!

Borussia Dortmund have set a 10 August deadline to agree a deal for forward Jadon Sancho - who is Manchester United's top summer transfer target - to leave the club.The German club have told United they want in excess of £100m for the 20-year-old England winger.
Sky in Germany are reporting that Manchester United have agreed terms with Jadon Sancho.

Manchester United and Borussia Dortmund remain far apart in their valuation of England forward Jadon Sancho.It had been reported United had agreed personal terms with Sancho, but BBC Sport understands that is not the case.

Jadon Sancho will not leave Borussia Dortmund this summer. "We are planning with Sancho," BVB sporting director Michael Zorc said in a media round table. "He will play with us next season. The decision is definite. I think that answers all questions." Those statements end all speculations about a possible transfer to Manchester United.

Jadon Sancho is pushing his agent to secure a transfer this summer after a move to Manchester United failed to materialise last year.The Manchester Evening News understands Borussia Dortmund winger Sancho, 21, was disappointed his representative Emeka Obasi failed to engineer a transfer to United following protracted negotiations.

Manchester United already have a transfer agreement in place with Jadon Sancho, according to reports. The Red Devils spent all of last summer trying to prise the England international away from Borussia Dortmund. [...]United are expected to return for Sancho and the Athletic claim an agreement is already in place between the club and player.Salary expectations and agent fees, which were agreed on last summer, will apparently remain the same.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has made Jadon Sancho a transfer priority this summer despite support from some Manchester United players for Jack Grealish as a signing. (...)Sancho, 21, is expected to be allowed to leave Dortmund in the next window for around £75million, one year after United were interested but could not strike a deal for the ex-Manchester City winger. - subscription required -

Ole Gunnar Solskjær wants to strengthen Manchester United in the centre-back, midfield, wide attacker and No 9 positions, with Pau Torres, Declan Rice, Jadon Sancho and Harry Kane among his preferred targets.Although the manager is conscious that adding four major signings is unlikely given an estimated total cost of more than £300m and the availability of any particular player, he is intent at least on pursuing one in each of his identified areas to bolster a squad that requires an upgrade in quality and depth.

Borussia Dortmund chief executive Hans-Joachim Watzke insists Jadon Sancho will not leave the club this summer.The England international is reportedly a big-money target for Manchester United, who are planning to move on up to six first-team players at the end of the season.

Borussia Dortmund have set the conditions for Jadon Sancho's potential summer transfer. Ruhr Nachrichten reported that all interested parties, among them Manchester United, have been informed that the winger will be available for no less than €120 million. Sancho is currently under contract until 2022.

Manchester United are in advanced talks with Jadon Sancho. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has identified the Borussia Dortmund winger as his top target ahead of the summer transfer window. [...]Woodward is believed to be preparing to launch an offer worth £80million once Champions League football has been secured.

Manchester United will not be bound by any artificial deadline in the pursuit of their leading summer transfer target, Jadon Sancho, as the club press ahead with their recruitment plans now Champions League qualification has been secured.United have yet to submit a formal bid for Sancho, despite reports in Germany on Monday that they had made an opening £89 million offer to Borussia Dortmund for the England winger.- subscription required -

Manchester United are working hard with Borussia Dortmund to find a solution for the transfer of Jadon Sancho, after cooling interest in Jack Grealish.Discussions for Sancho centre around the transfer fee and structure of payments. It is believed Dortmund want a deal sorted by August 10 when the club return for pre-season training in order to give them time to find a replacement.There has been no bid from United as of yet, but they are the only club to have made official contact with Dortmund.United are looking at alternatives, notably Kingsley Coman on loan from Bayern Munich, but their chances of convincing Sancho to come to Old Trafford will have been enhanced by them qualifying for the Champions League.
Jadon Sancho gets Man Utd fans excited over transfer with Marcus Rashford message
Manchester United are in advanced negotiations with Borussia Dortmund to sign Jadon Sancho for an initial €100m (£90m) – a fee that would set a transfer record for an English player.

Jadon Sancho will be Chelsea's principal target now their transfer ban has been lifted, with expectation increasing that the England winger will chose Stamford Bridge next summer, when he is expected to move from Borussia Dortmund.Chelsea will have to pay a club record for the 19-year-old, likely to be around £100million, but will also try to sign a new centre forward, despite the rise of Tammy Abraham, with RB Leipzig's Timo Werner in their sights.
Paris Saint-Germain are ready to fight Manchester United for the signing of Borussia Dortmund and England star Jadon Sancho.
Real Madrid are ready to contend with Manchester United for the signature of Borussia Dortmund wonderkid Jadon Sancho this summer.

Arsenal will let Mikel Arteta spend significantly to improve his squad in this transfer window if the right players become available, but they face a battle to land the Fiorentina forward Dusan Vlahovic.Vlahovic has rejected an extension to his contract, which expires in 2023, and Fiorentina will need to cash in on their prize asset before next season.Interest in Vlahovic from Europe’s wealthier clubs is significant and, even if Arsenal put together a viable package this month, they would face several obstacles in completing a potentially complicated deal.

Arsenal retain a strong interest in Dusan Vlahovic but will find it difficult to complete a deal this month due to the size of the transfer fee needed to sign the Fiorentina striker.Italian sources also say Vlahovic's preference is to join a side competing in the Champions League. Arsenal have not qualified for the competition for the past four seasons, although they are currently fourth in the Premier League.

Arsenal are ready to press ahead with an ambitious move for Dusan Vlahovic, which could pave the way for Eddie Nketiah to join Crystal Palace.The Gunners are working on deal worth around £58million to sign the Fiorentina forward, who has been one of the most prolific strikers in Europe this season.

Tottenham are lining up a move for Fiorentina striker Dusan Vlahovic as they look to find a partner for talisman Harry Kane, according to reports.The Telegraph claim that Fiorentina would demand around £50million for the exciting forward. (...)
Juventus agree £62.8m fee with Fiorentina for Dusan Vlahovic; striker is keen to make the switch; Fiorentina want to sell Vlahovic this month; Arsenal and Tottenham were interested in the striker.
Dusan Vlahović to Juventus, done deal and here we go!
Dusan Vlahovic to Juventus, done deal here we go! Total agreement with player, agents and Fiorentina 75m fee adding included. 7m net salary per season.

Twenty goals in 24 appearances, between Serie A and Coppa Italia, in the first part of the 2021/2022 season. Those numbers rise to 41 in 64 appearances if totalled with those from the 2020/2021 season.Any player boasting stats like these can be summed up in two words: lethal finisher - or, if you prefer, Dušan Vlahović, now officially at Juventus - what better way to celebrate your 22nd birthday?

Manchester City are crunching the numbers to work out if they would be able to sign Lionel Messi without breaching Financial Fair Play rules if the Barcelona star becomes available, sources have told ESPN.
Pep Guardiola and Lionel Messi spoke on the phone last week to discuss the possibility of the Barcelona forward making a move to Manchester City this summer, sources have confirmed to ESPN.

Manchester City believe they have a chance of signing Lionel Messi after the forward told Barcelona he wants to leave.It is understood City are banking on being able to get Messi on a free or for a relatively minimal fee, and a legal battle may determine that. Messi’s camp believes a clause in his contract means he can walk away for nothing. Barcelona, by contrast, insist that he is still bound by a €700m (£629m) buy-out clause.

Lionel Messi faces a defining day in his career amid reports he is considering a U-turn over his decision to leave Barcelona. The man regarded by many as the game's greatest ever player is now considering seeing out the remaining year of his contract, according to TyC Sports.
Lionel Messi to leave Barcelona with Paris Saint-Germain already in talks
Tearful Lionel Messi bids goodbye to Barcelona; sources say PSG deal agreed

Lionel Messi joins PSG... HERE WE GO! Total agreement completed on a two-years contract. Option to extend until June 2024. Salary around €35m net per season add ons included. Flag of ArgentinaFlag of France #MessiMessi has definitely accepted PSG contract proposal and will be in Paris in the next hours.
Reports: Messi joins Paris Saint-Germain - Neymar offers number 10
Manchester City favourites to sign The Greatest of all time Lionel Messi

Italian Media Report Inter Seriously Considering Trying To Sign Lionel Messi From BarcelonaSigning Messi would be a real signal of intent from Inter president Steven Zhang who hopes to take Inter back to the top. Messi currently earns €50 million net a year combined from his salary, prize money and signing bonuses, some €19 million more than Juventus’ Cristiano Ronaldo.

Chelsea have matched Paris Saint-Germain's £56.1m (€60m) offer for Inter Milan wing-back Achraf Hakimi.Sky in Italy are reporting that Inter may well be more open to Chelsea's proposal because of the Italian club's interest in Emerson Palmieri and Andreas Christensen.Chelsea's offer for Hakimi appears still to be some way short of Inter's asking price. They are understood to value the Morocco full-back at £68.8m (€80m).

Reports in Italy claim Chelsea have upped their bid for Archaf Hakimi as they look to edge Paris Saint-Germain to a transfer deal. The Blues initially matched the offer on the table from the Parisians but now they are looking to win the race to sign the Moroccan as they target Premier League glory next season.According to Italian newspaper Il Corriere dello Sport, Chelsea have offered Inter £43million plus Emerson Palmieri.

Chelsea are making progress in their attempt to sign Inter Milan right-back Achraf Hakimi.Both the Blues and Paris Saint-Germain have made £51.6m (€60m) offers but Inter want at least £68m (€80m), which Sky Sports News revealed earlier this month.However, Inter are willing to take players as part of any deal and Marcos Alonso and David Zappacosta are being discussed during negotiations.
PSG Preparing To Improve Offer For Inter’s Achraf Hakimi Over The Weekend, Italian Media Report

Reports this afternoon are claiming Real Madrid full-back Achraf Hakimi is about to join Inter in a €40m deal.Hakimi is currently on loan at Borussia Dortmund, but his two-year arrangement is coming to an end

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is targeting RB Leipzig defender Dayot Upamecano to bolster his defensive options at Manchester United, sources have told ESPN.[...] Solskjaer is now prioritising the addition of a top-quality centre-half to play alongside captain Harry Maguire and Upamecano is the top target.
Frank Lampard is plotting an overhaul of his Chelsea defence this summer - with Dayot Upamecano having emerged as his No.1 target.

Arsenal and Tottenham are set for a bidding war over RB Leipzig star defender Dayot Upamecano.Express Sport understands that the Gunners and Spurs are willing to meet Leipzig’s whopping £50million valuation for Upamecano ahead of the January transfer window to strengthen their respective defences as they eye a top-four finish.
​Manchester City are considering a January bid for RB Leipzig defender Dayot Upamecano, as they look to add some much-needed depth to their defence.
Arsenal are targeting the signing of RB Leipzig centre-back Dayot Upamecano, a source close to the Premier League club has told ESPN FC.
#5 Dayot UpamecanoDate of birth/Age: Oct 27, 1998 (22)Place of birth: FranceÉvreuxCitizenship: FranceFrance

Nine months after Antoine Griezmann appeared in his own documentary about his decision over whether to stay at Atletico Madrid or join Barcelona, the Frenchman has changed his mind.Of course, he stayed, upsetting Barca, but after Atletico lost in the Champions League and then again at San Mames in La Liga, leaving them 10 points behind the Catalans.He was promised a winning team, with Lucas Hernandez’s contract renewed and Thomas Lemar joining - both requested by Griezmann - and Diego Simeone convinced him not to become a lackey for Messi. They gave him a 23m euro a season contract.But with Lucas and Diego Godin thinking about leaving, Griezy now wonders if he should leave.Not even winning the World Cup earned him the Ballon d’Or, in conjunction with the Europa League.The No 7 will not be short of offers, despite his huge salary.Bayern Munich and Manchester United are frontrunners, particularly the English side.
Arsenal interested in summer move for England new boy Ben White and have held initial talks but Brighton slap £50MILLION price tag on the 23-year-old defender
Brighton have rejected a £40m bid from Arsenal for defender Ben White.Talks are ongoing between the two clubs.Arsenal are expected to go back with an improved offer for the 23-year-old centre-back.

Arsenal are moving closer to reaching an agreement with Brighton & Hove Albion to sign England defender Ben White in a potential transfer anticipated to be worth around £50 million.After seeing their initial advances for the 23-year-old centre-back rejected, the north London club are now progressing in negotiations with their fellow Premier League side and a deal is not far off.Face-to-face talks between the parties have taken place and their relations are known to be very strong, raising the prospect that a consensus will be found for White to become an Arsenal player.

Arsenal are expected to make a third bid for Brighton defender Ben White after having their initial two offers rejected for the centre-back.The clubs are in continued talks over the England international with Arsenal remaining hopeful they can reach a deal, but Brighton have not made their valuation public.

Arsenal and Brighton have finally reached an agreement for the transfer of England defender Ben White.White is one of Arsenal’s main targets this summer and a fee of around £50 million is believed to have been agreed after weeks of negotiations.
Arsenal hope to confirm the £50million signing of Ben White from Brighton with the defender undergoing a medical this weekend.

Ben White is undergoing the second part of his medical at Arsenal ahead of completing his £50m move from Brighton.The England defender went through the first stage on Wednesday on his return from a holiday after being part of England's squad at Euro 2020.

Ben White has joined us from Brighton & Hove Albion on a long-term contract.The 23-year-old defender, who has proved to be one of the Premier League’s finest young prospects, joins us after spending the summer as part of the England squad at the Euros.
‘MIGHT BE SOLD’: CLUB WILL SELL 23-YEAR-OLD FOR OVER £30M WITH TOTTENHAM REPORTEDLY KEEN, EXPERT CLAIMS

Manchester United have added Brighton defender Ben White to their centre-back options for the next two transfer windows.MEN Sport understands United are huge admirers of White, as well as RB Leipzig star Dayot Upamecano and Real Madrid's Raphael Varane, as they consider a swoop for a central defender in 2021.

Leeds have had an improved £22m bid rejected by Brighton for defender Ben White.Leeds were unsuccessful with an initial £18.5m offer for the centre-back, who enjoyed a hugely successful season on loan at Elland Road, helping the club win the Championship and earn promotion to the Premier League.

Leeds United have made a third bid for Brighton defender Ben White, believed to be £25m.The newly-promoted Premier League side have already seen bids of £18.5m and £22m rejected for a centre-back who enjoyed a hugely successful loan spell at Elland Road last season.
Albion will not be accepting a third Leeds bid for Ben White.The Elland Road outfit have tabled an offer reported to be worth £25 million plus potential add-ons.

Brighton will not sell defender Ben White to Leeds - for any price - because they want to avoid strengthening a club they consider to be a direct Premier League rival.Leeds had a third bid - worth £25m - for White rejected last week and will now turn their attention elsewhere with Brighton's stance over the centre-back having become clear.

Alongside champions Liverpool, Chelsea are also monitoring developments with the Brighton defender Ben White. Leeds United have already had two bids for White rejected and although they have made a third offer of £25m, Brighton are determined not to sell the 22-year-old.Lampard admires White, who helped Leeds win promotion to the Premier League during an impressive spell on loan at Elland Road last season, but it remains to be seen if anyone can come up with enough money to alter Brighton’s stance this summer. White, who has two years left on his contract with the option of an extra year, is yet to agree a new deal with Brighton and has rejected the club’s latest offer.

Xavi's first transfer to Barcelona is a matter of days, as Ferran Torres has already said adios to his teammates at Manchester City.The first big transfer in January has been closed by the Blaugrana, who will pay 55 million euros plus 10 in a bonus to the Citizens for the Spaniard who plays as a winger and at the top of the attack. There is agreement on all sides and the only thing missing to formalize the deal is the final okay of the English.Xavi has practically completed his first transfer and Ferran Torres is expected to be announced by the Catalans on December 28.

Manchester City have edged closer to completing the signing of Valencia winger Ferran Torres after agreeing personal terms, report Eurosport Spain.Sources close to the player have told Eurosport Spain that the player’s representatives met with City on Wednesday and reached total agreement on the terms of the deal.

Manchester City are determined to sign Valencia winger Ferran Torres, but they have made clear to Los Che that they will not pay over the odds for the 20-year-old.Ferran's contract comes to an end on June 30, 2021, and Manchester City have informed Valencia that they will not pay more than 35 million euros plus some add-ons relating to objectives.
Valencia are playing hardball with Manchester City over a fee for winger Ferran Torres as the Spanish club seek to raise around €80 million (£73m) through player sales.- subscription required -

Manchester City could make Valencia winger Ferran Torres their first summer signing to replace Leroy Sane.Valencia want £40m for Torres, who has a year left on his contract with the La Liga club, and BBC Sport understands the 20-year-old Spain international is keen on a move to Etihad Stadium.

Manchester City are close to agreeing a deal to sign Valencia winger Ferran Torres.Talks between the clubs are at an advanced stage and discussions are centring around an initial fee of £20.9m plus bonuses.

Manchester City are close to agreeing a fee with Valencia for winger Ferran Torres, sources have told ESPN.Manchester City are close to agreeing a fee with Valencia for winger Ferran Torres, sources have told ESPN.
Ferran Torres is expected to seal a €27m (£24.5m) move to Manchester City from Valencia after the forward met Txiki Begiristain, the Premier League club’s sporting director, in Barcelona on Tuesday.

Manchester City have completed the signing of Ferran Torres from Valencia, subject to international clearance.The 20-year-old has penned a five-year contract keeping him at the Club until the summer of 2025.

Manchester United are said to be preparing a move for Valencia winger Ferran Torres in case they fail to land top target Jadon Sancho.As per Fichajes, Borussia Dortmund’s £100m asking price for the winger may prove too high for the Red Devils.Torres would be a much cheaper alternative but Valencia are still likely to demand around £35m for the 20-year-old.A Valencia youth academy graduate, Torres has scored four goals and notched four assists in 30 La Liga games this season.

Arsenal and Leicester have joined the list of clubs monitoring Valencia teenager Ferran Torres.Winger Torres, 19, is attracting admiring glances following an eye-catching first full season at Valencia, helping them finish fourth in La Liga and reach the Europa League semi-finals.

Arsenal and Leicester have joined the list of clubs monitoring Valencia teenager Ferran Torres.Winger Torres, 19, is attracting admiring glances following an eye-catching first full season at Valencia, helping them finish fourth in La Liga and reach the Europa League semi-finals.

FC Barcelona are planning a swoop for highly-rated Valencia midfielder Ferran Torres, claim local reports.According to Miguel Rico, a reliable journalist at Mundo Deportivo, the 20-year-old, whose current deal expires in 2021, has already rejected two renewal offers from his current employers Los Che. His release clause set at $110mn, it is believed by Barça that a fee of just $39mn may be required to lure Torres to the Camp Nou.

The name of Ferran Torres has long been on the Real Madrid agenda despite the fact that he is only 19 years old.He was an ‘alevín’ (under-12) when they first tried to sign him. Then, while he was a ‘cadete’ (under-16) they again came knocking at his door – quite literally – and invited him to visit the Real Madrid training facilities. The last Madrid attempt came when he was at ‘juvenil’ level, specifically during the U17 World Cup in India.It was after that Valencia reacted, promoting him to the first team and raising his buyout clause from €8 million to €25 million and then, four months later, to €100 million. Now they are trying to renew his deal again as it currently ends in 2021.
Manchester United have made contact with Rennes over midfielder Eduardo Camavinga.Further talks are planned with Rennes plus Camavinga’s representatives this week.

Manchester United are making progress in attempts to sign the midfielder Eduardo Camavinga from Rennes. The 18-year-old is a France international with three caps but went to the Under-21 European Championship rather than Euro 2020 this year.Rennes are open to selling Camavinga for about €30m (£25.7m) because they could otherwise lose him for nothing next summer, when his contract is due to expire. He has been a long-term target for United and other clubs, notably Paris Saint-Germain, are also interested.

Real Madrid have been keeping tabs on Eduardo Camavinga for two years, although in recent months they have started looking at the Rennes midfielder with more intent.The 17-year-old has rose to prominence in the 2019/20 season, starting with a stellar display against Paris Saint-Germain in a 2-1 victory for the Brittany club, and that has attracted attention from some of the biggest clubs in Europe.
Manchester United are reportedly set to lock horns with Barcelona for the signature of Rennes midfielder Eduardo Camavinga in next summer's transfer window.

Manchester United have been told that it is going to take €40m (£35m) for them to sign Eintracht Frankfurt’s Andre Silva this summer. The Red Devils have been linked with the forward in the past as an alternative to Borussia Dortmund’s Erling Haaland.
Eintracht Frankfurt attacker Ante Rebic has left the Bundesliga club to join AC Milan on a two-year loan deal, with Andre Silva leaving Serie A to replace him in Germany.

Manchester United are in advanced talks to sign Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo from Juventus. Manchester United have reached an agreement with Juventus to re-sign Cristiano Ronaldo.Juventus will reportedly receive €15m (£12.8m) plus €8m (£6.8m) in add-ons for Ronaldo, who is set to sign a two-year contract with United after personal terms are finalised.Ronaldo's agent Jorge Mendes said earlier in the day that a deal for the Portugal captain to return to Old Trafford was very close.
Manchester United is delighted to confirm that the club has reached agreement with Juventus for the transfer of Cristiano Ronaldo, subject to agreement of personal terms, visa and medical.

Cristiano Ronaldo has completed his Manchester United medical as he closes on a return to his former club.United announced they had reached an agreement with Juventus to re-sign the 36-year-old forward on Friday.
Manchester United is delighted to confirm the signing of Cristiano Ronaldo on a two-year contract with the option to extend for a further year, subject to international clearance.

Cristiano Ronaldo has reached an agreement with Manchester City over a sensational transfer from Juventus to the Premier League champions, according to AS.The Spanish sports daily reports that Ronaldo has struck a deal with City, who have offered him a two-year contract with a salary of €15 million per season, about half of what he earns in Turin.

Manchester City are hoping to pull off a sensational attempt to sign Cristiano Ronaldo after the Portugal forward’s representative held talks with Juventus over a potential return to the Premier League.The 36-year-old has less than 12 months left of his deal with the Italian club that is worth an estimated €31m a season after tax, having moved to Serie A from Real Madrid in 2018. Ronaldo’s agent, Jorge Mendes, was in Turin on Wednesday to discuss the former Manchester United forward’s future after weeks of speculation, with Juventus understood to want a fee of between €25 and €30m.

Manchester City are no longer in talks to sign Cristiano Ronaldo. (...)City were offered the chance to sign Ronaldo and considered a deal to sign him, as they were believed to be the player's first choice.However, while recognising his qualities as a player, there was not a great deal of enthusiasm among the City board as Ronaldo is not the profile they would normally go for.

According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, Cristiano Ronaldo is tempted by a potential return to Manchester United and is willing to take a pay cut to play with the Red Devils again.The contract of the Portuguese star expires in June 2022, but the paper reports Ronaldo is considering leaving Juventus as the season hasn’t gone as planned.The Old Lady are also in financial troubles, which is the main reason they decided to launch a Super League along with some of the most storied clubs in Europe, but the project lasted just 48 hours.

Tottenham could be set to splash out £50 million to secure the services of former Manchester United man Memphis Depay, the Mirror reports. The Netherlands international has impressed during his time at Lyon, so much so that the London side are reportedly preparing a seismic bid for him.

Lyon sporting director Juninho Pernambucano has confirmed Manchester United will have the first option to buy Memphis Depay if he leaves the club. Depay joined Lyon from United in January 2017 after a difficult 18-month spell with the club.
LIVERPOOL sent scouts to watch Lyon’s 3-0 win over Marseille last week as they weight up a move for forward Memphis Depay, according to reports.

Newcastle have made a €40m (£33.5m) offer for Lyon’s defensive midfielder Bruno Guimarães and are awaiting a response from the French club.The 24-year-old Brazil international has not indicated whether he would welcome a move to St James’ Park. Other suitors, including Arsenal and Juventus, are interested in buying him at the end of the season.

Newcastle have agreed a fee with Lyon in the region of £30m to sign midfielder Bruno Guimaraes and are also targeting a deal to sign Brighton defender Dan Burn.It is understood Brazil international Guimaraes will undergo a medical in his homeland on Wednesday.However, Lyon have released a statement denying an agreement has been reached.

Bruno Guimaraes is set to undergo a medical on Friday ahead of completing a move to Newcastle.Guimaraes will take a medical in his homeland of Brazil after Newcastle agreed a package worth in the region of £33m plus add-ons with French club Lyon to sign the midfielder.

Newcastle United are set to sign Lyon midfielder Bruno Guimaraes after the two clubs agreed a deal in principle.Reports suggest the fee is 40m euros (£35m) with a further 8m (£6.7m) euros in add-ons.The Brazilian passed a medical while on international duty in South America with the two clubs finalising details before an announcement is made.
Newcastle United are delighted to confirm the signing of Brazil international Bruno Guimarães on a four-and-a-half-year deal.

Arsenal have not given up on trying to sign Bruno Guimaraes from Lyon. The Brazil midfielder would cost at least €30m (£25.1m).He has been watched closely by other clubs such as PSG, Man United and Spurs.Arsenal were interested in him two years ago before Lyon signed him from Atheltico Paranaense.The player is currently with the Brazil squad preparing for games against Ecuador and Paraguay.

ARSENAL are being used in an auction by Brazilian side Athletico Paranaense as they try to sell their midfielder Bruno Guimaraes, according to Portuguese reports.The Gunners have been credited with an interest in the 22-year-old after Paranaense chief Mario Celso Petraglia confirmed Arsenal had been monitoring the player.But reports in Portugal suggest Athletico have been using Arsenal to drum interest from elsewhere.A Bola claimed the reported interest from Arsenal forced Benfica into making an initial offer over fears of missing out.

RB Leipzig have confirmed Tottenham's interest in Marcel Sabitzer.Standard Sport understands that the midfielder is among Jose Mourinho's key targets for the January transfer window, though a move could hinge on Dele Alli's future.Sabitzer caught the eye of Spurs last year as he scored twice to help dump Mourinho & Co. out of the Champions League. The 26-year-old has just 18 months left on his contract and Leipzig sporting director Markus Krosche says talks over an extension will not begin until after the transfer window. "We wanted to end the year first, both sides will deal more intensively with the topic in the spring," he told Bild (via Sport Witness). When asked specifically about Tottenham's interest, Krosche continued: "As I said, he has made a great development. It goes without saying that other clubs also notice this."

Tottenham may wait until the summer to try and sign RB Leipzig midfielder, Marcel Sabitzer, according to a report from The Athletic.Spurs are said to be keen on signing the Austrian midfielder, with Jose Mourinho a big fan of the 26-year-old. However, The Athletic claims that a deal is more likely in the summer, given current circumstances.It is believed Sabitzer is happy to stay put for now but, come the summer, he will be in the final 12 months of his contract and it is believed his asking-price could drop to £30m or less.That could well put him in the sights of Spurs, who spent a lot in the summer just gone and are, like most clubs, dealing with the financial implications of the pandemic.

Ibrahima Konate is close to completing a transfer to Liverpool.The Premier League side have agreed personal terms with the RB Leipzig defender, who is set to move to Anfield in the summer on a five-year contract.Konate, 21, has a release clause in his Leipzig contract worth around €35million (£30m), with the two clubs in advanced talks over the terms of the payment.

RB Leipzig chief Oliver Mintzlaff has opened up on the future of Ibrahima Konate amid interest from Liverpool.The ECHO understands that Reds have placed Konate on a five-man centre-back shortlist that they will consider signing this summer.After the game Mintzlaff spoke to the media about Konate’s future, and confirmed that the player does have a release clause in his contract.Konate is said to have a clause that could be activated if interested clubs pay £34m, but despite this Mintzlaff says he wants the player to stay at Leipzig.

RB Leipzig expect Ibrahima Konate to join Liverpool this summer and are waiting for official confirmation that they will pay his €35m (£30.2m) release clause.Leipzig are already looking for replacements for the French centre-back, who turned 22 on Tuesday and made 21 appearances in 2020-21.

Liverpool have agreed to sign Ibrahima Konate from RB Leipzig on a five-year contract, sources have told ESPN.The defender passed his medical a few weeks ago and will complete a move to Anfield once he returns from competing at the Under-21 European Championship with France this summer.

Liverpool Football Club have reached an agreement for the transfer of Ibrahima Konate from RB Leipzig.The 22-year-old defender has agreed a long-term contract with the Reds from July 1, subject to international clearance and a successful work permit application process, after finalising terms and passing a medical.

Roma have agreed a £34m deal to sign Tammy Abraham from Chelsea, reports Sky in Italy.The 23-year-old striker must now decide if he wants to join the Italian club, who are managed by former Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho.

Roma are confident of completing a deal to sign Tammy Abraham from Chelsea. (...)Abraham and his representatives have held positive talks with Roma general manager Tiago Pinto over a deal worth between €40m and €45m.

Chelsea striker Tammy Abraham has completed a medical ahead of joining Roma for £34m.Talks progressed positively after Roma general manager Tiago Pinto met the striker in London on Thursday, and the Serie A side believe he will be a key part of boss Jose Mourinho's plans.Abraham is expected to sign a five-year contract worth £4m a year after tax.

AS Roma are delighted to be able to confirm the signing of England international Tammy Abraham.Abraham, 23, joins the club from Premier League side Chelsea – with whom he won the Champions League earlier this year – for a fee of €40 million.

Southampton have joined the race for Chelsea striker Tammy Abraham after the shock sale of striker Danny Ings to Aston Villa.Southampton will now look to re-invest the money and have joined Arsenal and West Ham in pursuit of Chelsea's Abraham, who fell down the pecking order under Thomas Tuchel at Stamford Bridge having been a key fixture during Frank Lampard's time at the club.

Aston Villa are ready to spend up to £40million to take Tammy Abraham from Chelsea.The 23-year-old striker has been told he is free to leave Stamford Bridge as he does not feature in Thomas Tuchel’s long-term plans.And that has opened the door for Villa boss Dean Smith, under whom Abraham had a successful loan spell three seasons ago.

Aston Villa are trying to land two former loan players with deals for Tammy Abraham and Axel Tuanzebe.Abraham, 23, helped Villa get promoted to the Premier League three seasons ago before returning to Chelsea to be part of their first-team squad, although will be allowed to leave this summer for £40 million.- subscription required -

NEWCASTLE UNITED have signalled their interest in Billy Gilmour and Tammy Abraham – and will attempt to secure a loan deal if Chelsea agree to make either player available for a temporary move next season. Wolves remain confident their pursuit of Tammy Abraham will not hit any unexpected problems.Nuno Espirito Santo is keen to add the England international, on loan at Aston Villa, to his squad this month.

Martin Odegaard is set for his Arsenal medical today ahead of joining on a loan deal from Real Madrid.The 22-year-old, who flew into London on Sunday, is expected to be confirmed as an Arsenal player later today once he's completed his medical.The deal will see Arsenal pay a £2.5million fee up front and then the midfielder's wages in full for the remainder of the season.

Arsenal are in talks with Real Madrid over re-signing attacking midfielder Martin Odegaard on a permanent deal.It is thought the Norway international, whose contract at the Bernabeu runs until 2023, would cost in the region of £35-40m.

Arsenal are close to agreeing a deal with Real Madrid for the permanent transfer of Martin Odegaard.Although a deal has not yet been finalised, it is understood that Odegaard did not train with the main first-team group at Real on Tuesday, ahead of a possible transfer which is expected to be in the region of €35 million.

Chelsea are in talks with Atletico Madrid over the signing of Saul Niguez on a season-long loan with an option to sign a permanent deal, sources have told ESPN.

Arsenal and Aston Villa have renewed their interest in Norwich star Emiliano Buendia. Both clubs have been making enquiries about the 24-year-old, who has been outstanding during the Canaries promotion campaign.

Aston Villa is delighted to confirm the signing of Emiliano Buendia for a club record transfer fee.The 24-year-old, who has signed a five-year deal with the club, joins from Norwich City after completing his medical and finalising personal terms following Argentina’s World Cup qualifying match with Colombia.

West Ham are in talks with Chelsea over the possibility of signing defender Kurt Zouma.The Hammers are prepared to pay around £20m for the Frenchman, which falls below Chelsea's valuation.

Talks are progressing over a deal which would see Chelsea defender Kurt Zouma move to Premier League rivals West Ham.The clubs are negotiating a deal worth in the region of £25m for the France international, who has not featured in either of Chelsea's Premier League games so far this season.Personal terms between Zouma and West Ham are yet to be finalised.

Aston Villa are lining up a move for Bayer Leverkusen star Leon Bailey.Villa have identified winger Bailey as an attainable target and are preparing an approach to his Bundesliga club.Bailey, who has two years left on his current deal and is capable of playing on both flanks, is valued at between £25m-£30m.

Manchester City are set to re-sign left-back Angelino from PSV, Sky Sports News understands.The 22-year-old is expected to complete a medical by Thursday evening, just one year after leaving the Etihad.

Manchester City are delighted to announce the resigning of Angelino from PSV Eindhoven, who will join subject to international clearance.The 22-year-old defender has signed a four-year contract, which keeps him at the Club until the summer of 2023.

Tottenham are in advanced negotiations to sign Cristian Romero and Pierluigi Gollini from Atalanta, football.london understands. 1PSL Standings |PSL MatchesTOURNAMENTSNEWSAF ZambiaPATSON DAKA HEADING TO LEICESTER CITYPatson Daka heading to Leicester CityPatson Daka of Zambiaby Staff ReporterFriday Jun 18, 2021. 08:32Chipolopolo striker Patson Daka is moving to English Premiership club Leicester City.Sources familiar with the development have indicated that Daka’s club RB Salzburg have accepted the 2015/2016 English champions offer and that the deal is set to be concluded at the start of next week.The 22-year-old striker was in red-hot form for RB Salzburg in the 2020/2021 season scoring 34 competitive goals.Twenty seven of those goals came in the league that saw Salzburg retain the Austrian Bundesliga title for an eighth successive timeLeicester has snapped up Daka following reported summer interest from their Premiership rivals Liverpool, West Ham and Chelsea.

Leicester City look to be closing in on a move for a striker. It is reported that the deal is close with City having had a bid accepted for the 22-year-old and personal terms agreed.Reports in Austria now claim that the player missed pre-season training with Salzburg as he closes in on a move to the King Power Stadium. It is said that Daka will cost City a fee of around £23 million, with the Foxes beating off competition from the likes of Liverpool and West Ham United for his services.

Red Bull Salzburg striker Patson Daka has told Austrian media he is on the verge of completing a £23m move to Leicester City.Daka has now been quoted in Krone Zeitung as saying: "I will go to England and move to Leicester City."I had a great time here, Salzburg has become my second home. I will always be happy to come back here, but the Premier League has always been my big dream."
Leicester City Football Club can confirm that exciting young striker Patson Daka will join the Club on a five-year-deal from 1 July, subject to Premier League and international clearance.

The Red Bull Salzburg striker has been linked with a move to Anfield, as well as Premier League outfit West Ham.Reports over the past few days have suggested that the striker is close to joining Liverpool, becoming their second signing of the summer after Ibrahima Konate from RB Leipzig.As claimed by Todofichajes over the weekend, Daka could become a Liverpool player “in the coming days”.The 22-year-old has been in fine form for Salzburg this season, filling the shoes of Erling Haaland and scoring 34 goals and providing 12 assists in all competitions.

Patson Daka will be announced as a Liverpool player this week, according to the Zambian Observer.The 22-year-old's name features on many shortlists this summer following a brilliant year at Red Bull Salzburg, with report from Spain last week claiming the forward was set to sign for Liverpool.The Reds have already agreed a deal to sign Ibrahima Konate from RB Leipzig, and reports last week claimed Daka could join the defender at Anfield this summer.But the Zambian Observer is reporting that the forward "is set to be announced” as a Liverpool player this week.
„Leicester are planning to announce new signings soon. Official bid made to sign Patson Daka from RB Salzburg.”
„Patson Daka is set to join Leicester, done deal.“

AC Milan will exercise the option to sign Chelsea defender Fikayo Tomori on a permanent deal this summer for £25m.Tomori, 23, joined AC Milan on an initial six-month loan in January and helped the club secure a second-placed finish and a return to the Champions League after a seven-year absence.Milan held talks with Chelsea in recent days in an attempt to lower the agreed £25m fee but the Premier League club refused, according to Sky in Italy.

Fikayo Tomori will complete a permanent transfer from Chelsea to AC Milan on 1 July.The defender spent the second half of last season on loan with Milan, but will make that move permanent next month after a deal was agreed between the two clubs.
(...)Lampard has been told that he needs to raise funds by moving one of his four centre-backs. Fikayo Tomori has been targeted by Rennes on loan (...)

Chelsea defender Fikayo Tomori is set to join French club Rennes on loan until the end of the season, talkSPORT understands.Following a breakthrough season at Stamford Bridge, the 22-year-old’s career has stalled during the 2020/21 campaign.

Everton are exploring moves for Southampton's Mario Lemina and Chelsea's Fikayo Tomori, Sky Sports News understands.[...]Everton are also in the market for a centre-back. Their first choice would be to re-sign Kurt Zouma but, with the deal stalling, they are considering England Under-21 international Tomori instead.

Meanwhile, Chelsea defender Fikayo Tomori is close to joining Everton on a season-long loan, sources have told ESPN.The 22-year-old has attracted interest from a number of clubs including Rennes and Newcastle but Everton are thought to be in pole position with talks at an advanced stage.Tomori initially enjoyed an impressive breakthrough spell last season after spending the previous year on loan at Derby County under Lampard.

Leicester City have opened talks with Lille over a proposed £21million deal for midfielder Boubakary Soumare.Sportsmail reported Leicester’s interest earlier this year and they are looking to tie up a deal ahead of competition.

Leicester City are close to reaching a deal with Ligue 1 champions Lille for 22-year-old midfielder Boubakary Soumare, for a fee which could rise to £18m.Soumare is keen on a move to Leicester, and has been encouraged by his international team-mate Wesley Fofana, who moved to the King Power Stadium in October.

Leicester City’s deal for midfielder Boubakary Soumare could be completed sooner than anticipated after France Under-21s were knocked out of the Euros. (...)Reports from France suggest a fee of around £18m to £20m has already been agreed, with terms on a five-year contract also tied up, but it was understood that the final details of any transfer would not be wrapped up until after Soumare’s international involvement had concluded.

Leicester City is delighted to confirm the signing of midfielder Boubakary Soumaré from Ligue 1 champions Lille for an undisclosed fee, subject to Premier League and international clearance.The 22-year-old Frenchman has signed a five-year-deal and will join up with his new Foxes teammates for the start of pre-season later this month.
Liverpool have reportedly made contact with the representatives of Lille midfielder Boubakary Soumare, a transfer target of Manchester United.

Date: 29/05, 2021Reported Everton target Merih Demiral intends to leave Juventus this summer in search of more regular football, according to a new report.La Gazzetta dello Sport report that Demiral could be subject to ‘good offers’ from abroad this summer, with the 23-year old wanting a move to a club that would feature him more prominently.He (Demiral) has found it difficult to break through at Juventus though, an elite team with an experienced backline full of quality and depth.Though Everton also have depth in the centre-back position they aren’t so flush with talent, with numerous reports speculating that the club have an interest in bolstering their options in that position this summer.At just 23-years old, Demiral fits the profile of the type of player that Marcel Brands is interested in pursuing this summer, while he would bring with him much desired Champions League experience.

TOTTENHAM are ready to join rivals Arsenal and Manchester United in the race for Juventus defender Merih Demiral.The Turkish central defender could become Jose Mourinho's first signings as Spurs boss, after club officials contacted the player's agent about a move.
Juventus centre-back Merih Demiral is interesting both Arsenal and Manchester United, with both clubs keeping tabs on the player ahead of a possible bid in January.

English Premier League outfits Arsenal and Manchester United are ready to rival Italian Serie A giants AC Milan for a possible signing of league rivals Juventus’ highly-rated centre-back Merih Demiral in the January transfer window, as per Tuttosport cited by Calciomercato.com.

AC Milan remain interested in Juventus defender Merih Demiral but face competition from two clubs, according to a report.The Rossoneri are expected to be active in the January transfer window after a dismal start to the season which has seen them lose seven of their first 12 games.Finding a consistent partner for Alessio Romagnoli has been a problem, and La Gazzetta dello Sport (via Calciomercato.com) reported last month that a new centre-back could be purchased if Mattia Caldara’s return to the fold does not go to plan after his long-term injury.
Barcelona have opened talks with Wolves over a deal to re-sign Spain winger Adama Traore.The Catalan club want an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy at the end of the season.

Adama Traore is undergoing a medical at Barcelona before finalising a loan transfer from Wolves.The LaLiga giants hold a purchase option worth around £30million should he impress at the Camp Nou in the second half of the campaign.On Friday afternoon, Traore was spotted entering Barcelona’s training ground for his medical.

FC Barcelona and Wolverhampton Wanderers have reached an agreement for the loan of the player Adama Traoré until 30 June 2022. The blaugranes will pay the player's wages and there is an option to make the deal permanent.

Tottenham are preparing a bid for Adama Traore, with Wolves ready to listen to offers for the winger if he does not sign a new contract before the transfer window closes.It is thought Spurs could attempt to loan Traore for the coming season with a view to a permanent deal worth around £40million next summer.

Tottenham Hotspur have accelerated talks over trying to take Adama Traore on loan for the rest of the season with a view to a permanent move worth up to £40million.New Spurs head coach Nuno Espirito Santo is a huge fan of Traore and wants the Spain international to follow him from Wolverhampton Wanderers to north London.Wolves value Traore at £40m, but, with the Spain international yet to extend his contract that has two years to run, the club may be forced to consider a loan deal that includes an obligation to buy.

Tottenham’s Hotspur’s bid to sign Adama Traoré has suffered a blow with Wolverhampton Wanderers standing firm in their desire to keep the winger.Spurs have targeted Traoré after accelerating talks this week and had hoped to structure a loan deal with a view to a permanent move.
Tottenham are expected to make a firm bid for Wolves winger Adama Traore during the current transfer window.The Londoners tried to sign Traore in the summer but were unable to complete the deal.

Wolverhampton Wanderers have rejected a £15m bid from Tottenham for winger Adama Traore.Spurs boss Antonio Conte is keen on the 25-year-old Spain international, who has 18 months left on his contract at Molineux.

Adama Traore looks likely to depart Molineux this month with Wolves and Tottenham edging closer to agreeing a deal.The 25-year-old's contract expires in 18 months and it’s believed he has no intention of signing fresh terms.Wolves rejected a bid of £15 million from Spurs earlier this week. However, it’s thought their asking price is around £20 million and with the two clubs not far apart there’s an expectation among senior figures at Wolves that an agreement will be reached.
Tottenham Hotspur are closing in on a £20m deal for Wolverhampton Wanderers winger Adama Traore.

West Ham have made a “concrete” move to sign Wolves star man Adama Traore, Football Insider can exclusively reveal.The Hammers are interested in the Spain international, 25, as they look to strengthen their attacking options this month

[...]Sources have told ESPN that, with three years left to run on his Wolves contract, Traore would remain at Molineux next season if the club can clinch a Champions League spot either through the Premier League or by winning the Europa League.

Liverpool are moving for Wolves’ Adama Traore.The champions-elect have enquired about the 24-year-old Spaniard, who has made a huge impact at Molineux this season.

Bryan Gil arrived in Valencia on Monday to undergo his medical after agreeing a loan switch from Tottenham.On Monday lunchtime, he began his medical for a loan move until the summer. Reports in Spain indicate that Valencia will not pay a fee for his temporary switch, but they will have to hand over bonuses if certain objectives are triggered.
Valencia CF have reached an agreement with Tottenham Hotspur for the signing of winger Bryan Gil on loan until the end of the season.

Tottenham are close to finalising a swap deal with Sevilla that will see them sign winger Bryan Gil and Erik Lamela move to Spain.Along with allowing Lamela to join Sevilla, Spurs will also pay the La Liga side £21.6m for Gil, according to Sky in Italy.

Arsenal have been given the green light to sign Denis Zakaria after Borussia Monchengladbach sporting director Max Eberl admitted he wants to leave the club this summer.

The 25-year-old Swiss midfielder’s contract expires with Borussia Monchengladbach at the end of this season and a number of clubs around Europe are interested in signing him on a free transfer, including the Giallorossi, but the Bianconeri want to beat out their competition with an immediate move.As reported by La Gazzetta dello Sport, Juventus want to sign Zakaria in this month’s transfer window, paying compensation to the Bundesliga side in order to avoid competing for his signature in the summer.

Juventus are prepared to complete Denis Zakaria signing once they’ll agree on final fee for Rodrigo Bentancur to Tottenham.Zakaria’s waiting, ready to sign with Juventus - €5m plus add ons to ‘Gladbach on the table.

Denis Zakaria to Juventus, done deal and here we go! Agreement reached for €5m fee plus add ons to Borussia Moenchengladbach. Contract agreed until June 2026. He’s prepared to fly to Turin in the next hours with his agents - he replaces Bentancur who joins Spurs.

Manchester United are one of several clubs interested in Verona defender Marash Kumbulla.Kumbulla has been a regular for Verona this season, helping them to have the fifth-best defensive record in the league with just 20 goals conceded so far.

Tottenham are rivalling Aston Villa for Juventus midfielder Rodrigo Bentancur after Villa had a £20.5m bid rejected for the Uruguayan, according to Sky in Italy.But Tottenham are also now interested in the Uruguayan, although the north London side are looking at a loan deal, which the Serie A side are not keen on.

Tottenham are set to complete the double signing of Juventus pair Dejan Kulusevski and Rodrigo Bentancur as part of a frantic deadline day in north London.Bentancur was also signed for Juve by Paratici, and Spurs have agreed a deal for the 24-year-old worth £15m up front and a further £4m due in potential add-ons.

Aston Villa are submitting a Tuesday night bid for Juventus midfielder Rodrigo Bentancur, Football Insider understands.The Premier League big spenders have made a formal move for the 24-year-old after opening talks over a late-window deal.A Villa source has told Football Insider that the offer for Bentancur is around the £18million mark.

Aston Villa are closing in on the transfer of Juventus midfielder Rodrigo Bentancur but there is still work to be done to complete the deal.Villa have identified Bentancur as their preferred option to add depth to their midfield ranks having seen a reported £25million bid for Brighton star Yves Bissouma tuned down earlier this month.

Aston Villa have had a €25m (£20.8m) bid for the midfielder Rodrigo Bentancur turned down by Juventus. They were offering a guaranteed €20m with the rest in add-ons but the Italian club are demanding more because of a sell-on clause with Bentancur’s previous club, Boca Juniors.

Chelsea are interested in signing Lille goalkeeper Mike Maignan.The 25-year-old is seen as a credible candidate to challenge Kepa Arrizabalaga for the number one position at Stamford Bridge.However, Chelsea are yet to make an official bid for the player.

Manchester United have been quoted a transfer fee of €35million for Lille goalkeeper Mike Maignan.Maignan was named goalkeeper of the year by the French professional footballers union following a Ligue 1 campaign in which he kept 15 clean sheets as Lille finished second to Paris Saint-Germain. Real Betis have opened negotiations to sign Arsenal full-back Hector Bellerin on a season-long loan arrangement.The Spaniard has two years of his deal at the Gunners remaining but it is likely that he will be moved on this summer as part of a squad rejuvenation in North London.

Arsenal right-back Hector Bellerin will leave the club on deadline day to join Spanish side Real Betis.The 26-year-old has been pushing for a move away from Arsenal all summer and had seem himself linked to the likes of Barcelona and Inter, only for both sides to fail to convince the Gunners to let him go.

Inter Milan are planning a summer raid on Arsenal for defender Hector Bellerin. Inter Milan are interested in signing Arsenal's Hector Bellerin, Sky in Italy are reporting.The Serie A champions want the Spanish right-back on loan with an option to buy him next summer.Arsenal value Bellerin in the region of £17m (€20m).

Hector Bellerin has yet to agree personal terms with any team but Inter Milan are now considered the favourites to sign the Spaniard, football.london understands.The Arsenal defender wants to leave the club this summer and his representative is currently speaking with a number of teams in Italy and Spain, with Inter the frontrunners to land him right now.

Everton want to sign Manchester United midfielder Donny van de Beek on loan before Monday’s transfer deadline.The Athletic understands that the 24-year-old has been discussed with the club’s managerial targets and has emerged Everton’s top priority this window.

Donny van de Beek is undergoing a medical in Liverpool ahead of his loan move to Everton from Manchester United.The Netherlands international's wages will be paid in full by the Toffees, who will not have an option to make his move permanent.
Donny van de Beek has joined Everton on loan from Manchester United for the remainder of the 2021/22 season.

Crystal Palace are interested in signing Manchester United midfielder Donny van de Beek on loan until the end of the season.Talks between both parties are ongoing but the player is known to want regular game time.

Talks continuing today.No option or obligation to sign permanently.Patrick Vieira wants more experience in his side for the second half of the season.Vieira hoping to convince Van de Beek Palace is a good move for him with guaranteed first team football.

Manchester United have renewed their interest in Donny van de Beek and are weighing up a bid to snatch Ajax’s young midfield talent ahead of Real Madrid.Van de Beek, 23, has agreed the outline of a deal to join the Spanish giants for €55 million (about £49 million) but the financial crisis in La Liga caused by Covid-19 has left him uncertain whether Real can execute the transfer this summer, creating an opportunity United are considering exploiting.- subscription required -

Manchester United are favourites to land Ajax midfielder Donny van de Beek, sources have told ESPN.The 23-year-old has featured for Ajax in preseason but was left out of their squad for a friendly with Eintracht Frankfurt on Saturday.

Manchester United are hopeful of signing Donny van de Beek from Ajax as the race for the Netherlands midfielder nears completion.It is understood that United are in touch with his agents and believe they have a good chance of concluding a deal with Ajax given their strong links to the Eredivisie champions thanks to the former goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar, who is Ajax’s chief executive.

Manchester United are closing in on the signing of Ajax midfielder Donny van de Beek after the two clubs agreed a fee in the region of £40m.It is understood United have now firmed up their interest with a medical and personal terms still to be concluded.

Manchester United agree £35.7m fee to sign Donny van de Beek from AjaxManchester United have reached an agreement with Ajax for Donny van de Beek. The fee is £35.7m (€40m) plus add ons, with personal terms agreed with the Netherlands midfielder on a deal until 2025.
Donny van de Beek has completed a medical in the Netherlands ahead of his £40m move from Ajax to Manchester United.
Manchester United is delighted to confirm the arrival of Donny van de Beek from Ajax. The Dutch midfielder has signed a five-year contract, with an option to extend for a further year.

Donny van de Beek could find himself back at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium next season after dismaying Spurs fans with his goal in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final last week.The Ajax player is being monitored by Tottenham as a potential replacement for Christian Eriksen, though they will have to compete with Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund, who are also chasing the attacking midfielder.

Tottenham have already begun planning for life without Christian Eriksen, and are said to be targeting a player who caused them a number of problems in their last Champions League match.It is rumoured that Donny van de Beek, who has impressed for Ajax all season, is top of their wishlist, with the Spurs hierarchy particularly impressed with the 22-year-old's performance during the Dutch club's 1-0 win over Tottenham last month.

while Crystal Palace are progressing in talks with United since Wednesday, Everton have now entered in the race to sign van de Beek. #EFC
