Everton and Tottenham are in talks about a permanent deal for midfielder Dele Alli that could reach £40m.Those discussions involve Spurs chairman Daniel Levy and the north London club's managing director of football Fabio Paratici.
Everton have completed the signing of midfielder Dele Alli from Tottenham Hotspur on a two-and-a-half-year contract until the end of June 2024.

West Ham fans are all saying the same thing about links with Tottenham midfielder Deli Alli.West Ham fans have taken to Twitter in reaction to claims that David Moyes allegedly wants to sign Tottenham midfielder Deli Alli in January.A move to sign Tottenham man Dele Alli would be a strange one, however.Firstly, the West Ham boss should be prioritising moves to sign a top-class striker and an established centre back.And attacking midfielder is needed as well but should in no way be our priority.Tottenham ace Alli has been incredibly poor over the past two years. It seems as though his hunger to improve, work-rate and desire have completely dissipated.On face value, the 37-capped England international, 25, isn’t a David Moyes type player whatsoever.

Marcelo Bielsa is planning a £20million swoop for Stuttgart striker Nicolas Gonzalez.Argentina international Gonzalez is rated as one of the hottest young properties around after plundering 14 goals in 27 outings to power the German outfit to promotion back to the Bundesliga this season.

Leeds United interest in Nicolás González was 'very serious' says Stuttgart's sporting director who claims move is currently unlikelyBut at no point did the German club come close to selling, he claims, and at present the player appears likely to stay at the Mercedes-Benz Arena.
Leeds and Brighton have expressed an interest in signing Nicolás González from Stuttgart, with the Argentina forward expected to cost at least £15m.

Albion target Enock Mwepu was left out of his club’s latest pre-season friendly ahead of a possible move.The Zambian midfielder was released from the club’s training camp and a friendly versus Monaco.The Seagulls have a confirmed interest in the Red Bull Salzburg star.

Crystal Palace are closing on a £20million deal for Lyon defender Joachim Andersen and remain in talks over a deal for Schalke's Ozan Kabak.Palace are hopeful of concluding a deal for Denmark international Andersen, 25, this week. The centre-back was on loan at Fulham last season.

rystal Palace are close to completing the signing of Lyon defender Joachim Andersen as Patrick Vieira continues to rebuild the squad in south London.Standard Sport understands Andersen, who was also a target for London rivals Tottenham this summer, will cost an initial €22million, with €5million in add-ons to follow.

Crystal Palace have completed the signing of Denmark international defender Joachim Andersen on a five-year deal.The 25-year-old centre-back joins Palace from Lyon after a competing in the Euro 2020 semi-final this summer.

Tottenham are keen on signing Lyon defender Joachim Andersen in the summer.The Denmark international has impressed in the Premier League this season on loan at Fulham, and will return to his parent club in June.However, he could be on the move again if Spurs meet Lyon's valuation of around £20m.

Spurs are also front-runners to sign Vestergaard's £25m-rated international team-mate Joachim Andersen from Lyon. He spent last season on loan at Fulham, catching Spurs' eye, but new manager Nuno Espirito Santo is set to make the final call on whether to sanction his signing.

Tottenham are tracking Sampdoria centre-half Joachim Andersen.The 23-year-old Dane is among the possible replacements for Toby Alderweireld if the Belgian's £25million release clause is triggered by a rival club this summer.

Arsenal have submitted a €42 million (£37m) offer to sign Sampdoria duo Dennis Praet and Joachim Andersen, according to reports in Italy.Unai Emery has been given a restricted budget of around £40m to work with in the summer transfer window after missing out on a place in next season’s Champions League.

Leicester are trying to sign Francisco Trincão from Barcelona and have offered to take the forward on loan for two seasons with an obligation to buy for £45m (€50m).The 20-year-old is one of Portugal’s most highly regarded young players and in January Barcelona secured a €31m deal with Braga under which Trincão would move to the Camp Nou this summer.The initial joining date of 1 July was pushed back when the Portuguese season was extended because of the Covid-19 pandemic and Trincão played his final game for Braga on 27 July.

Tottenham midfielder Giovani Lo Celso is set to join Villarreal on loan, talkSPORT understands. The Argentinian has struggled for game time this season and Antonio Conte has made the decision to let him temporarily leave the club.

Giovani Lo Celso wants to move to Tottenham this summer and join up with Mauricio Pochettino, Sky Sports News has been told.The Argentine is keen to move to the Premier League and is hoping current club Real Betis will allow him to leave.Spurs remain in talks with Betis and are hopeful of concluding a deal for the attacking midfielder, Sky Sports News understands.

Tottenham are set to make an improved transfer offer for Giovani Lo Celso.Spurs launched an initial bid for the midfielder of up to £53m but that was rejected by Real Betis.The Spanish club are holding out for the full £88.9m release clause in the Argentina midfielder’s contract.

Tottenham have put negotiations for Real Betis midfielder Giovani Lo Celso on hold for now with the two clubs unable to agree on a fee, Sky Sports News understands.The 23-year-old Argentina international, who has an £88m release clause, is keen to work under Mauricio Pochettino at Spurs.

Spurs are set to smash their transfer record for a second time this summer as they finally step up their interest in £70million-rated midfielder Giovani Lo Celso.The 23-year-old Real Betis midfielder wants to move to north London and has indicated as much to his club.

Argentinian midfielder Giovani Lo Celso has posted an image to his official Instagram account in which he appears to be saying goodbye to his coach.Tottenham Hotspur have been heavily-linked with the 23-year-old and hope to wrap up his signing before the close of the transfer window.

Manchester City are monitoring Giovani Lo Celso's situation this summer with the midfielder primed for a move away from Real Betis.MEN Sport understands that City boss Pep Guardiola will assess the 23-year-old's performances for Argentina at this summer's Copa America, as Tottenham and Atlético Madrid also vie for his services.

Japan international Takehiro Tomiyasu has joined us from Serie A side Bologna on a long-term contract.
Tottenham are in talks to sign Bologna’s Japanese international defender Takehiro Tomiyasu.The versatile 22-year old can play at right back or central defence and has over 20 caps for his country.

New Tottenham head coach Nuno Espirito Santo is keen to bolster his defence after taking over in north London.Spurs are in talks with Bologna over a deal for Japan international Takehiro Tomiyasu.The 22-year-old can play centre-back or right-back, two problem positions for Spurs over the past year, and has been on the radar of a number of Premier League clubs.

Tottenham have had an offer rejected by Bologna for defender Takehiro Tomiyasu.Spurs offered £12.9m (€15m) plus an extra £2.6m (€3m) in add-ons in a bid with a total value of £15.5m (€18m).However, the offer is close to the Serie A club's valuation of at least £17.2m (€20m), and talks remain ongoing over a deal for the defender.

Tottenham are closing in on the signing of Bologna defender Takehiro Tomiyasu, The Athletic understands. The two clubs are finalising the terms of the deal, with the fee expected to be in the region of £15 million plus add-ons.

Brighton are poised to complete the capture of Getafe left-back Marc Cucurella.The Athletic understands that the Premier League side have matched the £15 million release clause in Cucurella's contract.The 23-year-old is flying to England later today to finalise the formalities. An announcement is likely tomorrow, on the final day of the transfer window.
Brighton & Hove Albion are delighted to confirm the signing of Marc Cucurella from Getafe on a contract until June 2026, for undisclosed terms and subject to international clearance.

Chelsea are reportedly positioning themselves to sign Marc Cucurella and have identified the Spaniard as their second choice left-back option if they fail to land Ben Chilwell this summer. Blues manager Frank Lampard is planning a squad overhaul this summer and is in the market for defensive reinforcements as he looks to address his side's vulnerability at the back

As Aaron Cresswell begins to approach his thirties, the young ​Barcelona defender would provide competition for the Englishman. Cucurella has impressed on loan at Getafe this season, and can also provide an option at left-midfield.

Getafe full-back Marc Cucurella has emerged as a transfer target for Chelsea this summer, according to a report in Diario Sport.The player will be available for €25m this summer – a price that significantly undercuts the valuations of other Blues targets Alex Telles (€40m) of FC Porto and Leicester’s Ben Chilwell (€90m).

Burnley pushing to seal £12m deal for Wolfsburg striker Wout Weghorst.The 6ft6' Weghorst, 29, wants to come to the Premier League and Burnley are trying to agree a deal with Wolfsburg after it initially broke down last week. The Turf Moor side are looking to seal a £12million plus add-ons deal prior to Monday's 11pm January transfer deadline.
Burnley have reached full agreement with Wolfsburg for Dutch striker Wout Weghorst. Fee will be around €15m add ons included, personal terms agreed too.
Wout Weghorst is due to undergo a medical today ahead of a £12m move to Burnley.Sean Dyche is on the verge of bolstering his frontline by sealing a deal for Dutch international striker Weghorst.
After three and a half years with VfL Wolfsburg, Dutchman Wout Weghorst has completed a dream move to the Premier League by joining Burnley – who are currently bottom of England’s top flight.

Enjoying a very good season with Wolfsburg in Germany, Wout Weghorst has naturally caught the eye of a few scouts around Europe.With a big frame at nearly 6’5″ and an eye for goal, a few suitors from the Premier League have been linked, with the likes of Tottenham, Chelsea and now West Ham all reportedly keen in the Dutchman.The 28-year-old has found the back of the 20 times in 34 league games this season, and, following the Hammers’ inability to replace Sébastien Haller in January, makes a whole lot of sense for David Moyes’ side.It’s stated the Hammers ‘like’ the player, which isn’t at all surprising, but the biggest hurdle the London side will need to overcome is the fact they won’t be playing in the Champions League.Wolfsburg, on the other hand, will, and it could very well be that Weghorst will want to play in the elite European competition going forward.

Arsenal and Newcastle will lock horns in a battle to land towering Dutch striker Wout Weghorst, according to reports.The 6ft 5inch frontman is braced to leave Wolfsburg after scoring 16 goals in 32 Bundesliga appearances.With a contract until 2023, Wolfsburg will look in the region of £32million to let him leave.Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta is looking to bolster his strikeforce particularly with Alexandre Lacazette and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang expected to leave.Weghorst's physicality would appear suited to the Premier League and he has previously hinted at his desire to play in England.Six months ago he said: "I always said that England and Germany have the best leagues."

Wolfsburg striker Wout Weghorst admits he is flattered by speculation linking him with a summer move to Arsenal.Responding to Arsenal's reported interest, Weghorst said: "That would be nice, wouldn't it. That would be a good thing, of course that fits in the perfect picture.""In the end, of course, I also made a clear career plan, mapped out a plan. But you always have to see how it goes."Any potential move for Weghorst is likely to hinge on the future of club captain and this season's top goalscorer Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Newcastle United and Arsenal are among a number of Premier League clubs interested in signing Wolfsburg's Dutch striker Wout Weghorst, 27, for 35m euros (£31.9m). (Bild - in German)

Arsenal are in talks with Serie A side Torino over a loan deal for midfielder Lucas Torreira with a view to a permanent move.The two clubs are discussing a season-long loan for the Uruguay midfielder with an option to make it permanent next summer.

Lucas Torreira could be interested in joining AC Milan, the Arsenal midfielder's agent has hinted.Torreira is reportedly of interest to Milan after a season away from Serie A and have made the player a key transfer target.

Back in Italy, a year later. Lucas Torreira could return to play in Serie A, twelve months after his farewell from Sampdoria for London and the Premier League. AC Milan are preparing a bid to sign Arsenal midfielder Lucas Torreira on loan, with a view to a permanent transfer.The Serie A club will make an offer in the region of £4.5m for a two-season loan, with an additional fee of around £25m to make the Uruguayan's move permanent at the end of that period.

FC Barcelona and Eric Garcia have reached an agreement for the player to join the Club from 1 July one his contract with Manchester City is at an end. The player will sign a contract until the end of the 2025/26 season and his buy out clause is set at 400 million euros.

Manchester United are interested in signing Jeremie Boga this summer and have made contact with the former Chelsea midfielder over a deal, according to reports.It appears unlikely... Ed Woodward will sanction a Manchester United transfer offer (for Jadon Sancho) in that region in the post-coronavirus landscape, meaning the club have identified cheaper alternatives.Among them, according to ESPN FC, is Ivory Coast international Boga, who left boyhood club Chelsea for Italian outfit Sassuolo in 2018.The Ivorian midfielder is enjoying a producitve spell at Sassuolo, scoring 11 goals in 54 Serie A matches, but is desperate to play in either the Champions League or Europa League next season.It is claimed Manchester United... have approached Boga to discuss a move, with the player "interested" in the project at Old Trafford.

Manchester United reportedly look to be in the market for a cheap alternative to Borussia Dortmund star Jadon Sancho, with Sassuolo winger Jeremie Boga seemingly in their sights.According to Stretty News, the former Chelsea youngster can leave his current club for around £25-30million this summer, and that truly could be great value for money for an exciting talent.Boga has shone in Serie A despite struggling to make a first-team breakthrough during his time at Stamford Bridge, and it looks like he may now get a second chance in the Premier League.Stretty News suggest Boga may be a more realistic target for the Red Devils, and fans would surely take him as an upgrade on struggling stars like Jesse Lingard, Juan Mata and Daniel James.

Chelsea is another option. The Blues have an option to buy-back Boga for €20 million. Boga would not mind returning to London. “When I was there, it was Willian, Hazard, Pedro,” Boga said in the interview with The Athletic. “When Mourinho was there, it was Salah. There were a lot of good wingers. For me, it has always been if I can’t play, then I will try to go on loan or try to go somewhere to improve, then maybe come back one day.”
SSC Napoli have expressed interest in US Sassuolo winger Jeremie Boga.

Kieran Trippier has let slip to England colleagues that he is keen to join Manchester United this summer.The 30-year-old right-back won La Liga with Atletico Madrid last season but has told pals in the Three Lions set-up that he is open to a move to Old Trafford.United want Trippier to provide competition for Aaron Wan Bissaka, and believe a fee of between £15million and £20m should be enough to convince Atletico to do business.

Kieran Trippier expects any move to Manchester United to materialise towards the end of the transfer window. Trippier, 30, has entered the last year of his Atletico Madrid contract and wants to join boyhood club United, having arranged for his family to relocate to Manchester.

The England right back also has interest from Everton. Tottenham's England right-back Kieran Trippier is close to completing a £20m move to Spanish side Atletico Madrid.The 28-year-old joined Spurs from Burnley in June 2015 and has played more than 100 times for the club, with his last appearance coming in the Champions League final in June.He later admitted he was not sure he would see out his contract, which was due to expire in 2022.

Newcastle confident of signing Kieran Trippier from Atlético for about £25m. Newcastle United are increasingly confident of signing Kieran Trippier from Atlético Madrid by the end of the week and hope to open formal negotiations with the 31-year-old England right-back within the next 48 hours.

Barcelona are working on finalising the signing of Sergio Aguero on a free transfer this summer, sources have told ESPN.The Spanish giants have offered Aguero a two-year contract and sources have told ESPN that the Argentina international could arrive to the Camp Nou after the Champions League final between Manchester City and Chelsea on May 29.Aguero, who will turn 33 next month, has agreed to considerably reduce his wages and will join as a free agent once his contract with City expires on June 30.

Sergio Agüero has agreed to sign for Barcelona on a two-year contract when his Manchester City deal expires next month. Barcelona are confident of completing the signings of Sergio Aguero and Georginio Wijnaldum on free transfers within the next week.Representatives of both players have been at the Nou Camp in the last few days for advanced discussions on proposed contracts.

FC Barcelona and Sergio ‘Kun’ Agüero have reached an agreement for the player to join the Club from 1 July when his contract with Manchester City expires. The player will sign a contract until the end of the 2022/23 season and his buy out clause is set at 100 million euros.

Arsenal defender William Saliba is set to join Nice on loan until the end of the season.The Ligue 1 club will not have an option to make the move permanent as the Gunners see the 19-year-old as a part of their long-term plans.Arsenal hope Saliba's return to France will provide him with some valuable experience before competing for a first-team place next season.

William Saliba has joined French Ligue 1 side Nice on loan for the remainder of the season.The move is designed to give the 19-year-old French youth international defender the chance for more competitive playing time.Everyone at Arsenal wishes William all the best with Nice.

Arsenal defender William Saliba is attracting interest from Rennes ahead of a late loan move away from Emirates Stadium.[...] The centre-back, however, has not made his debut and now Standard Sport understands Rennes are keen to sign him on loan.Arsenal are now weighing up the early approach as they believe it could be best for the youngster to gain more experience.

Arsenal have been linked with a number of defenders already in the first few days of the summer transfer window.One name that has also stood out has been that of William Saliba.The talented right-footed centre-back starred for Saint Etienne while featuring 16 times during his breakthrough season as he boosted Les Verts to an excellent fourth place in Ligue 1.

Arsenal are in talks to sign Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba.The Gunners are keen to strengthen a back line which conceded 51 goals in the Premier League last season and have identified the 18-year-old as a hugely promising talent for the future.Reports in France suggest Arsenal have already reached a contract agreement with Saliba but it is thought the deal is not in fact that far advanced.

Arsenal are closing in on a deal for Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba.The Ligue 1 club are demanding 30 million euros (£26.5m) and an agreement they will keep the centre-back on loan next season before moving he moves to north London in 2020.

Arsenal are set to sign Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba in a 30m euro (£27m) deal that will see him loaned back to the Ligue 1 club next season.The Gunners will pay for the 18-year-old in instalments, which will not have a major impact on their restricted budget of around £45m for this summer.

The young St-Étienne centre-back William Saliba has decided to join Arsenal despite a late attempt by Tottenham to sign the France Under-20 international.Arsenal agreed a five-year deal with the 18-year-old last week and he looked all set to sign for the Gunners, but late interest from their North London rivals delayed the announcement.

Highly-rated French defender William Saliba is joining us from Ligue 1 club Saint-Etienne on a long-term contract.The much sought after centre half will spend a season back on loan at Saint-Etienne before joining our squad next summer.

ARSENAL face competition from rivals Tottenham in the battle for transfer target William Saliba.[...]However, Tottenham are reportedly trying to swoop in at the 11th hour and steal the youngster from their nearest rivals.RMC report that Mauricio Pochettino's side have contacted Saint-Etienne to inform them of their interest.
Leicester have reportedly offered €20 million for the midfielder. In a different case, they have also inquired about a loan plus purchase deal, like the one Bayern Munich had with Coutinho.

Philippe Coutinho is reportedly the subject of interest from the Premier League as he recovers from a knee injury.Arsenal and Everton are interested in signing Coutinho and are following the course of his injury recovery.This isn't the first time either Arsenal or Everton have followed Coutinho. It remains to be seen whether their interest will translate into a summer move.

The future of Philippe Coutinho has been one of the biggest topics of the summer transfer window but the latest developments suggest this transfer saga is close to finishing, with Arsenal reportedly making a remarkable play for his services.

(...)Coutinho is open to leaving Barcelona this summer after a stop-start first 18 months at the club and Giuliano Bertolucci and Kia Joorabchian are looking at potential suitors and have approached Arsenal to see whether they are interested.However, the Premier League club have told them that at the moment their focus is on securing a central defender. It remains to be seen whether their interest will translate into a summer move.

AS reports that the Blues have made contact with Coutinho's parent club Barcelona and have even held discussions about bringing the Brazilian back to the Premier League.Coutinho is on a season-long loan at Bayern Munich but hasn't impressed, and the Germans are unlikely to take up the €120m option of a permanent deal once the season finally comes to a close. Meanwhile, his future at Barca also remains unclear. Philippe Coutinho warned over Liverpool transfer by Brazil legend
Chelsea are among the clubs monitoring Philippe Coutinho's situation at FC Barcelona as they prepare for life without star man Eden Hazard.
Chelsea are interested in signing Philippe Coutinho from Barcelona if they can avoid a transfer ban this summer, according to reports in Spain.

Philippe Coutinho is the man Chelsea want to replace Eden Hazard — if they can get their transfer ban overturned.The Blues are keen on a deal for Barcelona's former Liverpool star, whether or not manager Maurizio Sarri stays. Perennial Serie A champions Juventus are still keen to bring him home to Italy after just one year to be their new boss.

The Blues are however hoping to win their appeal with the TAS in Lausanne which would allow them to replace the outgoing players starting with Eden Hazard who has already stated his journey with the club is over.To replace Hazard, the Blues are looking to Philippe Coutinho whom Barcelona are currently asking €150 million for.

A pedido do técnico Steven Gerrard, o Aston Villa negocia o empréstimo do meia-atacante brasileiro junto ao Barcelona, e há otimismo para que a transferência seja concluída nos próximos dias.At the request of the coach, Steven Gerrard, Aston Villa is negotiating for the loan of the Brazilian attacking midfielder with Barcelona. There is optimism for the move to be done in the coming days.

„Now he (Philippe Coutinho) has been linked with a Rodgers reunion. Mundo Deportivo claim Barcelona are keen to offload the 29-year-old playmaker from their wage bill and have put Leicester as one of his potential suitors.“„Mundo Deportivo report: ‘One of the teams that is very aware of Coutinho's future is Leicester City and in England they point out that the Foxes could launch themselves for the signing of the Brazilian. Coach Brendan Rodgers worked with Coutinho at Liverpool and would be the main supporter of his incorporation.‘It remains to be seen if Leicester presents a transfer offer for Coutinho - there is talk of about 20 million euros - or if otherwise they ask for a loan deal, as happened with Bayern Munich two seasons ago.‘At Barça they would welcome a departure from Coutinho to reduce the salary mass of the first team, but they hope to be able to take some money to recover part of the investment they made when he was signed from Liverpool.’”

West Ham United are reportedly eyeing up a transfer swoop for Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Alphonse Areola this summer.The French shot-stopper has been on loan at Fulham this season and his long-term future remains uncertain after falling out of favour at PSG.Areola has also had a loan spell at Real Madrid in the past and it would make sense if he finally moved on permanently at the end of this season.West Ham now seem set to try and take advantage by luring him to east London, according to ex-WHU employee.Areola could be an upgrade on Lukasz Fabianski if he can get back to his best with the Hammers, though some fans may question the need to make a new ‘keeper a priority right now.

West Ham are in talks to bring goalkeeper Alphonse Areola back to the Premier League.The French side have bolstered their goalkeeping department this summer by landing Italy’s No.1 Gianluigi Donnarumma on a free and are prepared to move Areola on again.That has alerted West Ham, who are interested in signing Areola on loan with a view to a permanent move and keen to add another senior goalkeeper to their squad. West Ham are in talks with Paris Saint-Germain over signing goalkeeper Alphonse Areola on a season-long loan.The Hammers will also have the option to make the deal for the 28-year-old France international permanent.

West Ham United have completed the loan signing of 2018 FIFA World Cup winner Alphonse Areola from Paris Saint-Germain.The 28-year-old France international joins the Irons on an initial season-long deal, with the option to make the transfer permanent in the summer of 2022.
Fulham are in talks to sign former Real Madrid goalkeeper Alphonse Areola from Paris Saint-Germain on a season-long loan.

Wolves forward Rafa Mir is in the final stages of a move to Spanish giants Atletico Madrid.The 24-year-old has proved to be a misfit since moving to Molineux, making just a handful of appearances in the Black County.

Rafa Mir hasn't yet played a Premier League game for Wolverhampton Wanderers but a spell in the Championship with Hull City could work wonders.Wolverhampton Wanderers are keen to ensure Rafa Mir gets some experience of English football under his belt next season with El Periodico claiming that they have offered Hull City the chance to sign the highly-rated striker.Big things were expected of Mir at Molineux when he joined Wolves from Valencia in the winter of 2018 for around £1.7 million (Superdeporte). Alexander Sorloth to Gent (loan)The Norwegian striker has found his opportunities limited at Palace this season, with the 23-year-old not starting once in the Premier League this season.round match at The Liberty Stadium, Swansea. Tottenham are close to finalising a swap deal with Sevilla that will see them sign winger Bryan Gil and Erik Lamela move to Spain.Along with allowing Lamela to join Sevilla, Spurs will also pay the La Liga side £21.6m for Gil, according to Sky in Italy.

Erik Lamela is counting down the minutes until he makes his move from Tottenham Hotspur to Sevilla.Everything has been agreed between the 29-year-old and the Andalusian club following a meeting this week, with Lamela set to sign a three-year deal which will keep him at the Estadio Ramon Sanchez-Pizjuan until 2024.

Sevilla FC have come to an agreement for the signing of the Argentine winger, Erik Lamela. The player signs for three seasons and joins from Tottenham Hotspur where he spent the previous eight campaigns.

Tottenham Hotspur have been keen on signing the Real Betis ace all summer long.According to a report from the Sun, Tottenham could now offer Erik Lamela to Real Betis as part of a deal to bring Giovani Lo Celso to north London.Spurs have already spent big this summer, signing Tanguy Ndombele from Lyon for a club record fee, whilst also bringing in Jack Clarke from Leeds United, before loaning him back to the west Yorkshire outfit.It appears as though Mauricio Pochettino's business is far from finished, however.

Juan Foyth is going to get some playing time, but it will not be for Tottenham Hotspur this season.According to Fabrizio Romano and Charlie Eccleshare, the Argentine defender is off to sunny Spain on a one year loan with La Liga side Villarreal.Both Romano and Eccleshare are reporting the same details of the loan. There is no word of any triggers that would turn it into an obligation to buy, and given the reporters involved, our guess is that there are none. Villarreal will also pay 100% of Foyth’s wages, though that’s not much of a concern as he’s only on £21,000/week.
Juan Foyth has signed a new contract with the Club until 2023 and joined Spanish side Villarreal on loan for the remainder of the 2020/21 season.
We can confirm that Villarreal has exercised the option to sign Juan Foyth on a permanent basis.

Leeds United are well placed to push for Juan Foyth after his agent revealed his plan to quit Tottenham this summer.This site revealed last week the Londoners are set to listen to offers for the Argentina international defender, 22, in the next transfer window.

Barcelona are keen on Juan Foyth with the Spurs defender available for transfer this summer.The 22-year-old Argentine has appeared only eight times for Jose Mourinho this season before the campaign was suspended because of the coronavirus.

Liverpool have identified Real Betis left-back Junior Firpo as a possible replacement for Alberto Moreno, according to reports.The Reds are short on cover at the back after Moreno left on a free following Liverpool's Champions League win over Tottenham.

Manchester City reportedly face competition from Barcelona for Real Betis defender Junior Firpo.City have been linked with the 22-year-old before, and Pep Guardiola is said to have followed his progress this season 'closely'.

Burnley have made an offer of around £13.5 million for Lyon left-back Maxwel Cornet and have permission to speak to the player.The Athletic understands Burnley have made the best bid for Cornet so far this summer. Burnley have submitted a £15m offer to Lyon for Ivory Coast left-back Maxwel Cornet.Burnley's offer represents a potential club record-equalling transfer, £15m also being the price they paid Middlesbrough for centre-back Ben Gibson in 2018.The Cornet fee would be paid across five instalments, Sky Sports News understands.

Burnley Football Club is pleased to complete the transfer of Ivory Coast international Maxwel Cornet from Olympique Lyonnais.Cornet joins the Clarets from the Ligue 1 club on a five-year deal following completion of a medical.

Newcastle United have had an offer for Dan Burn rejected by Brighton & Hove Albion, The Athletic understands.Eddie Howe, the Newcastle head coach, is desperate to bolster his defence before Monday’s deadline and the club are believed to be pursuing a series of parallel negotiations.

Newcastle are expected to go back in for Brighton defender Dan Burn. The St James' Park club have had an initial offer in the region of £8m rejected for the 29-year-old. Burn is a Newcastle fan and we're told he'd be interested in a potential move back north.

Newcastle United are closing in on a double signing before the close of the January transfer window with deals for Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah and Brighton defender Dan Burn likely to bring an end to their recruitment this month.- subscription required -

Brighton & Hove Albion have rejected Newcastle United's second, improved offer for Dan Burn.Newcastle’s initial offer of around £8 million was rebuffed earlier this week and now a second bid, believed to be around £10 million before add-ons, has also been turned down.
Newcastle United have agreed a £13 million fee for Brighton & Hove Albion defender Dan Burn.

Newcastle United are delighted to confirm the signing of Ashington-born defender Dan Burn from Brighton & Hove Albion for an undisclosed fee.The 29-year-old centre-back arrives at his boyhood club after signing a two-and-a-half-year contract and becomes Eddie Howe's fifth acquisition of the January transfer window.

Leeds are in advanced talks to resign Manchester City winger Jack Harrison on a season-long loan, according to Sky Sources.The 22-year-old scored four goals and made three assists in 37 appearances for Marcelo Bielsa's team in 2018/19.
Leeds United are delighted to announce the signings of Jack Harrison and Ben White, who have both joined the club on season-long loan deals.

[...]Bielsa is desperate to keep Harrison at Elland Road full-time and both clubs have started negotiations with a view to resolving the winger's long-term future.It is understood a fee has been agreed, with Leeds having first option to buy the England hopeful.

Jack Harrison is set to complete his move to Leeds United this week.The Manchester City winger will join the Yorkshire club for a fee that could reach £15million, money which will go into the Blues' transfer kitty for their own plans this summer.

Leeds United are delighted to announce the permanent signing of winger Jack Harrison from Manchester City.Harrison has spent the past three seasons on loan with the Whites, making 128 appearances in all competitions.

Borussia Dortmund midfielder Thomas Delaney is again being linked with a move to England.The experienced Denmark international has long been a target for Premier League clubs.ESPN says Southampton have now expressed interest in taking Delaney off BVB's hands this summer.

Barcelona manager Ernesto Valverde has restricted Carles Aleñá to one appearance this season, which came in the opening day defeat against Athletic Bilbao in August.The 21-year-old’s current situation has caught the attention of Tottenham Hotspur and Real Betis.‘Pochettino to get Aleñá’ is splashed on the front page of Mundo Deportivo as they view him as a replacement for Christian Eriksen, who could leave the club in January.

Getafe are dreaming of bringing Carles Alena to the Coliseum Alfonso Perez in January.The Barcelona midfielder is one of the big names who could be available in the winter transfer window, so it won't be easy for the Madrid side.Alena is set for a Camp Nou exit after featuring very little in the opening weeks of the season.Barcelona are open to letting Alena go on a six-month loan without the option to buy.

Barcelona and Real Madrid are engaged in a transfer battle to land the highly-rated Japanese teenager Takefusa Kubo.'Take' as he is otherwise known, was one of the youngster for whom Barcelona were sanctioned by FIFA for signing underage players.This coming June, he turns 18 and could leave FC Tokyo for a future in Europe at a big club.Barcelona are working on his return but they are not the only ones, with Real Madrid and PSG having made their interest known to the player's agent.

Barcelona and Real Madrid are engaged in a transfer battle to land the highly-rated Japanese teenager Takefusa Kubo.'Take' as he is otherwise known, was one of the youngster for whom Barcelona were sanctioned by FIFA for signing underage players.This coming June, he turns 18 and could leave FC Tokyo for a future in Europe at a big club.Barcelona are working on his return but they are not the only ones, with Real Madrid and PSG having made their interest known to the player's agent.
NEWCASTLE UNITED have made a loan inquiry about Ethan Ampadu, with the Chelsea youngster expected to leave Stamford Bridge in the next two weeks.

Sheffield United are in talks over a season-long loan for Chelsea defender Ethan Ampadu.The 19-year-old Wales international has returned from a six-month loan spell at RB Leipzig and may be allowed to leave Stamford Bridge again in the hunt for more first-team experience.

United have made a third signing of the day, with Chris Wilder adding a versatile Welsh international to his squad.Chelsea's Ethan Ampadu, who can play in a number or defensive and midfield roles, arrives at Bramall Lane on a season-long loan deal
Chelsea youngster Ethan Ampadu has undergone a medical ahead of a potential loan move to Bundesliga side RB Leipzig, according to Sky in Germany.
Ethan Ampadu becomes the fourth summer signing for RB Leipzig. The 18-year-old Welshman arrives on a one-year loan from Premier League side Chelsea FC and will wear the number 26 shirt.
Frank Lampard has confirmed that Ethan Ampadu is set to spend the season on loan after not travelling with the Chelsea squad for their tour of Japan.

Aston Villa are interested in signing Ethan Ampadu on a season-long loan from Chelsea if the 18-year-old becomes available this summer. Ampadu, who played more for his country than his club last season, is set to be targeted by Villa should Chelsea decide that the Wales international would benefit from playing regular first-team football elsewhere for a year.

Barcelona are close to reaching an agreement with Arsenal to sign striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang on loan for the rest of the season.Progress has been made in talks between all three parties and although the deal is not yet done, it has advanced significantly over the weekend.The main issue left to resolve is the payment of Aubameyang’s roughly £350,000-a-week salary and who covers what proportion of that income.

Barcelona are in advanced talks with Arsenal over the loan signing of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.The two clubs have not agreed the deal yet, but there is increased confidence it can be completed before the transfer window closes on Monday night.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang arrived in Catalonia on Monday morning and is expected to sign a contract at Barcelona in the next few hours.The two parties have already reached an agreement and Barcelona have found a formula to sign the Arsenal striker on loan, regardless of whether Ousmane Dembele leaves the club in this window or stays until the summer.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's proposed loan move to Barcelona from Arsenal is in major doubt after talks broke down over the financial part of the deal.Aubameyang flew to Barcelona to visit family and did not have meetings with club officials.Discussions between the clubs had centred around the percentage of Aubameyang's wages Barcelona would pay.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang will have a medical at Barcelona after the club agreed a free-transfer signing from Arsenal.

FC Barcelona and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang have reached an agreement for the player to join the Club after the striker terminated his contract with Arsenal FC. The play will sign a contract until 30 June 2025 with an option to agree departure on 30 June 2023 and his buy out clause will be set at 100 million euros.

Saudi Arabian side Al-Nassr have made an offer to take Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang on loan.Aubameyang has not played for the Gunners since 6 December and was stripped of the club captaincy after a disciplinary breach the following week.

Arsenal are already considering transferring him to another team before his value drops. Barcelona and Juventus have already expressed their interest. According to information from England, the "bianconeri" are already ready to submit an official proposal for the 32-year-old.
British media reports that Saudi Arabia's Al Nasr are seeking a loan deal for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.

Emerson Palmieri, out of favour at left-back, is a target for Internazionale and Lampard has been told that he will need to sell one of his four centre-backs before buying one.

Alessandro Florenzi has decided to leave Roma in January. Italy manager Roberto Mancini was clear with the full-back, if he wants a spot in the squad for the Euros next summer, then he needs to play continuously for the rest of this season.Furthermore, as we have learned, Roma manager Paulo Fonseca has already let the player know that he isn't the first choice as a full-back, nor as a winger. Tottenham are considering Napoli's Elseid Hysaj as they explore potential new right-back options following an injury to Juan Foyth, Sky Sports News understands.

Chelsea want £45m Elseid Hysaj in January window [...]Sarri does not see Zappacosta as part of his long-term plans and wants Chelsea to buy Elseid Hysaj from his former club Napoli to be his replacement.Hysaj has refused to sign a new contract at Napoli, providing hope that he can be lured to Stamford Bridge.However, Napoli value Hysaj at £45m and president Aurelio de Laurentiis will make it hard for Chelsea to acquire the Albania international because he was upset over the way Sarri left the club last summer.
Maurizio Sarri wants the Chelsea board to back him by bringing in another of his former players — £45million-rated Napoli right-back Elseid Hysaj.

A deal has been agreed to with the agents of Elsed Hysaj and Valencia on a contract. The Napoli right-back therefore is in agreement with the Spanish club, while now a deal with the partenopei must be reached: the basis is a loan with fee plus option to buy (which can become a forced option if conditions are met).

Elseid Hysaj is the chosen man for Atletico Madrid to take the place of Juanfran. Although Maurizio Sarri wants to bring him into Chelsea, his likely departure to Juventus has allowed him to go to the Wanda Metropolitano.

Southampton are close to finalising a deal for Brest left-back Romain Perraud. (...)Express Sport understands Southampton are now close to signing Perraud with talks now advanced.Discussions over the finer details which include bonuses and add-ons are well underway.

Southampton Football Club is delighted to announce it has completed the signing of defender Romain Perraud from Stade Brest.The 23-year-old French left-back has signed a four-year contract at St Mary’s, becoming the first addition of the summer to manager Ralph Hasenhüttl’s squad.
AC Milan are ready to pursue FC Nantes midfielder Imran Louza this summer, a report claims, as their youth-inspired revolution continues.

Barcelona defender Jean-Clair Todibo is on a list of centre-backs Everton are considering as they look to secure a loan signing before the transfer deadline.Carlo Ancelotti has confirmed the Blues want to add a defender to the squad before the October 5 cut-off and has said the club are not eyeing any permanent deals.

Todibo might be tempted by the fact Watford are a team which puts its faith in young players and he could get more regular minutes there than at the Camp Nou next year.

Italian Serie A giants AC Milan are one step closer in signing Spanish La Liga giants FC Barcelona’s young centre-back Jean-Clair Todibo in the January transfer window.

Liverpool have agreed a deal to sell playmaker Xherdan Shaqiri to French side Lyon.Shaqiri has been the number one target for Lyon sporting director Juninho and head coach Peter Bosz, and they have landed the 29-year-old Swiss international for a fee of £9.5m (€11m).

Tottenham will push to sign a striker this month as they react to the long‑term absence of Harry Kane and have joined the chase for Milan’s Krzysztof Piatek.Milan, who have re-signed Zlatan Ibrahimovic, are prepared to sell Piatek, a 24-year-old Poland forward, if they can recoup the £30m they paid to take him from Genoa last January.An expensive permanent deal would not appear to suit Spurs or, indeed, Newcastle and Aston Villa, who have also shown an interest in Piatek. Milan, Aston Villa's offer for PiatekYesterday there was a meeting between Milan and the Aston Villa officials. The ds of the British club flew to Italy to deal directly with the Rossoneri. please don't shoot the messenger, but he's [Piatek] not a target. Reina is on a list of possible gk's

Piatek joined Milan in January, arriving in a €35million deal from fellow Serie A side Genoa, where he had an explosive start to the season.The Poland international netted 22 goals in Serie A last season including nine for the Rossoneri, however he has struggled for form since the end of the last campaign.The 24-year-old did score his first goal from open play of the 2019-20 season off the bench against Lecce, and it is hoped that new head coach Stefano Pioli can get him back firing again.According to Calciomercato.com, Piatek has been linked with a move to Premier League side Chelsea in recent weeks, but the London club have taken no concrete steps towards trying to sign him.The report continues to add that Milan would ask for at least €35million if an approach were to be made at present.

Chelsea want to sign Kai Havertz from Bayer Leverkusen this summer.Leverkusen have not received a formal offer for the 20-year old but it is believed Real Madrid and Bayern Munich have held talks with the club.'Havertz would improve any PL team'Chelsea transfer rumoursTransfer Centre LIVE!Roman Abramovich is willing to give Frank Lampard significant backing in the transfer market this summer, with a deal for RB Leipzig striker Timo Werner agreed 'in principle'.Leicester left-back Ben Chilwell remains Chelsea's No 1 target this summer, while Hakim Ziyech will officially join Chelsea from Ajax in July.

Kai Havertz has left Germany's training camp to fly to London ahead of a club-record move to Chelsea.The Bayer Leverkusen midfielder is set to join Chelsea from the Bundesliga side after the clubs agreed a package of €80m plus €20m in add-ons on Wednesday, according to Sky in Germany.

Kai Havertz has left the Germany team HQ in Stuttgart on Friday so issues around a possible move to Premier League club Chelsea can be resolved. This was agreed after discussions between Bayer 04 and the DFB.

Chelsea are prepared to spend £75m on Kai Havertz - but that's less than Bayer Leverkusen value him at.Chelsea and Bayer Leverkusen are £15m apart as Frank Lampard looks to beat Liverpool and Manchester United to Kai Havertz's signature. Chelsea must wait to find out whether or not Bayer Leverkusen stick to their £90 million-plus valuation of Kai Havertz as the German club battle for Champions League qualification. [...]That is around £20 million more than Chelsea would hope to pay for Havertz, but there is a belief that asking price may have to drop if Leverkusen fail to finish in the top four of the Bundesliga.
Chelsea are ready to step up their pursuit of Kai Havertz after the attacking midfielder plays for Bayer Leverkusen in Saturday’s German Cup final against Bayern Munich.

Chelsea are the favourites to sign Kai Havertz from Bayer Leverkusen this summer, but are not willing to pay the £90m asking price.Havertz wants to leave Leverkusen and the German club are prepared to allow his exit. The 21-year-old has only two years remaining on his contract and Leverkusen have failed to qualify for next season's Champions League.

Bayer Leverkusen have accepted that Kai Havertz has chosen to join Chelsea but the Bundesliga outfit want to delay the transfer until the end of August.Leverkusen will grant Havertz his wish of a move to the Premier League and are open to selling the midfielder, but they are demanding a £89.8m transfer fee.

Chelsea are in talks with Bayer Leverkusen over a £70m deal to sign Kai Havertz. Sky Germany are reporting that all other suitors for the Germany forward are now out of the race to sign the 21-year-old.Chelsea technical adviser Petr Cech will fly to Germany following the conclusion of the Premier League season on Sunday to hold face-to-face talks.

Chelsea are expected to make a formal offer for Bayer Leverkusen's Kai Havertz when their Champions League qualification is confirmed, sources have told ESPN.The Blues are thought to be confident of securing a deal in the region of £70-£75 million despite Leverkusen demanding closer to £90m when initial contact was made prior to this month.
Chelsea have stepped up their pursuit of Kai Havertz after qualifying for the Champions League, opening talks with Bayer Leverkusen over a fee for the midfielder.

Chelsea are closing in on the signing of Kai Havertz after holding further talks with Bayer Leverkusen over a fee for the winger.Havertz is intent on joining Stamford Bridge this summer and belief is growing that Chelsea will be able to reach an agreement with Leverkusen. It is understood negotiations between the two clubs are moving at an encouraging pace.Chelsea’s initial offer of €65m (£58.6m) plus €15m in add-ons earlier this week was not enough to satisfy Leverkusen, who are holding out for as much as €100m. Bayern Munich believe they will land Leroy Sane from Manchester City this summer.The perennial German champions are aware that City manager Pep Guardiola would let the 23-year-old winger leave the Etihad, despite his contribution to their historic domestic Treble this season.

Pep Guardiola has wished Leroy Sane well as the Manchester City winger closes in on a £54.8m move to Bayern Munich.Guardiola said: "There are still some little issues but it looks like he's going to go to Munich. We wish him all the best, big thanks for our years together. We wish him all the best in his new chapter at a fantastic club."Is it disappointing? He wants to leave. Everyone has their own life. He deserves to move on."I'd love him to stay here but he decided to move on because he believes he will be happier [in Munich]."

FC Bayern Munich have signed Leroy Sané from Manchester City, the Germany international’s club since 2016. The 24-year-old has put his name to a five-year contract until 30 June 2025 and will start preparing for the upcoming season in Munich next week.

Bayern Munich are waiting for Leroy Sane to make a decision regarding his future at Manchester City, says club chairman Karl-Heinz Rummenigge.The Bundesliga club's president, Uli Hoeness, confirmed last month Sane is a player the German champions are interested in signing this summer after losing Arjen Robben and Franck Ribery.

Leroy Sane remains Bayern Munich's top transfer target this summer despite a recent lack of progress on a deal, according to Sky in Germany.According to Sky sources, the 23-year-old Germany international has reservations on a return to the Bundesliga having left Schalke to join Manchester City in 2016.

Bayern Munich expect Leroy Sane to make a decision on his future by next week.The Bundesliga champions made Sane their No 1 summer target and have been vocal in their pursuit of the Manchester City winger.

Bayern Munich have accepted that a deal to sign Leroy Sane from Manchester City is unlikely to happen in this transfer window, according to Sky in Germany.Sane will be part of the City squad travelling to Asia for their pre-season tour on Monday morning, and it is understood the club remain confident he wants to stay at the Etihad.

Bayern Munich have finally opened talks with Manchester City for £90million Leroy Sane.The Bundesliga champions’ Sporting Director Hasan Salihamidzic is leading negotiations as the club look to secure their man they have had as their prime target since the start of the summer.

Bayern Munich head coach Niko Kovac says he is "confident" the club will sign Manchester City winger Leroy Sane this summer.Earlier this week, Kovac confirmed the player would be the Bundesliga champions' "dream signing", confirming their intention of going all out to seal his signature.

Bayern Munich are weighing up a bid of more than £50 million to land Leroy Sane from Manchester City when the transfer window opens. The German champions have targeted Sane and believe it will require a package worth around €65m (£56.75m) to complete a deal, despite the 24-year-old having just one season left on his contract at the Etihad Stadium.

Bayern Munich have agreed a fee of £54.8m with Manchester City for Leroy Sane, with the German set to sign a five-year deal at the club.The Bundesliga champions will pay an initial fee of £44.7m (€49m) with a series of performance and trophy-related add-ons. These could lead to an additional £10m (€11m) for trophies won such as Bundesliga and Champions League titles as well as personal awards for the player himself.

Bayern Munich president Uli Hoeness confirmed on Thursday that the newly-crowned Bundesliga champions are considering a summer move for Manchester City winger Leroy Sane.Kicker magazine reported earlier this week that Sane, 23, was "a candidate" for Bayern's major transfer offensive this close season, and Hoeness confirmed the club's interest to Munich-based newspaper Sueddeutsche Zeitung."We are looking into the player (Sane)," he told the newspaper.

Bayern Munich chairman Karl-Heinz Rummenigge has indicated it is possible the club may sign both Leroy Sane and Callum Hudson-Odoi this summer.The Bavarians are looking to strengthen after a season that saw them retain their Bundesliga title but once again fall short in the Champions League.And Rummenigge has left open the possibility of a £70million bid for Manchester City winger Sane plus a renewed effort to prise 18-year-old forward Hudson-Odoi from Chelsea.

Bayern Munich president Uli Hoeness has admitted it is unlikely the Bundesliga champions will be able to clinch a deal for Manchester City winger Leroy Sane."I do not have an exact figure yet, but I think that financially it will be very difficult," he told Sport Bild.

Manchester City have turned down an offer of €80m (£70.7m) for their winger Leroy Sané from Bayern Munich. I can’t assure that to anyone so I understand completely.”

Bayern Munich will not give up on trying to prise away Leroy Sane from Manchester City – after fresh talks over a new contract with the Treble winners failed to bring a breakthrough.The German giants have made winger Sane their top target this summer to replace 30-somethings Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben, who are both moving on.

Napoli are ready to sign former Inter captain Mauro Icardi who is beginning to warm up to the idea but is yet to fully open up to the prospect, Italian broadcaster Sky Sport Italia’s transfer market expert Gianluca Di Marzio reports.According to the report, even up to as late as a few weeks ago the Argentinian striker completely dismissed the idea of a move to Napoli, but now he is beginning to think about it, given that Napoli have earmarked a high wage in their budget for the former Sampdoria striker as well as a rather heft transfer fee to pay the Nerazzurri.

​Paris Saint-Germain have been tipped to make a summer approach for Inter striker Mauro Icardi - in a potential move which could also spell the end of 32-year-old Edinson Cavani in the French capital.Icardi has had a difficult season in 2018/19 and his relationship with Inter was tested further when he was stripped of the captaincy in early February and didn't play for nearly two months amid conflicting claims that he was and was not injured.PSG are described as being 'ahead' of Atletico in their pursuit, but Inter are still waiting for any 'communication' and negotiations are not thought to have yet begun.La Gazzetta claims that Inter will ask for €70m to part with Icardi.

A summer of changes at the Metropolitano seems to be inevitable and the Atlético board have already begun to ponder what is needed in the transfer market with a particular focus on the front line.If Costa, or Griezmann, do leave Atlético this summer, Cerezo is eager to take advantage of Mauro Icardi’s increasingly untenable situation at Inter Milan. The Argentina striker has alienated fans and teammates by going on what amounted to a strike over contract issues and is unlikely to remain in Italy beyond the end of the season.

Atlético Madrid’s victory over Liverpool did not sit quite right with some, notably Jürgen Klopp who bemoaned the absence of Proper Football at Anfield, and yet clinical finishing and a dogged defensive display set the pulse racing for others, with Arsenal’s tails wagging at the performance of Thomas Partey in particular. Arsenal have opened talks with Atletico Madrid over the signing of their midfielder Thomas Partey, the player's father has claimed.The Ghanaian midfielder has been heavily linked with a summer move to the Emirates and has a £43million release clause in his current deal - allowing the Gunners to possibly snap him up for a relatively cheap fee.

Thomas Partey has joined us on a long-term contract.The 27-year-old midfielder had been with Atletico since 2012, making 188 appearances, in which time he won both the Europa League and Super Cup in 2018, and was a Champions League runner-up in 2016.

The name of Ferran Torres has long been on the Real Madrid agenda despite the fact that he is only 19 years old.He was an ‘alevín’ (under-12) when they first tried to sign him. Then, while he was a ‘cadete’ (under-16) they again came knocking at his door – quite literally – and invited him to visit the Real Madrid training facilities. The last Madrid attempt came when he was at ‘juvenil’ level, specifically during the U17 World Cup in India.It was after that Valencia reacted, promoting him to the first team and raising his buyout clause from €8 million to €25 million and then, four months later, to €100 million. Now they are trying to renew his deal again as it currently ends in 2021.

Barcelona, Real Madrid, and Leicester City are reportedly interested in signing Arsenal midfielder Matteo Guendouzi this summer, amid reports Mikel Arteta is ready to get rid of the Frenchman.The French midfielder tested Mikel Arteta's patience by bragging about his wages after a clash with Brighton's Neil Maupay. Everton remain hopeful of agreeing a deal to sign James Rodríguez as negotiations with Real Madrid over permanent transfer for the Colombia midfielder continue.It is understood that Carlo Ancelotti spoke to Rodríguez last week in an attempt to persuade him to move to Merseyside, with Real believed to want around £25m.

Everton are close to signing James Rodríguez from Real Madrid and the Colombia international has been given permission not to train with the Spanish giants on Monday in an attempt finally to sort out his future.The Telegraph revealed last week that the Premier League club had held talks over a deal for Rodríguez in what would be the coup of the transfer window so far.It is understood that those talks have remained positive and are now close to being concluded with Everton increasingly confident of securing the play-maker.

James Rodriguez's future is looking increasingly likely to be away from Real Madrid and Manchester United have returned to the race to sign him.

Arsenal are set to battle a Premier League rival for the signing of James Rodriguez from Real Madrid.According to Spanish publication AS, Mikel Arteta is keen on adding a 'quality reinforcement' such as Rodriguez to his squad this month.The Colombian is valued at around £34million by the Spanish giants but with the Gunners struggling for funds this month a loan deal appears to be the more plausible option.

Chelsea have joined Everton in the race to sign Real Madrid's Sergio Reguilon, voted "the best left-back in La Liga" last season. [...]For now, Chelsea have made their interest in Reguilon known - and are expected to trump Everton's £18m bid in the coming days.

Real Madrid left-back Sergio Reguilon is in talks to join Chelsea, with discussions already at an advanced stage, sources have told ESPN.The defender, 23, has attracted interest from a number of top European clubs after impressing in La Liga this season on loan at Sevilla.Chelsea's No. 1 left-back target this year has been Leicester's Ben Chilwell, but negotiations have proved difficult. Manchester United, Tottenham Hotspur and Inter Milan had all made inquiries about Reguilon this summer, but multiple sources have told ESPN that Chelsea are now favourites to land him.

Everton have moved ahead of at least three other Premier League clubs after bidding £18m for Real Madrid left-back Sergio Reguilon.Everton boss Carlo Ancelotti is keen to fill the vacancy left by Leighton Baines - who retired on Sunday - and provide competition for Lucas Digne.

Sevilla are confident of completing a deal for Real Madrid of full-back Sergio Reguilon this summer, say reports in Spain.Marca have verified information that was first published in La Sexta that the full-back is the preference of both former Madrid boss Julen Lopetegui, now at Sevilla, and sporting director Monchi.

Manchester United are keeping close tabs on Lyon striker Moussa Dembele.United are desperate to improve their striking options this summer and 22-year-old Dembele has been hugely impressive in France this season.

AC Milan are preparing a bid to sign Arsenal midfielder Lucas Torreira on loan, with a view to a permanent transfer.The Serie A club will make an offer in the region of £4.5m for a two-season loan, with an additional fee of around £25m to make the Uruguayan's move permanent at the end of that period.

Everton coach Carlo Ancelotti wants to bring his former player Allan to Merseyside, according to a report from Italian newspaper Il Roma via Calciomercato.com today.The report details how Ancelotti understands that Napoli are likely to sell the 29-year-old Brazilian midfielder in the summer, as president Aurelio De Laurentiis wants to clear out the older stars to invest in a younger squad. Carlo Ancelotti is preparing a raid on former club Napoli having reportedly opened negotiations with midfielder Allan over a potential summer transfer. Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale is set to sign for Chinese Super League outfit Jiangsu Suning on a three-year deal.The Welshman will earn 22 million euros per season and only small details remain for the deal to be finalised.Bale is not part of Zinedine Zidane's plans for the upcoming season and the Welshman's agent, Jonathan Barnett, had been in negotiations with the Chinese club in recent weeks.

Beijing Guoan want to make Gareth Bale the highest-paid player in Chinese football history by offering him a route out of Real Madrid.Barnett also suggested there could be a surprise in terms of where Bale goes next and Telegraph Sport understands, Beijing Guoan have already made it clear they are interested in taking the 30-year-old to China.Guoan are not the only club interested in Bale, but they are one of the few who might be able to match or better his £600,000-a-week Real wages.

Gareth Bale has been handed one potential exit route from Real Madrid this summer after Bayern Munich have been linked with a move for the Welshman.According to TEAMtalk, the 29-year-old winger has a contract that runs with Los Blancos until 2022 and club president Florentino Pérez is 'very fond of the player.' Arsenal are keeping tabs on Lille ace Gabriel Magalhaes after Everton's failure to reach a deal with the Ligue 1 outfit. The Lille centre-back Gabriel Magalhães has agreed to join Arsenal and will fly to London on Monday to complete a move worth up to €30m (£27m).

Gabriel Magalhaes has undergone a medical in London ahead of his move to Arsenal.The Gunners have agreed to pay around £25million to bring the Lille defender to the Emirates and he has agreed personal terms on a long-term contract, which is thought to be for five years.
Central defender Gabriel has joined us from French side Lille on a long-term contract.The 22-year-old Brazilian has completed his move and will wear our number 6 shirt.

Manchester United are monitoring Lille defender Gabriel Magalhaes, as they look to sign a new centre-back this summer.The 22-year-old is on United's radar as his age, potential and price - in the region of £20m - all fit the bill for a possible move to Old Trafford.

After Maurizio Sarri was appointed as Juventus manager in the summer, things haven’t been good for Emre Can.The midfielder has been left out of the Turin club’s Champions League squad and hasn’t started a game in the league this season. The Serie A winners have a few players they would like to offload in January and the 25-year-old is among them.Four days ago, Tuttosport talked about the Germany international being a player who could be offered to Manchester United.The Italian newspaper once again talks about the Red Devils and states ‘the United option’ still remains available for the player in the next market.

Borussia Dortmund are looking into the possibility of signing Emre Can from Juventus in January, according to Bild.BVB would be able to meet Juventus' reported asking price of €20 million for the midfielder, but Can's wage demands could be a potential hurdle as the German club wouldn't be able to match his current annual salary of €12 million.

BUY-BACK AND MAN CITY - Sensi was a great addition for Inter as the nerazzurri will clearly buy him back from Sassuolo. According to Calciomercato.com, Inter have already held talks with Sassuolo concerning the matter as his buy-back now seems to be a formality. Even so, they will have to watch out since many big European clubs have been interested in him. Other than FC Barcelona, Manchester City have also been scouting him over the last few months. Pep Guardiola likes him a lot (he also likes Tonali and Fabian Ruiz) as he views him as the perfect potential addition for his team. Man City would love to get him but for Inter Milan, he is untouchable at the moment...

As reported by Gazzetta dello Sport, Sassuolo value their midfielder at 25 million euros, while the Rossoneri to do not want to offer more than 20 million plus bonuses, which is unconvincing for the Neroverdi. Negotiations have not yet officially started but are expected to kickstart in the coming days and Sassuolo are looking to make a proposal to their liking.Sassuolo's dream would be Patrick Cutrone and have proposed Milan a swap deal involving the two players. However, the evaluations of both players are different, given that Cutrone has a higher price than Sensi. Other players Sassuolo like are Davide Calabria and Alessandro Plizzari but as of now, it remains to be seen whether any swap deal will materialize.

Arsenal are preparing to table a bid for £9million-valued Hungary international Dominik Szoboszlai, Football Insider can reveal.The Gunners are one of a number of top clubs around Europe preparing to make an offer for the highly-rated teenager.

Red Bull Salzburg star Dominik Szoboszlai is edging "closer" to an exit, with Arsenal heavily linked with interest.The 20-year-old's performances in Austria have reportedly attracted interest from across Europe, helped by two goals in three Champions League appearances this season.

Arsenal are exploring ways to structure a deal for highly-rated midfielder Dominik Szoboszlai, who has a £23million release clause at RB Salzburg.Chief among the attacking midfielder's suitors are the Gunners, who are exploring means of financing a deal.

Arsenal may be forced into a buy-to-loan deal to win the January race for rising star Dominik Szoboszlai.The London giants have been closely monitoring the attacking midfielder for two years and have bid for him in previous windows but there is growing competition to prise him from RB Salzburg.

Arsenal were expected to wait until next summer to make a move for Dominik Szoboszlai, but could change their minds after a new development.Szoboszlai is believed to be Arsenal’s top transfer target after a busy summer window.

Dominik Szoboszlai could leave Red Bull Salzburg when the January transfer window opens.And that is fantastic news for Arsenal who were first linked with a move for the Hungary international in the summer of 2019 and scouts have been keeping close tabs on the midfielder ever since.

uventus are constantly on the look-out for talented young players that they can add to their already impressive roster of old and new talent. Names such as Hamed Traore and Cristian Romero have frequently popped up in recent months but now, there is a new name that the Bianconeri are studying.Juventus are interested in signing 18-year-old Red Bull Salzburg youngster Dominik Szoboszlai. The Salzburg starlet has been attracting attention from around Europe but it looks as though Juventus are among the most interested. Szoboszlai currently has a release clause at €25m; a figure considered slightly too high by the Bianconeri and, therefore, as per La Gazzetta dello Sport, Juventus are working on a joint deal with Genoa for the Salzburg man. Manchester United are one of several clubs interested in Verona defender Marash Kumbulla.Kumbulla has been a regular for Verona this season, helping them to have the fifth-best defensive record in the league with just 20 goals conceded so far.

Norwich City have agreed a deal with Schalke for former Liverpool loan centre back Ozan Kabak, with the Turkish international in England to complete his medical.The 21-year-old centre back has agreed to join the Canaries on a season long loan, with an option to buy.

Leicester City could sign Schalke 04 defender Ozan Kabak for a significantly reduced fee this summer amid claims that Liverpool have turned down another opportunity to sign the Turkey international.Kabak has been strongly linked with a move to the Foxes in recent weeks, so Brendan Rodgers’ charges could secure themselves a bargain.
