Tottenham Hotspur have been linked with a move for VfB Stuttgart defender Ozan Kabak as per reports.Kabak has been on the radar of three of the top six sides in the Premier League for quite some time now, and the German side have put a price-tag of £13.8 million on him as per the Daily Express.After Stuttgart’s relegation, Arsenal, Manchester United and Spurs have once again turned their heads towards the 19-year-old defender who was recently named the Bundesliga rookie of the season following his impressive performances.The former Galatasaray centre-back made 17 appearances for Stuttgart this past season, but his impressive performances alongside Benjamin Pavard couldn’t save the club from relegation.

The 19-year-old has impressed in the Bundesliga since a transfer from Galatasaray in January – attracting the attention of the Premier League.Manchester United and Arsenal are set to battle it out for the star, who has been compared to the likes of Sergio Ramos and Virgil Van Dijk.

STUTTGART defender Ozan Kabak could continue his meteoric rise with a move to Manchester United.The 19-year-old has impressed in the Bundesliga since a transfer from Galatasaray in January – attracting the attention of the Premier League.Manchester United and Arsenal are set to battle it out for the star, who has been compared to the likes of Sergio Ramos and Virgil Van Dijk.

Everton flop Moise Kean is close to sealing a return on loan to his former club Juventus after failing to adapt to Premier League football.The 20-year-old joined the Toffees for a fee of £27.5m last summer in a deal which many felt was a coup for the club.

Juventus are reportedly exploring the option of reuniting with Moise Kean as they brace themselves for Cristiano Ronaldo's shock summer departure.According to Italian news outlet SportItalia, Everton have given Kean the green light to re-join Juventus this summer, with the two clubs ready agree to a loan fee, which will include an obligation to buy in the deal.
Juventus are close to re-signing Moise Kean on a two-year loan with an obligation to buy the Everton forward for £17m.
Everton are in talks about a return to Juventus for striker Moise Kean.It is not yet clear whether the deal for the Italy international will be a loan with an obligation to buy.
Moise Kean is back home at Juventus upon completing his loan move from Everton

Inter Milan could make a move for Everton striker Moise Kean this summer, according to Sky in Italy.Kean has not settled on Merseyside after joining Everton from Juventus for around £27m in 2019, with the forward going on loan to PSG last season where he scored 13 goals in 26 appearances.It was expected the 21-year-old Italy international would join the French club on a permanent deal this summer.

Paris Saint-Germain are in talks with Everton over a potential loan deal for striker Moise Kean.The agreement could include an option for the Ligue 1 champions to buy the 20-year-old at the end of the loan.

Everton striker Moise Kean is poised to join Paris St-Germain on loan until the end of the season.The 20-year-old Italy international has failed to make an impact on Merseyside since joining Everton in a £27m deal from Juventus in the summer of 2019.He will now try to re-ignite his career at PSG, who are understood to have an option to buy Kean at the end of his loan period.

Paris Saint-Germain is pleased to announce the arrival of Moise Kean from Everton FC. The 20-year-old Italian striker is on loan to the capital club until 30 June 2021. The loan does not come with option to buy.

Everton are on the hunt for a new striker this summer and that has inevitably got them looking around Europe.Marcel Brands has a specific set of requirements, though, particularly when it comes to the player’s age.The Dutchman prefers signing younger, talented players with a high resale value, which led him to target Juventus youngster Moise Kean.

Everton are in talks to sign Juventus striker Moise Kean, Sky Sports News understands.The Serie A club are looking for €40M (£36M) for the 19-year-old and also want a buy-back clause inserted into any deal.

Everton have agreed a transfer fee of £27.5m, potentially rising to £36.6m with Juventus for striker Moise Kean, according to Sky in ItalyThe 19-year old Italy international could earn around £52,000 per week, it is reported, with a medical possible as early as Wednesday.The deal is expected to include a buy-back clause for Juve, and the fee could potentially rise to £36.6m.
Moise Kean has signed for Everton from Juventus for an undisclosed fee, agreeing a five-year deal until the end of June 2024.

Arsenal have joined the race to sign Juventus forward Moise Kean and have made contact with his agent Mino Raiola. The last player to make a big move from Turin to the Gunners was Thierry Henry and Emery will be hoping Kean can make as big an impact if the Premier League side can get a deal over the line.

Everton are keen to sell Moise Kean in the summer - the negotiations will start around €50m. PSG are working to sign him on a permanent deal but negotiating on the price - Italian clubs would join the race only if PSG won’t find an agreement.
Tottenham wing-back Ryan Sessegnon is wanted by Hertha Berlin and Hoffenheim on loan.The Bundesliga duo are looking for short-term reinforcements in the position and are keen on the 20-year-old.

(...) On Saturday The Athletic reported David Ornstein tweeted that Hoffenheim have reached an agreement to sign Sessegnon on a season-long loan.Hoffenheim will have no option to buy the attacking midfielder, who Tottenham signed from Fulham in a deal worth €27 million one year ago.(...)
Tottenham wing-back Ryan Sessegnon is wanted by Hertha Berlin and Hoffenheim on loan.The Bundesliga duo are looking for short-term reinforcements in the position and are keen on the 20-year-old.
Celtic have made an approach for Tottenham left-back Ryan Sessegnon – but it is believed the finances of any potential deal have proved problematic.

Fulham are one of the leading candidates to sign Ryan Sessegnon on loan following their promotion to the Premier League.Sessegnon has struggled for game time at Tottenham Hotspur this season and did not play a single minute for the club after lockdown.
Ajax want to take Ryan Sessegnon on loan and have asked Tottenham whether the England Under-21 winger will be made available next campaign.

Chelsea hope to persuade Rennes to sell Édouard Mendy, despite having their first offer of €16m (£14.2m) for the goalkeeper rejected. (...)However, Lampard does not trust Arrizabalaga, who was dropped on two occasions last season, and Chelsea have tracked Mendy for a while. Their first offer for the Senegalese goalkeeper has been turned down and they are expected to return with a €20m bid.

Senegal goalkeeper Edouard Mendy is expected to complete his move to Chelsea from Rennes on Tuesday, Frank Lampard has confirmed. The 28-year-old was undergoing a medical with the west London club, with Blues boss Lampard indicating the deal should be completed shortly afterwards.(...)“Mendy’s having a medical as we speak, so, subject to that being OK, later on he’ll become our player at that point,” Lampard said. “With Mendy coming in, it’s more competition, so every reaction will have to be positive around that from Kepa. Mendy as he comes in himself will push to try and play in this team, we know that. We know the standards that are required from a goalkeeper in this team, so we have to push for that.”
Chelsea Football Club has today completed the signing of goalkeeper Edouard Mendy from Rennes.The Senegalese international has penned a five-year deal at Stamford Bridge. [...]

Chelsea boss Frank Lampard is keen to bring in a top-level goalkeeper. [...] Now Lampard will focus his attention on Rennes goalkeeper Edouard Mendy. [...] The Blues have had an opening bid of around £14m rejected but are expected to return with a second bid.
Rennes want a transfer fee of more than £30million for Edouard Mendy to join Chelsea. - subscription required -

Chelsea are increasingly confident they are on the verge of agreeing a deal with Rennes for goalkeeper Edouard Mendy, which will take their spending on new players this summer closer to the £250 million mark, reports Simon Johnson.Sources have told The Athletic that talks are progressing well. One insider claimed that Mendy is expected to arrive at Stamford Bridge “within days or the next few weeks” in a move that will spark more speculation about the future of Kepa Arrizabalaga as the club’s No 1.

Chelsea are close to signing a new goalkeeper to compete with Kepa Arrizabalaga after holding talks with Rennes over an £18.2m deal for Edouard Mendy. (...)However they have continued to negotiate with Rennes, who qualified for the Champions League after finishing third in Ligue 1 last season, and are close to reaching an agreement with the Ligue 1 club over a deal for the Senegal international. Nothing has been finalised yet but it is understood that Chelsea could end up paying €28m for Mendy once add-ons are included.
Chelsea are close to agreeing a deal to sign goalkeeper Edouard Mendy from French club Rennes.Mendy did not train with Rennes on Friday morning, even though they are playing Nimes on Sunday.

Chelsea are set to complete the transfer of Rennes goalkeeper Edouard Mendy, the player's agent Djily Dieng has confirmed. Speaking to Senegal paper Stades, Dieng said: "The two parties have come to an agreement. All that’s left is the formalisation."It could even be done tomorrow, if all goes well. Afterwards, the player will come to finalise everything, including having his medical examination.
Chelsea are set to sign a goalkeeper to put pressure on Kepa Arrizabalaga after reaching an agreement with Rennes over a £22m deal for Édouard Mendy.

Now that we all know Aaron Ramsey will be signing for Juventus in the summer, clubs will be aware Arsenal will be in need of replacing the Welshman in some shape or form.A number of names have been touted as potential replacement, but we appear to have found a new one in Fiorentina’s Jordan Veretout.The information comes from Le Foot, who look at the former Aston Villa man’s situation at Fiorentina, as a number of clubs both in Italy and abroad (including the Gunners) are interested in him after an impressive second season with the Serie A side.Scoring five league goals (the same as Ramsey has this season) in 27 Serie A appearances, the 26-year-old would provide Emery with similar versatility to the Welshman’s, capable of featuring anywhere down the midfield spine with relative ease.Both creative and tenacious, Veretout would come at a price, however, as Le Foot believe €25-30m would be needed to open talks with Fiorentina.

Manchester United have been told that it is going to take €40m (£35m) for them to sign Eintracht Frankfurt’s Andre Silva this summer. The Red Devils have been linked with the forward in the past as an alternative to Borussia Dortmund’s Erling Haaland.
Eintracht Frankfurt attacker Ante Rebic has left the Bundesliga club to join AC Milan on a two-year loan deal, with Andre Silva leaving Serie A to replace him in Germany.

Tottenham have been handed a major boost in their attempts to sign Thomas Meunier with reports in France claiming that the Belgian will not be signing a new contract with PSG.As reported by Standard Sport, Jose Mourinho will be limited to free transfers, loans and swap deals once the transfer window opens as the club looks to combat the financial effects of the coronavirus pandemic.

Tottenham are in talks to sign Paris Saint-Germain free agent Thomas Meunier at the end of this season.Belgian international right back Meunier is out of contract with the French champions at the end of this campaign and is one of several players [...] who have been made available.
Arsenal manager Unai Emery is interested in signing Paris Saint-Germain full-back Thomas Meunier this summer.

ARSENAL boss Unai Emery has been “in contact” with Paris Saint-Germain defender Thomas Meunier more than once in a bid to persuade him to join the club.Arsenal transfer news: Thomas Meunier in ‘contact’ with Unai Emery as Gunners eye bidARSENAL boss Unai Emery has been “in contact” with Paris Saint-Germain defender Thomas Meunier more than once in a bid to persuade him to join the club.By Duncan Robinson / Published 8th June 2019Chelsea: Loftus-Cheek finds training difficult says SarriPauseUnmuteCurrent Time 0:02/Duration 0:48FacebookTwitterShareFullscreenThat is according to Belgian football expert Kristof Terreur, who says that the right-back will probably leave the club this summer.The player himself admitted recently that there are a “dozen” teams interested in snapping him up and Manchester United and Everton, as well as Arsenal have been linked.
ARSENAL boss Unai Emery has been in touch with Paris Saint-Germain right-back Thomas Meunier over a potential transfer this summer.

Manchester United are considering Thomas Meunier as an option for the troublesome right-back position this summer. The Paris Saint-Germain defender would represent an experienced choice to fill Antonio Valencia's boots when the Ecuadorean veteran leaves the club at the end of the season.

Manchester United look set to win the race to sign Thomas Meunier from Paris Saint-Germain, despite Unai Emery’s personal intervention. The Belgium international is surplus to Thomas Tuchel’s requirements following the emergence Colin Dagba, while the likes of Dani Alves and Juan Bernat remain at the German’s disposal. PSG are hopeful of securing a £25million fee for the attack-minded full-back who is at the centre of a tug of war between United and Arsenal, both of whom are desperate for defensive reinforcements.

Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek is having a medical at Fulham ahead of a season-long loan, report David Ornstein, Peter Rutzler and Liam Twomey.The 24-year-old is understood to be likely heading to Craven Cottage for the 2020-21 season ahead of Monday night's deadline.
The Club is delighted to announce the signing of Ruben Loftus-Cheek on loan from Chelsea.The England international midfielder will remain at Fulham for the duration of the 2020/21 season.

Aston Villa are interested in Chelsea duo Ross Barkley and Ruben Loftus-Cheek, but Premier League rules mean they can only pursue a loan deal for one of them.As reported by Sky Sports News last week, Villa head coach Dean Smith wants another midfielder to add to his ranks before the transfer deadline on October 5.

Aston Villa are pushing to sign Ruben Loftus-Cheek, 24, on loan from Chelsea amid competition from Southampton and West Ham. Villa head coach Dean Smith wants to bolster his midfield options before the transfer deadline on October 5.
Aston Villa and West Ham are among several clubs interested in signing Ruben Loftus-Cheek on a season’s loan after the midfielder was left out of Chelsea’s past two matchday squads.

Gunners in for UnderAccording to a report by Tuttomercato in Italy, as cited by the Mirror, Arsenal are going to challenge Leicester City for the signing of Roma winger Cengiz Under this summer.Under spent the second half of this season on loan at the King Power Stadium and showed flashes of his qualities, althogh he struggled for consistency.Leicester have the chance to sign him for £20million this summer but it is thought that the Foxes will pass on the opportunity.
Brendan Rodgers is close to making his second summer signing with the capture of Roma winger Cengiz Ünder.- subscription required -

Brendan Rodgers says Leicester are hopeful of securing a deal for Roma winger Cengiz Under.Leicester's discussions over a deal to sign Under are focusing on whether there would be an obligation to buy the Turkish winger at the end of his loan spell.A loan fee of £2.7m has been agreed for the 23-year-old, according to Sky in Italy, but Roma want Leicester to commit to buying him for £22m in a year's time.
Leicester City Football Club have agreed terms with A.S. Roma for the loan of Turkish international Cengiz Ünder until the end of the season, subject to Premier League and international clearance.

Brazilian club Corinthians are in talks with Arsenal over a potential deal for Willian.The discussions taking place would be for a free transfer which would see Willian make the move back to his native country.

Arsenal are working on a mutual agreement to terminate Willian's contract before a free transfer to Brazilian club Corinthians.The deal could save the Gunners millions of pounds as the Brazil midfielder still has two years left on a three-year contract, reported to be worth more than £200,000 a week.

We have reached a mutual agreement with Willian to terminate his contract effective from today.He had two more years to run on his contract but following positive and constructive recent discussions with him and his team, he will be leaving for a new opportunity with Corinthians in Brazil, where he began his career.
Arsenal winning race to sign Chelsea star Willian on free transfer

(...)Lampard, who had to deal with a transfer ban after being appointed as manager last summer, is keen to revamp his attack. Chelsea are set to part company with Pedro Rodríguez, who is joining Roma on a free transfer, while Willian is another veteran whose contract runs out at the end of the season. While Lampard wants Willian to stay, the 31-year-old Brazilian winger’s hopes of a new three-year deal look slim and there is an expectation that he could end up joining Arsenal on a free.

Willian is edging closer to leaving Chelsea on a free after rejecting the club’s latest attempts to persuade him to sign a new two-year deal and has held talks over a move to Arsenal.The winger has been unable to reach agreement with Chelsea over fresh terms because of his demands for a three-year extension and is increasingly likely to leave after the second leg of the last-16 Champions League tie against Bayern Munich on Saturday. Although Willian is expected to delay a decision on his future until after that game, the chances of a breakthrough in negotiations with Chelsea are receding, boosting Arsenal’s hopes of signing the 31-year-old.
Arsenal have made a formal three-year contract offer to Willian, edging them to the front of the race to sign the Brazilian forward.

Arsenal are close to completing the signing of midfielder Willian from Chelsea on a three-year deal.Arsenal moved into pole position to sign the Brazil international, whose Chelsea deal expires later this month, by offering a three-year contract earlier this week.
Willian confirms Chelsea departure as expected Arsenal move progressesThe Brazilian, who turned 32 on Sunday, is expected to sign a three-year deal at Arsenal with the option of a further 12 months.

Chelsea, Barcelona and Inter Miami have all made contract offers to Brazilian forward Willian.Catalan club Barcelona are understood to have fulfilled Willian's request for a three-year deal.However, the biggest proposal on the table, a lucrative three and a half year offer, comes from the MLS club Inter Miami, who are part-owned by former England captain David Beckham.
Willian has been offered £230k a week, a flat and two cars with drivers to leave Chelsea for Shanghai Shenhua this summer.

Chelsea are reportedly preparing to battle the likes of Real Madrid, Atletico Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain for the signature of Brazilian teenager Reinier.The 17-year-old has scored three times and contributed two assists in 10 appearances for Flamengo this season, having broken into the first team earlier this year.Atletico were thought to be in a strong position to land the attacker, who is believed to have a release clause of £53.5m inserted into his current contract in Brazil.However, according to Gazzetta dello Sport, Chelsea have now entered the race for the South American and are hopeful of beating a number of European clubs to a deal.

Flamengo starlet Reinier Jesus is attracting plenty of attention this summer. And Arsenal are among the clubs keen on the teenage talent, according to Tutto Mercato Web.Jesus is hot property and Flamengo face a major battle convincing him to stay. He has not made his debut yet for the Rio de Janeiro-based outfit but he is still in high demand.The 17-year-old is protected by a colossal £60m-plus release clause. But Arsenal are still hoping to win the race for the young midfield man
​Atlético Madrid are reportedly in advanced talks with Flamengo's exciting Brazilian prodigy Reinier Jesus Carvalho.

Even though Juventus are said to be strong in the race for Napoli striker Arkadiusz Milik, the Old Lady will have to work hard to land the 26-year-old.Turin newspaper Tuttosport has today another story about this pursuit, claiming there’s a heavy competition for the Polish star.Tottenham Hotspur are named as one of the clubs who’ve ‘knocked on Napoli’s door’, as they try to get Milik as well.It’s said Spurs have put money and players on the table, and that’s what Juventus will try to do so they can fight for the signing.Napoli are said to be demanding between €40m and €50m, and both Tottenham and Juve plan to get a discount by adding players in their respective offers.

Tottenham are offering Napoli striker Arkadiusz Milik a £90,000-a-week contract and £5million signing-on fee, Football Insider understands.The London giants are working on a deal to sign the Poland international among multiple forward targets in the final weeks of the window.

Meanwhile, a door may have opened for Tottenham in Italy in the search for a backup for Harry Kane. According to transfer expert Alfredo Pedulla, Spurs are showing interest in Arkadiusz Milik. A meeting with the agents of the 26-year-old striker is said to be scheduled for Wednesday. The Napoli contract of the Poland international expires in 2021, but transfers to Juventus and Roma recently fell through.

Manchester United have turned their attentions to Napoli striker Arkadiusz Milik as they look to strengthen their attacking options in the January transfer window. The 25-year-old has been in fine form in recent weeks, scoring 10 goals in his last 10 appearances for the Italian club.
Aston Villa's head coach Dean Smith is weighing up a bid to sign Chelsea's Ross Barkley on loan. - subscription required -

Aston Villa are interested in Chelsea duo Ross Barkley and Ruben Loftus-Cheek, but Premier League rules mean they can only pursue a loan deal for one of them.As reported by Sky Sports News last week, Villa head coach Dean Smith wants another midfielder to add to his ranks before the transfer deadline on October 5.
Aston Villa is delighted to announce the signing of Ross Barkley on a season-long loan from Chelsea.
West Ham 'eye Ross Barkley loan move' as David Moyes wants to reunite with Chelsea midfielder who he brought through the ranks at Everton

David Moyes is set to reignite his interest in Chelsea and England midfielder Ross Barkley.The West Ham boss wants a reunion with the schemer he nurtured at Everton after his progress through the Toffees’ youth teams.

Birmingham City are closing in on a loan deal for Manchester United ’s Amad.The Ivorian teen has been allowed to leave Old Trafford to gain first-team experience and Lee Bowyer is bang in the race to sign the talented teen.
Rangers are close to signing Manchester United winger Amad Diallo on loan until the end of the season.

Manchester United starlet Amad Diallo is set to leave the club this summer, joining Dutch outfit Feyenoord on a season-long loan. Diallo will have to go out on loan to earn the minutes he craves, and Fabrizio Romano reports that the winger is now close to completing a season-long move to Eredivisie giants Feyenoord.
Amad Diallo's loan move from Manchester United to Feyenoord has fallen through following an injury to the winger.The 19-year-old was due to complete the move before Tuesday's transfer deadline.

Sheffield United are interested in signing Manchester United winger Amad Diallo on loan.The Championship club are looking to add reinforcements following their relegation from the Premier League last season.Manchester United may allow him to leave in search of more game time, but a final decision has yet to be made.

Manchester United are exploring the possibility of signing right-winger Amad Traore from Atalanta.The MEN understands Ivory Coast-born Traore, 18, is not seen as an alternative to Jadon Sancho and United have contacted Atalanta amid competition from other clubs.

Manchester United chiefs are cautiously optimistic of signing Atalanta winger Amad Traore before the transfer window slams shut. Talks between the relevant parties are progressing, although the deal is reportedly far from done at this stage. Traore became the youngest player to score on his Serie A debut in Atalanta’s 7-1 win over Udinese last season and he is expected to not be cheap, despite only playing 30 minutes of football in Italy’s top flight.

Manchester United are expected to try and finalise a permanent deal for Amad Traore next year.United have been working on a move for Atalanta winger Traore, 18, but encountered issues in arranging a visa. Traore was reportedly due to join Parma on loan but they have just recruited winger Valentin Mihaila and Traore is now expected to stay at Atalanta until January.

Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign the 18-year-old Atalanta winger Amad Traoré for €30m (£27.2m) plus add-ons and remain in talks with Barcelona over loan deal for Ousmane Dembélé.Traoré was on his way to Parma on loan – the club had announced the transfer on their social media channels – before United made their move early on deadline day.

Manchester United have reached an agreement with Atalanta for the future transfer of Amad Diallo, one of the most exciting young prospects in Italian football.[...] He will join United at a later date, subject to medical, personal terms and work permit.

Borussia Dortmund are contemplating a move for Manchester United starlet Amad Diallo.The talented winger, who signed from Atalanta, has failed to gain the first team opportunities he may have been expecting at the Old Trafford club.A loan move in the summer was derailed by an injury before the transfer window closed.Sky Sports Germany reports Dortmund are seriously assessing Diallo, and may put in a loan offer before the January window shuts.United are not likely to want to sell Diallo permanently, considering they have a lot of faith that he can go on to become a first team star.
Wolves and West Ham have been linked with a move for AC Milan forward Suso.The 25-year-old is understood to have a release clause of £36million, which only applies to clubs outside of Italy.
Wolves and West Ham have been linked with a move for AC Milan forward Suso.The 25-year-old is understood to have a release clause of £36million, which only applies to clubs outside of Italy.

Leicester City are reportedly weighing up a move for Atalanta defender Timothy Castagne.According to Sport/Foot, the Foxes are planning for the possible departure of Ricardo Pereira, and have identified Castagne as a potential replacement.
Leicester are in talks with Atalanta over signing full-back Timothy Castagne.The Foxes are keen to add cover at left-back after selling Ben Chilwell to Chelsea last week.
Leicester have agreed a deal worth £22 million for Belgium full-back Timothy Castagne from Atalanta.
Timothy Castagne has completed his Leicester medical ahead of a £21.5m switch from Atalanta.

Leicester City Football Club have agreed terms with Atalanta for the transfer of full-back Timothy Castagne, subject to Premier League and international clearance.The 24-year-old Belgian international has put pen to paper on a five-year deal with the Foxes and will link up with his new team-mates after the conclusion of the current international break.

Atalanta right back Timothy Castagne says that he could not turn down the chance to join Tottenham if Spurs make a move this summer.The 24-year-old Belgian international has been linked with a move away from Serie A at the end of the season, with PSG and Tottenham said to be interested.Castagne said in May, he would "lead towards England" if an opportunity arose, but PSG remains an option after Belgian compatriot Thomas Meunier left the Ligue1 champions to join Borussia Dortmund."I think the time has come to move on, but I won't be disappointed if I stay," Castagne told La Derniere Heure in Belgium."I'm very proud of this. It's proof that hard work pays off. I hope it's more than just simple interest from them.""You have to be honest with yourself. When a team like PSG or Tottenham come knocking on your door, you can't say 'no'."
Tottenham are reportedly moving a step closer to completing a move for Atalanta star Timothy Castagne in the summer transfer window.

Crystal Palace are preparing for the departure of Aaron Wan-Bissaka to Manchester United by stepping up their interest in Atalanta star Timothy Castagne, according to the Mirror (27 June, page 65) – although they appear to have given up hope of signing Norwich City’s Max Aarons.

(...)Trabzonspor president Ahmet Agaoglu has said that Spurs are one of the sides interested in signing Sørloth, but it would be a complicated deal as the Norwegian is on loan from Crystal Palace with the Turkish club having an option to buy. But Mourinho was not willing to engage on the topic.“Well I’m not going to discuss Sørloth. If the president of Trabzonspor told that I’m not going to say that it’s not true,” he said. “I think Sørloth is a Trabzonspor player and it’s not for me to speak about. “Do we need a striker? Yes we need. Was it because of that we lost the game? No. We didn’t lose the game because we need a striker. We lost the game and the responsibility of that defeat is my responsibility.”

Alexander Sorloth to Gent (loan)The Norwegian striker has found his opportunities limited at Palace this season, with the 23-year-old not starting once in the Premier League this season.round match at The Liberty Stadium, Swansea. Photo: PA Wire He has only played 16 times in the league since joining the Eagles in January, and has now been linked with a short-term switch to get game time.A reunion with his former manager , Jess Thorup, has been mentioned, with Belgian side Gent reportedly interested in signing the striker, and it could be a move that suits all parties, with Sorloth not featuring in the last three matchday squads for Palace. Verdict: Very possible
Crystal Palace forward Alexander Sørloth has joined Belgian Pro League club KAA Gent on loan for the remainder of this season.

Leeds United’s pursuit of Real Sociedad defender Diego Llorente is edging closer to a conclusion after the Basque club confirmed a fee had been agreed with the Whites. (...)Sky Sports News first reported talks with Llorente were at an advanced stage on Tuesday morning, while Basque sources are suggesting a deal between £18m and £19m is all done with a medical in Madrid planned for tomorrow.

Tottenham Hotspur are confident they will sign Southampton Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg this summer, as long as the club can raise the transfer fee through sales.Hojbjerg is near the top of head coach Jose Mourinho's wanted list to strengthen his options in the middle of the pitch for Spurs.The 24-year-old midfielder has one year remaining on his contract and is understood to favour a move to Tottenham over other current options.Spurs are, therefore, optimistic they will be able to land Hojbjerg, but Mourinho is likely to have to raise money to do so through sales.
Copied to clipboardWe are delighted to announce the signing of Pierre-Emile Højbjerg from Southampton

Tottenham have made a players-plus-cash offer to sign Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from Southampton, according to transfer expert Duncan Castles. Tottenham wanted to sign Hojbjerg in January and are once again pursuing the former Bayern Munich ace. The Denmark international is out of contract at St. Mary's in 2021 and has been stripped of the captaincy after refusing to sign a new contract. "Southampton see him as a player they have to sell in this market," Castles said on the Transfer Window podcast."They, I'm told, have three offers so far for the player, none of them are satisfactory, one extremely low at a financial level, and they have an offer of cash plus players in exchange, which I understand has come from Tottenham Hotspur.
Southampton midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg wants to join Tottenham this summer and Spurs could use Kyle Walker-Peters in a deal for the Dane.

Everton have made a bid of £18million for Southampton’s highly-rated midfielder Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.The Denmark international was stripped off the Southampton captaincy after making it clear he wanted to leave the Premier League club in the next transfer window.Tottenham Hotspur were regarded as the clear favourites to sign the 24-year-old partly because they were willing to offer right-back Kyle Walker-Peters, who is on loan at Southampton, in exchange plus cash.
Tottenham Hotspur have emerged as favourites, ahead of Everton, to sign Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from Southampton.
Tottenham are confident that they will close a deal for Southampton’s Pierre-Emile Højbjerg, even though Everton have had a bid of £25m accepted for the midfielder.
Tottenham are edging closer to a deal to sign Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from Southampton.Spurs are said to have offered £15m for the Denmark midfielder in negotiations so far.

Tottenham and Southampton have agreed deals in principle for the transfers of Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg and Kyle Walker-Peters.A fee in the region of £15m has been agreed for Hojbjerg to move to Spurs and one in the region of £12m for Walker-Peters to join Saints, where he spent the second half of the 2019/20 season on loan.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg will have a medical with Tottenham on Monday ahead of his transfer from Southampton.Spurs have agreed a deal of £15m plus bonuses to sign the Denmark midfielder from the Saints.

Everton have bid £18m for the Southampton midfielder Pierre-Emile Højbjerg but Tottenham are also in negotiations over a deal that would see the Denmark international join Spurs and Kyle Walker-Peters, who has spent the past six months on loan at St Mary’s, make a permanent switch in the opposite direction. Southampton are hopeful Tottenham will better Everton’s offer.
Southampton have accepted a bid from Everton of around £25 million for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, but Tottenham Hotspur are still in the race after also finally tabling an offer of their own.

Ajax have joined the race for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg but Tottenham are in pole position to land the Southampton midfielder. Hojbjerg, 24, has been replaced as captain at St Mary’s after failing to agree an extension to his contract, which runs out in a year and could see him leave for free.

Arsenal have made contact with Marseille star Morgan Sanson over a potential move this summer, according to reports in France. Le10 Sport claims Arsenal chiefs are monitoring the midfielder’s situation at Marseille.

Leicester City have been linked with a move for Olympique Marseille midfielder Morgan Sanson.According to French media outlet L'Equipe, City have 'shown an interest' in the France Under-21 international.

West Ham are in talks to sign Marseille's Morgan Sanson, Sky Sports News understands.Marseille are willing to listen to offers for some of their players after they failed to qualify for next season's Champions League.Sanson, who Marseille value at around €35m, played 33 times for the French club last season, scoring five goals and getting three assists.
Wolves have made Andre Silva and Morgan Sanson their top transfer targets this summer, as the club’s owners seek to add quality to Nuno Espirito Santo’s squad.

Manchester United defender Chris Smalling has travelled to Italy to finalise a loan move to Serie A side Roma, says boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.The Premier League club have reportedly agreed a season-long deal with Roma paying a fee of £2.7m.
Chris Smalling is intent on rejoining Roma on loan from Manchester United next season and is willing to push for the deal, according to reports from Italy.
Manchester United defender Chris Smalling looks set to join Roma on a permanent basis after the Italian side bid £18m plus bonuses for the player.

Roma are stepping up their pursuit of the Manchester United centre-back Chris Smalling and are expected to submit a second bid for the 30-year-old this week.A first offer of £11m was rejected out of hand by United, who are hoping to bolster their transfer budget with at least £18m.

Roma have submitted a new and improved bid to Manchester United for Chris Smalling. The Giallorossi have made an offer of €15 million plus add-ons for the Englishman, adding add-ons to their previous offer of €15 million in order to persuade the Red Devils to let their centre-back go.Roma however are considering alternative options to Smalling, should an agreement with United not be reached.
Manchester United have reached an agreement with AS Roma for the transfer of defender Chris Smalling.
Inter Milan are keen on Manchester United defender Chris Smalling and could meet the Red Devils’ asking price of £20m this summer.

Manchester United defender Chris Smalling has been offered to Newcastle United and a clutch of other top-flight sides after Serie A outfit AS Roma spluttered over his £20million asking price.The England international spent last term on loan in Italy but has returned to Old Trafford this summer.

West Ham United are working on a deal to sign Juventus' Weston McKennie, 23, with talks having already taken place over the United States midfielder.According to football.insider, talks have already been held between McKennie’s representatives and West Ham, and the London club will consider launching an official bid for the midfielder in one of the upcoming transfer windows.ng already taken place over the United States midfielder.

Tottenham Hotspur have spoken to Juventus about the signing of Weston McKennie, and repeated sources now feel a move may be possible for under £40m. The Spurs hierarchy are keen to bring in a central midfielder, and the highly-rated American’s situation may allow a deal to be done as Juventus continue to rearrange their squad.
According to German outlet Kicker, Saints are eyeing up Schalke midfielder Weston McKennie as a replacement for Hojbjerg if the Dane is set to leave Southampton.

Southampton, managed by former Leipzig head coach Ralph Hasenhüttl, are seriously interested in signing Schalke youngster Weston McKennie, according to information acquired by Bild.
