Zinedine Zidane has made it clear to Real Madrid that he wants fellow Frenchman Ferland Mendy to arrive at the Santiago Bernabeu this summer after the left-back has impressed at Lyon.The left side of Madrid's defence has had a number of names linked to it, such as Real Betis' Junior Firpo, Alex Grimaldo of Benfica and David Alaba of Bayern Munich, but Mendy is the one Zidane wants.
Leicester are in talks with Monaco over a £20m deal for midfielder Youri Tielemans, Sky Sports News understands.

Leicester are closing in on the loan signing of Monaco midfielder Youri Tielemans.Tielemans, 21, flew into the Midlands on Wednesday to complete his medical, with Portuguese midfielder Adrien Silva, 29, going the other way.
Leicester City Football Club have agreed terms with AS Monaco for the loan of midfielder Youri Tielemans until the end of the 2018/19 season, subject to Premier League and international clearance.

Youri Tielemans will undergo a medical at Leicester on Saturday as the club near an agreement with Monaco for the midfielder, Sky Sports News has learned.Tielemans flew to Birmingham on Friday evening with a view to finalising the deal before Leicester travel to France next week for their pre-season training camp.
Leicester City Football Club have agreed terms with AS Monaco for the transfer of midfielder Youri Tielemans for an undisclosed fee, subject to Premier League and international clearance.

Tottenham are exploring the chances of signing Monaco midfielder Youri Tielemans, Sky Sports News has been told.One source close to the negotiations has confirmed they are in talks over a possible deal to bring the Belgian midfielder to north London - though another source close to the club has denied they've entered into negotiations for him.

A new candidate in Manchester City's search to sign a central defender has emerged, according to reports.City are looking for a new centre-back after the departure of club legend Vincent Kompany after 11 years. Pep Guardiola still has Aymeric Laporte, John Stones and Nicolas Otamendi to choose from, but that hasn't stopped the search for a fourth player to increase competition. The likes of Matthijs de Ligt and Harry Maguire have been linked as potential targets, but both will come at a cost and City will have to fight off plenty of interest if they wanted to sign either player. And now reports in Italy claim Roma's Greek defender Kostas Manolas has emerged as a target for Guardiola.

The €36 million clause in Kostas Manolas' Roma contract does not become active until after the January transfer window, according to reports.Manchester United have been linked with the 27-year-old Greece international as the Reds look to shore up their defence for the second half of the season.

Manchester United are closing in on a deal for Roma star Kostas Manolas, according to reports in Spain. The 27-year-old has a £30.75m release clause in his contract but it does not become active until the summer and United are unwilling to risk losing their man at the end of the season.

Costas Manolas is in Greece and the only thing left is for Olympiakos to announce the big return!The international central defender is in Greece for his return to the Port of his heart.There is a frenzy in the red and white classes. Thira 7, through its facebook page, invited the people to Alexandra Square, for the reception at the "Greek gamblers", as they characteristically mentioned.Corriere dello Sport wrote from the morning of Thursday (16/12) that the player is in Greece to negotiate with Olympiakos. However, it seems that the case was already ... a finished case since all that remained was the formalities.

Kostas Manolas is set to join Olympiacos from Napoli. Personal terms agreed - he already completed his medicals today in Greece, as per @DiMarzio. #OlympiacosFinal details to be sorted between clubs then the deal will be officially announced - as he’ll join in January.

Serie A giants Napoli have now decided that they will pay the release clause of Roma defender Kostas Manolas.Personal terms were already agreed with the defender and now the deal is only a step away from completion. The paying of the release clause will put the final details into the picture.

Yesterday the new AC Milan coach Marco Giampaolo met Paolo Maldini and the other leaders of the Rossoneri management and among the names discussed as potential reinforcements on the transfer market, there was also that of Kostas Manolas, a defender whom Giampaolo appreciates very much.Convinced that he can become a top defender at the international level, the manager approved Manolas and the Milan management informed itself about the situation of the Greek international in recent days. Mino Raiola is also involved, contacted directly by Paolo Maldini and Frederic Massara and the agent gave the go-ahead to the Rossoneri.

Man City are in pole position to sign Erling Haaland this summer – thanks to his father, Football Insider understands.A City source has told Football Insider the club and manager Pep Guardiola are big admirers of Haaland, 21, and they will be supported by the Abu Dhabi owners in a concerted pursuit.

Erling Haaland is believed to be interested in a move to Chelsea if the European champions can find a way of negotiating a deal with Borussia Dortmund – either for this summer or next.Telegraph Sport reported on Monday that Chelsea have not abandoned their interest in Haaland, despite Dortmund’s insistence the striker is not for sale this summer.It is understood that Chelsea are not only exploring the possibility of trying to sign Haaland this year, but also of setting up an agreement for next year if Dortmund remain determined to keep him for another 12 months.

Napoli are reportedly expecting Manchester United to secure the signing of RB Salzburg wonderkid Erling Haaland in January after deciding the striker is too expensive.The teenage sensation has netted a staggering 21 goals in 14 games this campaign, and has previously played under Red Devils manager boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer at Molde.According to Italian outlet Corriere dello Sport, the Italian club have pulled out a move for the 19-year-old as they believe they cannot compete with United financially.
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer 'sends personal scout' to watch Man Utd transfer target Erling Haaland

After the 3-2 victory of Dortmund over Hoffenheim with Halland littering the Vestafalos in the delays, as everything shows, they say goodbye to Dortmund on behalf of the biggest team of Madrid and owner of La Liga, Atlético Madrid.The Rochiblancos will withdraw from their funds an amount of around 150 million euros in order to dress the Norwegian striker of Dortmund in red and white.

Napoli are ready to jump into the race for Liverpool, Manchester United and Juventus target Erling Braut Haaland and are preparing to table an offer to Red Bull Salzburg.The 19-year-old striker’s Champions League exploits this season have attracted the attention of some of the biggest clubs in Europe.
Bayern Munich have reportedly joined several top European clubs in the race to sign Red Bull Salzburg striker Erling Braut Haaland.

According to reports in Italy, Juve sent the head of their scouting department, Matteo Tognozzi, to run the rule over Haaland in the San Paolo while Manchester United are naturally interested in the prolific teenager, who made his professional debut under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer at Molde and would provide a goal threat that has been absent Romelu Lukaku departed for Inter Milan.

Manchester United, Liverpool and Arsenal may have to be patient in their efforts to lure Red Bull Salzburg's prolific young striker Erling Braut Haaland.Real Madrid, Barcelona and Juventus have all launched plans to sign the 19-year old, whose valuation has rocketed beyond £80m, with 23 goals in 17 appearances to his name so far this season.However Sky Sports News has learned that the 6ft 4in Norwegian striker is also considering a proposal to stay affiliated to the RB group and join Bundesliga outfit RB Leipzig.Head coach Julian Nagelsmann, a known admirer of Haaland, sees him as a perfect fit in the youngest squad in the Bundesliga, and the player could be attracted by playing alongside other emerging talent like Timo Werner.

Erling Haaland has truly broken onto the European scene this season, with the Red Bull Salzburg striker scoring six goals in his first three Champions League matches.As such, that has caught the eye of Europe's elite clubs, including Real Madrid and Barcelona, as they consider a move for the 19-year-old striker.

Erling Haaland has truly broken onto the European scene this season, with the Red Bull Salzburg striker scoring six goals in his first three Champions League matches.As such, that has caught the eye of Europe's elite clubs, including Real Madrid and Barcelona, as they consider a move for the 19-year-old striker.
Perhaps a more ambitious target, Zapata has scored 16 Serie A goals for Atalanta this season and has the physicality to suit Premier League football.

The current mood surrounding Newcastle isn't the most positive to say the least, with grievances relating to the departure of Rafa Benitez, the failure to secure Salomon Rondon, and obviously, the general direction under Mike Ashley.However, one positive for United fans is rumours that Hoffenheim's Joelinton could well be heading for Tyneside.The club are linked with a move for the Brazilian, as they search for an alternative option to the Venezuelan striker who led the line for the Magpies so effectively last season. ChronicleLive first reported United's interest back in January, but if the club was to actually secure his signature, what would he bring to St James Park?

Newcastle are closing in on the signing of Hoffenheim striker Joelinton, Sky Sports News understands.Sky Sports News understands Newcastle have agreed a fee in the region of £40m with Hoffenheim and the Brazilian is on Tyneside finalising his move.

Newcastle United have completed the permanent signing of forward Joelinton from TSG 1899 Hoffenheim for an undisclosed club record fee.The 22-year-old becomes the Magpies’ first signing of the summer, putting pen to paper on a six-year deal which will keep him at St. James’ Park until the summer of 2025.

One of the more eye-catching stories from the paper talk this morning is Newcastle's links with Borussia Dortmund striker Paco Alcacer in The Sun. The former Barca striker has found chances limited this season and wants to move on loan ahead of Euro 2020. Newcastle are eyeing up a loan move with the option to sign him for £25million in the summer. Alcacer's former club Valencia are also sniffing around but may have to sell if they want to afford him.

Manchester United are reportedly keen on bringing Sevilla and France forward Wissam Ben Yedder to Old Trafford this summer.... Ben Yedder has attracted interest from United with the Premier League outfit willing to trigger his £35.9million release clause, according to ABC de Sevilla.The possible move is reportedly dependent on whether striker Romelu Lukaku, who has been linked to a switch to Inter Milan, departs Old Trafford.

Everton flop Moise Kean is close to sealing a return on loan to his former club Juventus after failing to adapt to Premier League football.The 20-year-old joined the Toffees for a fee of £27.5m last summer in a deal which many felt was a coup for the club.

Juventus are reportedly exploring the option of reuniting with Moise Kean as they brace themselves for Cristiano Ronaldo's shock summer departure.According to Italian news outlet SportItalia, Everton have given Kean the green light to re-join Juventus this summer, with the two clubs ready agree to a loan fee, which will include an obligation to buy in the deal.
Juventus are close to re-signing Moise Kean on a two-year loan with an obligation to buy the Everton forward for £17m.
Everton are in talks about a return to Juventus for striker Moise Kean.It is not yet clear whether the deal for the Italy international will be a loan with an obligation to buy.
Moise Kean is back home at Juventus upon completing his loan move from Everton

Inter Milan could make a move for Everton striker Moise Kean this summer, according to Sky in Italy.Kean has not settled on Merseyside after joining Everton from Juventus for around £27m in 2019, with the forward going on loan to PSG last season where he scored 13 goals in 26 appearances.It was expected the 21-year-old Italy international would join the French club on a permanent deal this summer.

Paris Saint-Germain are in talks with Everton over a potential loan deal for striker Moise Kean.The agreement could include an option for the Ligue 1 champions to buy the 20-year-old at the end of the loan.

Everton striker Moise Kean is poised to join Paris St-Germain on loan until the end of the season.The 20-year-old Italy international has failed to make an impact on Merseyside since joining Everton in a £27m deal from Juventus in the summer of 2019.He will now try to re-ignite his career at PSG, who are understood to have an option to buy Kean at the end of his loan period.

Paris Saint-Germain is pleased to announce the arrival of Moise Kean from Everton FC. The 20-year-old Italian striker is on loan to the capital club until 30 June 2021. The loan does not come with option to buy.

Everton are on the hunt for a new striker this summer and that has inevitably got them looking around Europe.Marcel Brands has a specific set of requirements, though, particularly when it comes to the player’s age.The Dutchman prefers signing younger, talented players with a high resale value, which led him to target Juventus youngster Moise Kean.

Everton are in talks to sign Juventus striker Moise Kean, Sky Sports News understands.The Serie A club are looking for €40M (£36M) for the 19-year-old and also want a buy-back clause inserted into any deal.

Everton have agreed a transfer fee of £27.5m, potentially rising to £36.6m with Juventus for striker Moise Kean, according to Sky in ItalyThe 19-year old Italy international could earn around £52,000 per week, it is reported, with a medical possible as early as Wednesday.The deal is expected to include a buy-back clause for Juve, and the fee could potentially rise to £36.6m.
Moise Kean has signed for Everton from Juventus for an undisclosed fee, agreeing a five-year deal until the end of June 2024.

Arsenal have joined the race to sign Juventus forward Moise Kean and have made contact with his agent Mino Raiola. The last player to make a big move from Turin to the Gunners was Thierry Henry and Emery will be hoping Kean can make as big an impact if the Premier League side can get a deal over the line.

Everton are keen to sell Moise Kean in the summer - the negotiations will start around €50m. PSG are working to sign him on a permanent deal but negotiating on the price - Italian clubs would join the race only if PSG won’t find an agreement.

RMC report that Ligue 1 side PSG are in negotiations to sign attacking midfielder Pablo Sarabia from Sevilla.The Spaniard has an €18m release clause that Les Parisiens are hoping to activate by the 30th June, per the outlet.The player is not a new target, but talks are expected to accelerate in the coming days. Sarabia has been in talks with PSG for several weeks, discussions that had been initiated by Antero Henrique and have since been picked up again by Leonardo, the club’s new Sporting Director.

Everton have asked about Valencia striker Maxi Gomez to add a striker to Carlo Ancelotti's summer spending.Gomez, 24, will be allowed to leave the Mestalla ahead of the transfer deadline in October as the Spanish club look to trim their squad to cut costs.Ancelotti has made moves for Allan and Abdoulaye Doucoure for his midfield and playmaker James Rodriguez but would also welcome an out-and-out striker and has interest in Gomez.

West Ham have lined up Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez as a potential replacement for Marko Arnautovic if he leaves the club, Sky Sports News understands.The Hammers held talks with the Spanish side over Gomez in the summer, but felt Celta Vigo were demanding too much money for the 22-year-old Uruguay international.

West Ham have offered to meet Celta Vigo the £44.85m (€50m) release clause for striker Maxi Gomez, according to Sky sources.Sky Sports News understands discussions are ongoing with regards to the method of payment.
West Ham United hope to find out this week whether or not they have been successful in trying to convince Maxi Gómez to turn down Valencia and move to the London Stadium.

West Ham's deal to sign Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez is off, according to Sky sources.West Ham offered Celta Vigo the £45m release clause but could not agree a payment structure.Gomez is now close to a move to Valencia, who have offered cash and players as part of the deal.

West Ham are still in talks with Celta Vigo over the signing of Maxi Gomez, Sky Sports News understands.Celta Vigo are unwilling to sell the 22-year-old in the January window unless the player's £43.3m release clause is met.

West Ham are considering whether to trigger Maxi Gomez's £43.3m release clause at Spanish side Celta Vigo.The Hammers have had one bid rejected for the 22-year-old Uruguay striker, who has scored nine goals this season.
West Ham are closing in on a deal to sign Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez, according to Sky sources.Sky Sports News understands West Ham are prepared to meet the player's £43.2m release clause.

West Ham are close to agreeing a deal with Celta Vigo that would see striker Maxi Gomez arrive in the summer, Sky Sports News understands.West Ham are hopeful of capturing Gomez's signature although the Uruguay international will remain at Celta Vigo for the rest of the season.
West Ham are continuing talks with Celta Vigo over striker Maxi Gomez, with the clubs trying to finalise a deal for the summer.

West Ham will renew their interest in Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez this summer.Gomez has a £43.5million release clause in his contract at Celta Vigo. West Ham identified the 22-year-old Uruguay striker as their top target to replace Marko Arnautavic if he left in January. They opted against a move but Pellegrini and director of football Mario Husillos have been keeping tabs on Gomez since then.

West Ham have made further enquiries about Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez and his teammate midfielder Stanislav Lobotka.The pair are valued at £58million by the Spanish club and Gomez has strong interest from Valencia.
West Ham will step up their pursuit of Maxi Gomez after an opening £25million bid for the Celta Vigo striker was rejected.

Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez wants to join West Ham but personal terms have yet to be agreed, according to Sky sources.West Ham had a £29m offer for the 22-year-old, who has been a target for the Hammers since last summer, accepted in June.
West Ham have made a dramatic late bid to hijack Valencia’s move for Maxi Gomez after deciding to cut their losses on Marko Arnautovic and sell him to China.

Maxi Gomez has emerged as a potential transfer target for Aston Villa this summer.Claims have been made in Spain that the claret and blues have registered an interest in the Celta Vigo forward, who has also been linked with West Ham United previously.

Tottenham are monitoring Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez.The 22-year-old was a January target for West Ham who remain keen but the Uruguayan is keen to play for a club in European competition.Vigo have placed a £43.5million clause in Gomez's contract and expect to field lower offers for a player who has scored 11 goals this season.

Maxi Gómez is on Tottenham's agenda to bolster their attack for the new season. Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino is a big fan of the Uruguayan striker and club chairman Daniel Levy would be willing to negotiate a transfer fee with Celta de Vigo. According to reports by Playingfor90, Tottenham are hopeful that they could land the 22-year-old for a lower price than his buy-out with Celta which is set at 50 million euros. Levy however, would definitely not be willing to meet the player's buy-out in full.
TOTTENHAM are leading the race to sign Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez – with West Ham and Liverpool all but out of the running.

Valencia are actively pursuing a deal for Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez with Santi Mina potentially going the other way, report Marca.The Uruguayan striker netted 17 goals in La Liga last season in his first campaign in European football, leading to a series of top European clubs monitoring his progress.The striker’s contract at the Galician club contains a €50m release clause but Celta are said to be trying to negotiate to include Mina in a deal plus an upfront fee of €25m.

Wales midfielder Aaron Ramsey is set to leave Juventus but has yet to decide where to go, with Rangers one of the clubs he could join.The former Arsenal player, 31, has been frozen out of the first-team picture at Juve and has not appeared since making a substitute appearance in the Champions League on 20 October.
Aaron Ramsey is in Glasgow for a medical to join Rangers on loan from Juventus.The Wales midfielder, 31, has been in talks with the Scottish Premiership leaders, who visit Celtic on Wednesday.
RANGERS are delighted to announce the loan signing of Wales international midfielder Aaron Ramsey from Juventus until the end of the season.

Aaron Ramsey swap eyed.With Thomas Partey and Mohamed Elneny set to out of action for a month while they are at the African Cup of Nations, midfield recruits may also be required.Arsenal are reportedly considering a swap deal with Juventus involving Aaron Ramsey and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Juventus confirm former Arsenal midfielder Aaron Ramsey is available for transfer with Newcastle, Crystal Palace, and Aston Villa ready to swoop
Juventus are willing to let Wales midfielder Aaron Ramsey leave for free in January despite having 18 months remaining on his contract.

The Daily Mirror report the Wales international is surplus to requirements for new Juve manager Andrea Pirlo.Former Gunner Ramsey apparently doesn't fit into his plans for the team, has been told he is free to find a new club and is being linked with Everton

Manchester United have been linked with a swap deal for Juventus star Aaron Ramsey with the future of Paul Pogba uncertain.Manchester United could sign Aaron Ramsey with Juventus willing to let the former Arsenal man leave if they were to secure the return of Paul Pogba in a blockbuster swap deal.
Eintracht Frankfurt attacker Ante Rebic has left the Bundesliga club to join AC Milan on a two-year loan deal, with Andre Silva leaving Serie A to replace him in Germany.
Atletico Madrid are closing in on the signing of Eintracht Frankfurt player Ante Rebic in a deal worth €40m, according to reports.
LIVERPOOL and Arsenal are ready to launch bids for Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Thorgan Hazard.
LIVERPOOL and Arsenal are ready to launch bids for Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Thorgan Hazard.

Thorgan Hazard agrees terms with Borussia Dortmund ahead of summer move.Hazard has always been Borussia Dortmund’s preferred candidate to replace Christian Pulisic, who will leave for Chelsea in the summer. His pace, directness, versatility and Bundesliga experience make him the ideal signing for Borussia Dortmund.

Belgian forward Thorgan Hazard has confirmed that he has reached a 'personal agreement' with Borussia Dortmund over his transfer from Borussia Mönchengladbach. However, the clubs are yet to agree on a fee for the player.

Manchester City are close to a deal that will see Juventus right-back Joao Cancelo move to the Etihad, with Danilo heading in the opposite direction, Sky Sports News understands.Sky in Italy say City will pay £27.5m for the 25-year-old Portugal international, who joined Juventus one year ago from Valencia.

For the past few seasons there has been a revolving door at the right back position on Inter’s squad. The nerazzurri are already at work to find the right profile for next season and have started talks with Manchester City for Danilo.The former Porto defender has already expressed willing press to join the Italian club which paved the way to talks with Manchester City, Inter are willing to offer between €20 and €22 million, while the Citizens value him at €30 million- the gap between the offer and demand could be bridged rather easily brining a positive conclusion to the negotiation. In addition at the moment Inter are offering Danilo less than his current wages of €4.5 million plus €500k in bonuses.

Danilo has hinted that he will be at Manchester City next season, despite rumours linking him with a move to Inter Milan.For the second successive season, Danilo has played back-up to Kyle Walker at right back, while Oleks Zinchenko has been preferred as a deputy left-back when Benjamin Mendy has been out.The Brazilian has impressed whenever he has been given the opportunity, but it seems likely that he will be a fringe player again next season.That has prompted reports claiming he is close to a move away from City, with Inter Milan said to be close to completing a deal. Some reports have even suggested Danilo has agreed personal terms and the two clubs just need to agree a fee.

One of the more eye-catching stories from the paper talk this morning is Newcastle's links with Borussia Dortmund striker Paco Alcacer in The Sun. The former Barca striker has found chances limited this season and wants to move on loan ahead of Euro 2020. Newcastle are eyeing up a loan move with the option to sign him for £25million in the summer. Alcacer's former club Valencia are also sniffing around but may have to sell if they want to afford him.

Manchester United may be lining up a late bid for Cagliari midfielder Nicolo Barella, who has also been a target for Chelsea this month.According to Gazzetta Dello Sport via Goal, United are prepared to table a £50 million bid for the 21-year-old before the January window closes.This surprise transfer swoop could see the Red Devils beat Chelsea to Barella’s signature, who had been hoping to bring him in as a direct replacement for Cesc Fabregas after he joined AS Monaco two weeks ago.
Chelsea have identified Cagliari midfielder Nicolo Barella as a January transfer target as they prepare for the departure of Cesc Fabregas.

Cagliari midfielder Nicolo Barella is on Chelsea's shortlist as they target a replacement for Cesc Fabregas, according to Sky sources.The 21-year-old Italy international, who is under contract at the Serie A side until 2022, could cost the Blues as much as £45m.

[...]Fabregas is completing his move to Monaco on a three-and-a-half-year deal as Chelsea deliberate over whether or not to sign Nicolo Barella or Leandro Paredes as the Spaniard’s replacement.Chelsea have agreed deals in principle for both Cagliari’s Barella and Zenit St Petersburg’s Paredes, but are considering which man would best replace Fabregas or, if in fact, they need a new midfielder.

Manchester United have reportedly identified Barcelona goalkeeper Jasper Cillessen as a top target as they eye a replacement for David De Gea.The Spaniard is being heavily linked with a summer move away from Old Trafford after a tough season having failed to agree a big-money contract extension.
Barcelona and Valencia have reached a ‘total agreement’ for a direct swap deal for goalkeepers Jasper Cillessen and Neto, report El Mundo Deportivo.

Barcelona goalkeeper Jasper Cillessen has agreed a deal to join Portuguese champions Benfica, but negotiations over price are holding up the transfer.Goal understands that the Blaugrana are demanding €25 million (£22m/$28m) for the Netherlands international despite him having barely appeared for the first team over the past two seasons.

Tottenham are working on a loan deal for Juventus winger Dejan Kulusevski, to be made permanent in the summer.After failing to bring in Wolves' Adama Traore and Porto's Luis Diaz, Tottenham have turned to 21-year-old Kulusevski to bolster Antonio Conte's squad.

Dejan Kulusevski to Tottenham, here we go! He’ll fly to London today. Total agreement reached with JuventusDeal will be around €40m plus add ons - including loan fee and buy clause that could become mandatory in case of UCL qualification/certain number of appearences.

Tottenham are set to complete the double signing of Juventus pair Dejan Kulusevski and Rodrigo Bentancur as part of a frantic deadline day in north London.Kulusevski, a Sweden international, flew to the capital last night and completed his medical, and the 21-year-old was this morning working with Spurs' content team at Hotspur Way before being officially unveiled as Antonio Conte's first signing.

We are delighted to announce the signing of Dejan Kulusevski from Juventus, subject to international clearance and a work permit.The attacking midfielder joins us on an 18-month loan with an option to buy from the Serie A side.

Manchester United have spoken to the agent of Dejan Kulusevski as they prepare another bid for the midfielder amid interest from Arsenal and Liverpool .That's according to respected Italian football journalist Nicolo Schira, who says Inter Milan have also met the Parma star's representative with a view to a New Year deal.United have already made a bid of 25million euros (£21m) for the 19-year-old, according to Italian source FCInterNews .

Newcastle have agreed a £12m fee plus add-ons with Atletico Madrid for England full-back Kieran Trippier.The 31-year-old is set to be Newcastle's first signing under their new Saudi owners - and first for new manager Eddie Howe since he took charge in November.Trippier (...) will have a medical on Wednesday.

Newcastle United are delighted to confirm the signing of England full-back Kieran Trippier from Atlético Madrid for an undisclosed fee.The 31-year-old has agreed terms on a two-and-a-half-year deal and becomes the first senior signing under the club's owners and head coach Eddie Howe.
ARSENAL are ready to revive their interest in Kieran Trippier - but need Atletico Madrid to slash their asking price.
Kieran Trippier is among the players Manchester United will consider when they look to strengthen at right-back.- subscription required -

Manchester United have resurrected their interest in Atletico Madrid right-back Kieran Trippier.United parked plans to move for Trippier in the January transfer window after he was suspended for breaching betting regulations but are now considering a formal bid. Trippier, 30, is out of contract at Atletico next year and is understood to have made arrangements to permanently return to England.

Kieran Trippier has let slip to England colleagues that he is keen to join Manchester United this summer.The 30-year-old right-back won La Liga with Atletico Madrid last season but has told pals in the Three Lions set-up that he is open to a move to Old Trafford.United want Trippier to provide competition for Aaron Wan Bissaka, and believe a fee of between £15million and £20m should be enough to convince Atletico to do business.
Manchester United have had an opening bid to buy Kieran Trippier turned down by Atlético Madrid. La Liga’s champions want about €40m (£34.4m) to sell the England full-back.

Manchester United are looking to bolster their squad ahead of the new season and, (...) they are now eyeing a double swoop for Real Madrid centre-back Raphael Varane and Atletico Madrid right-back Kieran Trippier.Trippier, (...) is now keen on returning to the Manchester area, with his move thought to be worth around 21 million euros.

Kieran Trippier expects any move to Manchester United to materialise towards the end of the transfer window. Trippier, 30, has entered the last year of his Atletico Madrid contract and wants to join boyhood club United, having arranged for his family to relocate to Manchester.

The England right back also has interest from Everton. He has two years left on contract but cash-strapped Atletico are open to offersTripper, 30, has just two years left on his current deal and despite enjoying a hugely successful season, could be offloaded as Atletico Madrid continue to feel the repercussions the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic has had.
Aston Villa keen to sign Kieran Trippier from Atletico Madrid to bolster defenceTrippier, 29, moved to Spain from Tottenham a year ago and has two years left on his contract at Wanda Metropolitano

Tottenham's Kieran Trippier is on a shortlist of right-back targets at Bayern Munich, Sky Sports News understands.The Bundesliga champions are looking for a new full-back option this summer and have scouted the 28-year-old.
Atletico Madrid have joined Napoli by showing interest in Tottenham right back Kieran Trippier.

Kieran Trippier is set to find himself at the centre of a tug-of-war between Atletico Madrid and Napoli.Both clubs are interested in the England right-back for whom Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino is willing to listen to offers this summer.

According to Gazzetta dello Sport on Wednesday, said bid has now arrived, as Atlético Madrid are said to have put ‘€25m + bonuses’ on Spurs’ desk to try and convince Daniel Levy to let Mauricio Pochettino’s starting right-back leave in the summer.No information has appeared about Tottenham’s reply to the bid, who could very well be waiting until after June 1st (Champions League final) to deal with anything transfer related.

Tottenham's England right-back Kieran Trippier is close to completing a £20m move to Spanish side Atletico Madrid.The 28-year-old joined Spurs from Burnley in June 2015 and has played more than 100 times for the club, with his last appearance coming in the Champions League final in June.He later admitted he was not sure he would see out his contract, which was due to expire in 2022.

Kieran Trippier has departed Tottenham.The right-back has left Spurs and joined Spanish giants Atletico Madrid in a deal thought to be in the region of £20million.Trippier has signed a three-year contract at the Wanda Metropolitano.
Atlético de Madrid and Tottenham Hotspur have reached an agreement over the transfer of Kieran Trippier. The 28-year-old has signed a contract for the next three seasons.
Tottenham Hotspur are braced for a bid from Juventus for Kieran Trippier and are willing to sell the right-back for around £25 million.
Atletico Madrid have joined Napoli by showing interest in Tottenham right back Kieran Trippier.
Napoli boss Carlo Ancelotti has admitted the club are "evaluating" Tottenham's Kieran Trippier as a potential summer signing.

Kieran Trippier is set to find himself at the centre of a tug-of-war between Atletico Madrid and Napoli.Both clubs are interested in the England right-back for whom Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino is willing to listen to offers this summer.

Napoli are in pole position to sign Kieran Trippier from Tottenham Hotspur this summer. The England right-back will be allowed to leave White Hart Lane for the right offer, and the Italian side are confident of reaching a deal for a fee of roughly £25m.

Tottenham will reportedly demand £40million for Kieran Trippier this summer, as Manchester United eye a move for the England defender.The 28-year-old’s performances in north London have caught the attention of Premier League rivals United and Italian giants Napoli.According to the Daily Express, Trippier will be one of a number of departures at Tottenham in the summer, with Spurs valuing the defender at £40m.Ole Gunnar Solskjaer wants to rebuild his Manchester United squad at the end of the season, with the Red Devils struggling after an initial fine run under the former caretaker boss.Defensive reinforcements will be at the top of Solskjaer’s wish-list and Trippier is being heavily linked with a move to the Theatre of Dreams.
KIERAN TRIPPIER is keen to join Manchester United this summer.

Newcastle confident of signing Kieran Trippier from Atlético for about £25m. Newcastle United are increasingly confident of signing Kieran Trippier from Atlético Madrid by the end of the week and hope to open formal negotiations with the 31-year-old England right-back within the next 48 hours.

Everton are leading the race to sign Juventus midfielder Adrien Rabiot, according to reports.The 25-year-old has endured an underwhelming first campaign in Turin, having joined the club from Paris Saint-Germain just summer, and may already be set to leave this summer.
New Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta could move for Juventus midfielder Adrien Rabiot on loan in January as he looks to strengthen his options.

Juventus are ready to offer Adrien Rabiot as part of a deal to bring Christian Eriksen to Turin in the January transfer window, according to reports.The French midfielder has struggled to secure a regular place in Juve's starting XI and is behind the likes of Miralem Pjanic, Blaise Matuidi, Sami Khedira and Aaron Ramsey in the pecking order.

Manchester United are still monitoring Adrien Rabiot as he prepares to leave Paris Saint-Germain on a free transfer.Rabiot, 24, has not played for PSG since December amid his refusal to sign a new contract and the MEN understands United remain interested in signing the France international as he decides on his next club.

Manchester United have reportedly made a lucrative offer for Adrien Rabiot.Mirror Sport reported earlier this month that Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was weighing up a move for Rabiot, who is out of contract at PSG this summer.
TOTTENHAM boss Mauricio Pochettino is reportedly set to hold transfer talks with Barcelona target Adrien Rabiot tonight.
Chelsea have reportedly contacted PSG over a potential deal for Adrien Rabiot.The French midfielder is out of contract this summer and will not be signing a new deal with the Ligue 1 champions.
Internazionale are willing to end Alexis Sanchez's disaster of a spell at Manchester United - but only if the Chilean drastically drops his demands.

Alexis Sanchez’s agent has reportedly offered the Manchester United forward to Inter, but any potential deal would be difficult due to the high costs involved.According to the Gazzetta dello Sport, Fernando Felicevich has been in Milan in recent days working on the feasibility of a summer move.

Internazionale now face competition from Juventus for the signature of Alexis Sanchez, as it now seems likelier his Manchester United nightmare will end this summer.There have now been concrete meetings between intermediaries and both clubs.
Inter Milan have enquired about the prospect of signing Manchester United’s misfit striker Alexis Sanchez on a season long loan before the Italian transfer window closes on September 2.

Inter Milan are keen on keeping Manchester United’s expensive striker Alexis Sanchez.The Serie A club secured a short extension to Sanchez’s loan deal so that he could see out the rescheduled domestic season at the San Siro but that is due to expire in early August.Now Inter’s chief executive Giuseppe Marotta has admitted he wants Sanchez to stay on their books to play in the Europa League and did not rule out the possibility of a permanent move. (...)Marotta told Sky Italia Sport: “This situation is an anomaly, considering the outcome of the entire Europa League can be affected by the absence or otherwise of individual players.“This hasn’t been resolved yet. We are working on it and we want to keep hold of him for at least the rest of the Europa League.”
Inter Milan are keen to sign Alexis Sanchez on a permanent transfer but a deal could hinge on Manchester United’s willingness to give their misfit striker a pay-off.

Alexis Sanchez appears set for a permanent move from Manchester United to Inter Milan and has reportedly already agreed personal terms with the Serie A giants.The 31-year-old has spent the season on loan with the club and, despite suffering injury problems, has largely been a success.
Alexis joins Inter on a permanent dealEveryone at Manchester United wishes Alexis Sanchez all the best in his future career as he joins Inter Milan on a permanent transfer.

Palmeiras have expressed interest in Manchester United striker Alexis Sanchez.Local reporter Jorge Nicola has revealed Palmeiras, the current Brazilian Serie A champions, were interested in a move for the former Udinese and Barcelona man.However, he added that the possibility of Sanchez joining the club has been "completely ruled out" by United, who were seemingly unhappy with the terms on offer from Palmeiras, who were taken aback by just how much the forward earns.It is claimed that Sanchez makes "six times the salary" of the best paid player at Palmeiras, with the Brazilian club unable to offer United a deal that didn't include the Premier League side still paying the vast majority of his wages.

Internazionale now face competition from Juventus for the signature of Alexis Sanchez, as it now seems likelier his Manchester United nightmare will end this summer.There have now been concrete meetings between intermediaries and both clubs.

Newcastle have this evening agreed a fee with Leicester for the sale of Ayoze Perez.Sky Sports News understands Leicester have a deal in place to buy the Spaniard for £30m subject to a medical and personal terms being agreed.
Leicester City Football Club is delighted to confirm the signing of Spanish forward Ayoze Pérez for an undisclosed fee, subject to Premier League and international clearance.
Arsenal boss Unai Emery is keen on bringing Newcastle forward Ayoze Perez to Emirates Stadium at the end of the season.

NAPOLI are ready to do battle this summer with the clubs in Spain looking to prise Ayoze Perez away from Newcastle United.The Spaniard’s 12-goal return in the Premier League this season has seen his value soar to greater heights than at any other stage of his career.

ARSENAL EYE KESSIEArsenal have made a further enquiry about the availability of AC Milan midfielder Franck Kessie but might face competition from West Ham, according to The Sun.Mikel Arteta is keen to strengthen his squad in January with a midfielder among his priorities.

Wolves appear to have beaten Arsenal and Tottenham to the signing of AC Milan midfield general Franck Kessie, with just personal terms yet to be agreed, a report claims.SempreMilan, via SportItalia’s Alfredo Pedulla, claim that a bid of €25 million plus €3 million in add-ons has been greenlit by the Rossoneri.The Ivory Coast international’s future at AC Milan appeared to be uncertain under new manager Marco Giampaolo, with the Italian reportedly having the final say on whether Kessie’s future would remain at the San Siro.
WEST HAM are ready to fight Arsenal and Tottenham for AC Milan star Franck Kessie.

Barcelona have already starting preparing for next season, and attention has turned to the free transfer market for the summer of 2022, with a number of bargains to be had, few more impactful than Franck Kessie, who is in line to reinforce the Blaugrana's midfield. Los Cules have been following the Ivorian for some time, and he is also interested in the move, despite interest from Paris Saint-Germain and Liverpool.

AC Milan have made their stance on Franck Kessie clear amid speculation Gennaro Gattuso could try and bring him to Napoli, a report claims.TMW (via MilanNews.it) then reported that Rino has already informed president Aurelio De Laurentiis of who he wants as his first purchase: Milan midfielder Franck Kessie.

Tottenham will push to sign a striker this month as they react to the long‑term absence of Harry Kane and have joined the chase for Milan’s Krzysztof Piatek.Milan, who have re-signed Zlatan Ibrahimovic, are prepared to sell Piatek, a 24-year-old Poland forward, if they can recoup the £30m they paid to take him from Genoa last January.An expensive permanent deal would not appear to suit Spurs or, indeed, Newcastle and Aston Villa, who have also shown an interest in Piatek. The Premier League clubs would prefer a loan. Milan do not want that but it remains to be seen whether their position changes in the countdown to the 31 January deadline.

Milan, Aston Villa's offer for PiatekYesterday there was a meeting between Milan and the Aston Villa officials. The ds of the British club flew to Italy to deal directly with the Rossoneri. Offer submitted: outright transfer for 30 million euro. Now the ball passes to Milan who will evaluate Aston Villa's offer.
please don't shoot the messenger, but he's [Piatek] not a target. Reina is on a list of possible gk's

Piatek joined Milan in January, arriving in a €35million deal from fellow Serie A side Genoa, where he had an explosive start to the season.The Poland international netted 22 goals in Serie A last season including nine for the Rossoneri, however he has struggled for form since the end of the last campaign.The 24-year-old did score his first goal from open play of the 2019-20 season off the bench against Lecce, and it is hoped that new head coach Stefano Pioli can get him back firing again.According to Calciomercato.com, Piatek has been linked with a move to Premier League side Chelsea in recent weeks, but the London club have taken no concrete steps towards trying to sign him.The report continues to add that Milan would ask for at least €35million if an approach were to be made at present.
AC Milan striker Krzysztof Piatek is the latest forward to be linked with a January switch to Manchester United.

Tottenham are in advanced negotiations to sign Cristian Romero and Pierluigi Gollini from Atalanta, football.london understands. Joining Juventus in 2019 from Genoa before returning to them on loan, last September the 23-year-old signed a two-year loan deal with Atalanta, who have the option to buy the player for €16million (£13.8m).It is believed that Atalanta will exercise their option to purchase the talented player a year early, with Paratici then in negotiations with the Italian side to sell to Tottenham for a generous profit.

Tottenham have stepped up talks with Atalanta over a deal for centre-back Cristian Romero.Spurs have made an offer of at least £34m (€40m) plus £8.5m (€10) in bonuses - but he is not their only centre-back target and the club will not overpay for the Argentine.

Tottenham are stepping up their attempts to land Atalanta centre-back Cristian Romero. (...)Romero, 23, is Spurs’ primary target to strengthen the heart of Nuno Espirito Santo’s defence for the start of the season in three weeks. They are negotiating a deal with his Italian club, who have loaned him from Juventus with an obligation to buy at the end of the campaign.
Tottenham have had an offer for defender Cristian Romero accepted by Atalanta, talkSPORT understands.Spurs have agreed to pay £43million, plus add-ons, for the Argentine centre-back.

Tottenham have agreed a deal with Atalanta to sign Cristian Romero.Spurs increased their offer to £42.7m (€50m) plus bonuses, making a total package worth £47m (€55m) for the Argentina centre-back.Romero, 23, will fly to London in the next 24 hours to complete his move, before agreeing personal terms on a five-year deal.
Tottenham are expected to complete the signing of Cristian Romero from Atalanta on Friday, with the Argentina centre-back due in London on Thursday to finalise his £47million move.
We are delighted to announce the signing of Cristian Romero from Atalanta.Cristian will wear the number four shirt.

Sevilla defender Jules Kounde's potential transfer to Chelsea is hanging in the balance as the La Liga side hold out for more than £43m (€50m) for the player.A deal close to that figure has already been agreed but Sevilla are now thought to be asking for nearer the player's £68.5m (€80m) release clause.The Spanish club turned down a €55m offer from a Premier League side last summer and are also keen to line-up a replacement before they let Kounde go.

Jules Kounde's potential departure from Sevilla this summer is growing increasingly less likely, as his club have made their position clear to Chelsea either pay 80 million euros or he will stay put.Chelsea have not made a new offer in the last few hours and Sevilla believe that this will remain the case until the end of the window.

The club want to sign at least one central defender and have included Sevilla’s Jules Koundé among their targets. The 22-year-old, part of France’s Euro 2020 squad, is expected to be sold for less than his €80m (£69m) release clause.

Manchester United have added Sevilla's Jules Kounde to their list of targets with manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer not ruling out a move for a centre-back in January if his problems in defence do not improve, sources have told ESPN.Kounde, 21, is considered an option to strengthen the defence in January or next summer but any move is likely to rely on United moving on at least two of the centre-backs already at Old Trafford.

Manchester City are looking at a deal for Sevilla centre-back Jules Koundé which could see Nicolas Otamendi move in the opposite direction.Koundé, 21, has been earmarked by Real Madrid and Barcelonas as a target for future windows but City are considering him to bolster Pep Guardiola's defence ahead of the October 5 transfer deadline.The France Under-21 international played a key role in Sevilla winning the Europa League last month and has a £68.25 million release clause which makes his market valuation fall within the price bracket City pay for their first-team signings.

Manchester City have had a 55 million euro bid for Jules Kounde rejected by Sevilla.The French centre-back was one of the great breakthrough stars in LaLiga Santander last season after signing from Bordeaux.After City's bid was first reported in the English press, MARCA can confirm that Sevilla have rejected the offer.

Sevilla remain braced for a second, improved bid from Manchester City for Jules Kounde, sources have told ESPN, despite reports that City have turned their attention to Benfica's Ruben Dias.The La Liga club rejected an initial €55 million City offer for centre-back Kounde last week, believing they'll be able to sell him for more next summer.However, sources told ESPN that if City were to raise their bid to €65 or €70m, Sevilla would find it extremely difficult to refuse in the challenging, post COVID-19 financial environment.

rystal Palace are close to completing the signing of Lyon defender Joachim Andersen as Patrick Vieira continues to rebuild the squad in south London.Standard Sport understands Andersen, who was also a target for London rivals Tottenham this summer, will cost an initial €22million, with €5million in add-ons to follow.

The 29-year-old’s deal expires at the end of the season and he is believed to have committed to Paris St Germain over another option

Paris Saint-Germain is pleased to announce the arrival of Ander Herrera Agüera. The Spanish midfielder comes to Paris after his contract ended at Manchester United and has signed a five-year contract with the capital club until 30 June 2024.

Arsenal are ready to rival Paris Saint-Germain for Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera and have registered their interest in the Spaniard, according to reports.Herrera is out of contract at Old Trafford this summer, when he can leave the club on a free transfer, and has already received a £150,000-a-week contract offer from PSG.The 29-year-old insists he is yet to decide where he will play his future next season, and now the Daily Mail claim Arsenal are hoping to lure him to the Emirates.

Tottenham are working on a loan deal for Juventus winger Dejan Kulusevski, to be made permanent in the summer.After failing to bring in Wolves' Adama Traore and Porto's Luis Diaz, Tottenham have turned to 21-year-old Kulusevski to bolster Antonio Conte's squad.

Dejan Kulusevski to Tottenham, here we go! He’ll fly to London today. Total agreement reached with JuventusDeal will be around €40m plus add ons - including loan fee and buy clause that could become mandatory in case of UCL qualification/certain number of appearences.

Tottenham are set to complete the double signing of Juventus pair Dejan Kulusevski and Rodrigo Bentancur as part of a frantic deadline day in north London.Kulusevski, a Sweden international, flew to the capital last night and completed his medical, and the 21-year-old was this morning working with Spurs' content team at Hotspur Way before being officially unveiled as Antonio Conte's first signing.

We are delighted to announce the signing of Dejan Kulusevski from Juventus, subject to international clearance and a work permit.The attacking midfielder joins us on an 18-month loan with an option to buy from the Serie A side.

Manchester United have spoken to the agent of Dejan Kulusevski as they prepare another bid for the midfielder amid interest from Arsenal and Liverpool .That's according to respected Italian football journalist Nicolo Schira, who says Inter Milan have also met the Parma star's representative with a view to a New Year deal.United have already made a bid of 25million euros (£21m) for the 19-year-old, according to Italian source FCInterNews .

Leicester City midfielder Dennis Praet is to reportedly set to undergo a medical at Serie A side Torino today (Monday).City reportedly received an "official proposal" from Torino for midfielder Dennis Praet which, according to Italian journalist Fabrizio Romano, was an initial loan with an option to buy Praet for €15m.
Leicester City midfielder Dennis Praet will spend the 2021/22 season on loan at Serie A side Torino, subject to international clearance.

Leicester are interested in signing Sampdoria midfielder Dennis Praet, according to Sky in Italy.The 25-year-old is likely to cost the Foxes more than £15m, and AC Milan and Valencia are also understood to be keen.

Leicester are set to complete the signing of the Sampdoria midfielder Dennis Praet for €20m (£18.4m). The 25-year-old Belgian has agreed a five-year contract with Brendan Rodgers’ side and will move to the King Power Stadium if the clubs can agree on the final details of the deal.
Leicester City Football Club have agreed terms with Sampdoria for the transfer of attacking midfielder Dennis Praet, subject to Premier League and international clearance.

Arsenal have submitted a €42 million (£37m) offer to sign Sampdoria duo Dennis Praet and Joachim Andersen, according to reports in Italy.Unai Emery has been given a restricted budget of around £40m to work with in the summer transfer window after missing out on a place in next season’s Champions League.

ARSENAL have been told they must pay at least £44m for Sampdoria pair Dennis Praet and Joachim Andersen.Gunners sources yesterday laughed off as "nonsense" reports from Italy that Unai Emery’s side have already bid for the pair.But it is an open secret that the Arsenal boss has both players on a long list of potential summer targets.

Arsenal are close to completing a double swoop for Sampdoria stars Dennis Praet and Joachim Andersen, according to reports in Italy.The Gunners are said to be splashing £42million on midfielder Praet and defender Andersen.La Gazzetta dello Sport claim Arsenal have ‘taken steps forward’ to finalise a deal for the duo.
Valencia are holding talks with Sampdoria over a potential €15m deal for midfielder and Belgian international Dennis Praet, say reports.

Milan have shown interest in Sampdoria pair Dennis Praet and Joachim Andersen. Ever since the links between Milan and Sampdoria manager Giampaolo gained steam, so has this rumor.Dennis Praet was one of the top performers from last season playing 34 matches and scoring twice with three assists. He was given an average rating of 7.0 by Whoscored for the entire season.

Real Betis and Roma have reached an agreement for the transfer of goalkeeper Pau Lopez.After negotiations, Betis managed to get Roma to pay close to the 30 million euros they had been requesting. The initial fee will be 24 million euros, as well as 50 percent of Tonny Sanabria's economic rights.

This has prompted interested from England, where West Ham United have been said to be keeping tabs on the former Hertha Berlin man, as reported by Italian media outlet FcInternews.
Arsenal are reportedly one of a number of Premier League clubs interested in Aston Villa centre-back Tyrone Mings this summer, but they may be unable to afford him.
Aston Villa are planning a renewed approach for Nottingham Forest winger Joe Lolley and want to sign Tyrone Mings on a permanent deal from Bournemouth.

Aston Villa have agreed a fee of £25m with Bournemouth for defender Tyrone Mings, Sky Sports News understands.Mings is expected in the Midlands in the next 24 hours to complete contract terms with the club he helped gain promotion to the Premier League.With the centre-back having spent last season on loan at Villa Park, it’s not thought he requires a full medical.

Aston Villa is delighted to announce the signing of Tyrone Mings from AFC Bournemouth. The 26-year-old defender arrives on a permanent deal having spent the second half of last season on loan at Villa Park.

REPORTS Nottingham Forest have agreed a loan fee for Cherries defender Tyrone Mings are understood to be untrue.BBC Nottingham reported Forest had come to a financial arrangement with the Dorset club for the 25-year-old.

According to a report from the Daily Mail (23/1; page 65), Leeds have joined West Brom in the race to sign Tyrone Mings on loan from Bournemouth.The Championship leaders have taken a while to really get going this month. Kiko Casilla is their only signing so far, but it appears that the Whites' recruitment team are looking to step up their plans during the remaining days of the window, with Mings not the only player to be recently linked.
West Brom are interested in a loan deal for Bournemouth defender Tyrone Mings, Sky Sports News understands.

Manchester United have been told that it is going to take €40m (£35m) for them to sign Eintracht Frankfurt’s Andre Silva this summer. The Red Devils have been linked with the forward in the past as an alternative to Borussia Dortmund’s Erling Haaland.
Eintracht Frankfurt attacker Ante Rebic has left the Bundesliga club to join AC Milan on a two-year loan deal, with Andre Silva leaving Serie A to replace him in Germany.

Real Madrid defender Theo Hernandez has made the decision to join AC Milan this summer, according to one journalist.We recently revealed that Milan have placed an offer of a season-long loan with an option to buy for Hernandez, who could replace Ricardo Rodriguez for next season under Marco Giampaolo.

Leicester City chief Brendan Rodgers is keeping tabs on Roma midfielder Amadou Diawara according to reports.The Guinea international is rated at £27m and is also attracting interest from Premier League rivals Tottenham and Newcastle United, according to Corriere dello Sport, with Roma open to moving him on this summer for a significant profit.
West Ham are in talks with Celta Vigo over forward Maxi Gomez, but they are hoping for a double deal that could include his team-mate Stanislav Lobotka, we can reveal.

West Ham have made further enquiries about Celta Vigo striker Maxi Gomez and his teammate midfielder Stanislav Lobotka.The pair are valued at £58million by the Spanish club and Gomez has strong interest from Valencia.

Napoli transfer target Stanislav Lobotka is not even on the Celta Vigo bench against Osasuna, reportedly because he asked not to play.The midfielder is believed to be very close to making his move for €18-20m, likely on loan with obligation to buy at the end of the season.Lobotka was called up for tonight’s game against Celta Vigo, but is left in the stands.According to Calciomercato.it, the decision was made by the Slovakia international himself, who asked not to play because he was already focused on his next destination.The 25-year-old had also been a target for Napoli over the summer, but Celta Vigo have lowered their asking price from €30m to €25m.Lobotka has also started following Napoli on Instagram and liking several of their posts.
The striker has risen to near the top of the Liga scoring charts in his second season with the Andalusian side, attracting attention from London
Arsenal are interested in signing Sampdoria goalkeeper Emil Audero as a replacement for the retiring Petr Cech, according to Sky in Italy.

Wolves are in talks to sign Portugal international midfielder Renato Sanches from Lille on loan.Sanches is currently recovering from a knee injury and faces another month out, but Wolves still hope to finalise a deal before Tuesday's deadline.

Leicester are in talks with RB Leipzig over a possible deal to sign Ademola Lookman but the two clubs are some distance apart over a fee for the winger.Lookman, who spent last season on loan at Fulham, is thought to be keen on the move if a deal can be agreed.

Leicester are edging closer to reaching an agreement with RB Leipzig to sign Ademola Lookman on Deadline Day.The two clubs are yet to agree a fee for Lookman but the Bundesliga side are prepared to lessen their demands with the valuation gap between the two sides much smaller than it was on Monday.
Talented winger Ademola Lookman has joined Leicester City on loan from Bundesliga side RB Leipzig, subject to Premier League approval.

Fulham are close to signing RB Leipzig winger Ademola Lookman on a season-long loan with the deal set to be completed in the next 24 to 48 hours.The 22-year-old Englishman was left out of Leipzig's squad for their 1-1 draw at Bayer Leverkusen on Saturday, with the German club saying he was not selected "due to ongoing transfer discussions".

The Club is delighted to announce the signing of Ademola Lookman on loan from RB Leipzig.A 22-year-old forward who is comfortable operating anywhere along the frontline, Lookman will remain at Craven Cottage for the duration of the 2020/21 season.

Leicester are exploring the possibility of signing the Atalanta striker Andrea Petagna, who is currently on loan at Spal, in the summer.Scouts have watched the 23-year-old, who has one full cap for Italy and scored 14 goals this season despite Spal being in the bottom half of the table, several times and Leicester are considering a bid of €20m.
David Luiz has refused to show up for Chelsea training as he looks to push through a move to Arsenal before Thursday’s transfer deadline.

Manchester United defender Chris Smalling has travelled to Italy to finalise a loan move to Serie A side Roma, says boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.The Premier League club have reportedly agreed a season-long deal with Roma paying a fee of £2.7m.
Chris Smalling is intent on rejoining Roma on loan from Manchester United next season and is willing to push for the deal, according to reports from Italy.

Roma are stepping up their pursuit of the Manchester United centre-back Chris Smalling and are expected to submit a second bid for the 30-year-old this week.A first offer of £11m was rejected out of hand by United, who are hoping to bolster their transfer budget with at least £18m.

Roma have submitted a new and improved bid to Manchester United for Chris Smalling. The Giallorossi have made an offer of €15 million plus add-ons for the Englishman, adding add-ons to their previous offer of €15 million in order to persuade the Red Devils to let their centre-back go.Roma however are considering alternative options to Smalling, should an agreement with United not be reached.
Manchester United have reached an agreement with AS Roma for the transfer of defender Chris Smalling.
Inter Milan are keen on Manchester United defender Chris Smalling and could meet the Red Devils’ asking price of £20m this summer.

Manchester United defender Chris Smalling has been offered to Newcastle United and a clutch of other top-flight sides after Serie A outfit AS Roma spluttered over his £20million asking price.The England international spent last term on loan in Italy but has returned to Old Trafford this summer.

By Pranav Shahaney24th Jun, 2021 | 2:10pmReport: Giovanni Simeone open to summer transfer amid West Ham linksWest Ham-linked Giovanni Simeone is seemingly keen on leaving Cagliari this summer after spending five years there.According to Tutto Mercato Web, Simeone is set to have discussions with manager Leonardo Semplici amid interest from overseas.The report states that he is eager to test himself in another country, and West Ham are said to have already made a move to sign the Argentina international.

Wolves in talks with AC Milan over Patrick Cutrone

Wolves are close to an agreement with AC Milan over a fee for striker Patrick Cutrone, Sky Sports News understands.A deal worth £16m plus add-ons is being negotiated by the clubs - Milan were holding out for £23m but are under Financial Fair Play restrictions and need to recoup funds.
Wolves have made exciting young Italian striker Patrick Cutrone their latest new signing ahead of the 2019/20 Premier League campaign.

Negotiations have not yet officially started but are expected to kickstart in the coming days and Sassuolo are looking to make a proposal to their liking.Sassuolo's dream would be Patrick Cutrone and have proposed Milan a swap deal involving the two players. Werder Bremen are closing in on a deal to sign midfielder Marko Grujic from Liverpool.Grujic has spent the last two seasons on loan in Germany at Hertha Berlin and is expected to leave Liverpool before the transfer window slams shut.

Marko Grujic's proposed loan move to Werder Bremen is now off, according to reports. The Serbian international was poised to move back to the Bundesliga on a temporary deal but that has now collapsed with just hours of the window remaining.

According to Kicker, Hertha Berlin want to sign Marko Grujic again – as well as Liverpool target Weston McKennie.Despite the global pandemic, they could be set for more spending this summer, and their plans could greatly impact Liverpool.It’s claimed that Hertha want to sign Grujic permanently after a two-year loan spell, but they want the Serbian as well as McKennie.The American star is set to leave Schalke this summer, and Hertha want to offer him a stay in Germany whilst bringing Grujic back too.

Experienced England international Danny Rose has agreed a move to Vicarage Road, the Hornets are delighted to confirm.The 30-year-old left-back, who recently left Tottenham Hotspur after 14 years in North London, will join as a free agent on July 1, signing a two-year deal.

Middlesbrough are plotting an ambitious move to sign Tottenham defender Danny Rose by Friday evening, Football Insider can exclusively reveal.The left-back, 30, is surplus to requirements at the north Londoners and is free to find a new club permanently or on loan during the domestic window.
Genoa have held talks with Tottenham over the signing of defender Danny Rose, the club have told Sky Italy.

“I will say this too, I will play up north. I don’t know exactly when but I will get back up north and play some football somewhere. I am going to make it my priority before I retire to play football up there. I have been away for over 10 years now and I don’t get to see my mum that often. I’m not saying I want out but if something came to me that was concrete, I’d have no qualms about voicing my opinions to anyone at the club.”
"Newcastle’s Steve Bruce keen on loan move for Tottenham’s Danny Rose"

Now that we all know Aaron Ramsey will be signing for Juventus in the summer, clubs will be aware Arsenal will be in need of replacing the Welshman in some shape or form.A number of names have been touted as potential replacement, but we appear to have found a new one in Fiorentina’s Jordan Veretout.The information comes from Le Foot, who look at the former Aston Villa man’s situation at Fiorentina, as a number of clubs both in Italy and abroad (including the Gunners) are interested in him after an impressive second season with the Serie A side.Scoring five league goals (the same as Ramsey has this season) in 27 Serie A appearances, the 26-year-old would provide Emery with similar versatility to the Welshman’s, capable of featuring anywhere down the midfield spine with relative ease.Both creative and tenacious, Veretout would come at a price, however, as Le Foot believe €25-30m would be needed to open talks with Fiorentina.

Barcelona manager Ernesto Valverde has restricted Carles Aleñá to one appearance this season, which came in the opening day defeat against Athletic Bilbao in August.The 21-year-old’s current situation has caught the attention of Tottenham Hotspur and Real Betis.‘Pochettino to get Aleñá’ is splashed on the front page of Mundo Deportivo as they view him as a replacement for Christian Eriksen, who could leave the club in January.

Getafe are dreaming of bringing Carles Alena to the Coliseum Alfonso Perez in January.The Barcelona midfielder is one of the big names who could be available in the winter transfer window, so it won't be easy for the Madrid side.Alena is set for a Camp Nou exit after featuring very little in the opening weeks of the season.Barcelona are open to letting Alena go on a six-month loan without the option to buy.

Alessandro Florenzi has decided to leave Roma in January. Italy manager Roberto Mancini was clear with the full-back, if he wants a spot in the squad for the Euros next summer, then he needs to play continuously for the rest of this season.Furthermore, as we have learned, Roma manager Paulo Fonseca has already let the player know that he isn't the first choice as a full-back, nor as a winger. Therefore, Florenzi has understood that he will have to pack his bags come January.There are several suitors, but Florenzi absolute dream would be Antonio Conte and Inter, given that the manager has always been a fan of the player. However, the Nerazzurri already have Candreva and Lazaro, meaning they would only make an offer if the conditions are fantastic.

Chelsea have been tipped to sign Aurelien Tchouameni before the transfer window slams shut on Tuesday evening amid the Blues' invested interest in the Frenchman this summer.Chelsea have opened talks with Monaco, reports claim, and the west Londoners have been handed a huge bargaining chip following the French side's early exit from the Champions League.

West Ham are in talks with Paris Saint-Germain over signing goalkeeper Alphonse Areola on a season-long loan.The Hammers will also have the option to make the deal for the 28-year-old France international permanent.

Pep Guardiola has been keeping a close eye on Douglas Luiz and is open to bringing him back to Manchester City when the window opens, according to reports.Luiz signed for Aston Villa last summer, after failing to earn a work permit at the Etihad.The Man City boss made his opinion on Luiz public several times before his departure, expressing his immense disappointment at his permit setback.

Manchester City are weighing up a swoop for Aston Villa midfielder Douglas Luiz - as they also target the club's star man Jack Grealish.City sold Luiz to Villa for £15million in July last year, but insisted on a £25m buyback clause for the defensive midfielder.Now Pep Guardiola is considering a reunion following the 22-year-old's fine form for Villa this season.And City could launch a £100m double raid to land the two midfielders as they look to wrest the Premier League title from reigning champions Liverpool.

Aston Villa are poised to make another huge statement of intent with the £15 million signing of Manchester City’s Douglas Luiz.Villa are closing in on the capture of the Brazilian central midfielder after agreeing a fee with the Premier League champions, as Dean Smith moves to further strengthen his squad.

Everton and Leicester City have both made informal inquiries about the RB Leipzig striker Jean-Kevin Augustin. The 21-year-old French forward is expected to cost around 20million euros (£17.5million) if he is sold this summer.

Date: 29/05, 2021Reported Everton target Merih Demiral intends to leave Juventus this summer in search of more regular football, according to a new report.La Gazzetta dello Sport report that Demiral could be subject to ‘good offers’ from abroad this summer, with the 23-year old wanting a move to a club that would feature him more prominently.He (Demiral) has found it difficult to break through at Juventus though, an elite team with an experienced backline full of quality and depth.Though Everton also have depth in the centre-back position they aren’t so flush with talent, with numerous reports speculating that the club have an interest in bolstering their options in that position this summer.At just 23-years old, Demiral fits the profile of the type of player that Marcel Brands is interested in pursuing this summer, while he would bring with him much desired Champions League experience.

TOTTENHAM are ready to join rivals Arsenal and Manchester United in the race for Juventus defender Merih Demiral.The Turkish central defender could become Jose Mourinho's first signings as Spurs boss, after club officials contacted the player's agent about a move.
Juventus centre-back Merih Demiral is interesting both Arsenal and Manchester United, with both clubs keeping tabs on the player ahead of a possible bid in January.

English Premier League outfits Arsenal and Manchester United are ready to rival Italian Serie A giants AC Milan for a possible signing of league rivals Juventus’ highly-rated centre-back Merih Demiral in the January transfer window, as per Tuttosport cited by Calciomercato.com.

AC Milan remain interested in Juventus defender Merih Demiral but face competition from two clubs, according to a report.The Rossoneri are expected to be active in the January transfer window after a dismal start to the season which has seen them lose seven of their first 12 games.Finding a consistent partner for Alessio Romagnoli has been a problem, and La Gazzetta dello Sport (via Calciomercato.com) reported last month that a new centre-back could be purchased if Mattia Caldara’s return to the fold does not go to plan after his long-term injury.

Foot Mercato report that Premier League side Everton have made an approach for 21-year-old French youth international winger Moussa Diaby, who is current contracted to Bayer Leverkusen until June 2025.Diaby has produced 10 goals and 15 assists in 41 matches in all competitions this season – the Toffees’ approach came in the form of contact with the player’s representatives to get a sense of the player’s intentions for the summer transfer window. Only a major bid is likely to make Bayer take a serious look.
French newspaper L’Equipe have claimed that Tottenham Hotspur have opened talks to sign Rennes striker Mbaye Niang this summer, after another solid 2019-20 campaign
Stade Rennais striker M’Baye Niang is attracting interest from Brighton.

Diego Carlos, the Sevilla centre-back, is on Newcastle’s list of potential signings as they look at alternatives to Sven Botman. Sevilla would be expected to make a huge profit on the £13.5 million they paid Nantes to land the defender from the French club in 2019, with his market value now beyond £30m.- subscription required -
Newcastle are continuing to push to sign Diego Carlos and are awaiting a response from Sevilla after submitting a bid for the defender.
Newcastle United are hoping to get a £30million deal finalised for Sevilla centre back Diego Carlos this week.

Sevilla defender Diego Carlos has told the club he wants to leave this month to join Newcastle.The Brazilian is writing a transfer request to send to the club's manager and president after Newcastle had submitted a bid for him earlier this month.Sevilla are willing to do business with Newcastle at the right price, but the Magpies will not pay over the odds for the 28-year-old and have other centre-back targets.

Sevilla defender Diego Carlos has told the club he wants to leave this month to join Newcastle.The Brazilian is writing a transfer request to send to the club's manager and president after Newcastle had submitted a bid for him earlier this month.

Newcastle will be able to sign Diego Carlos if they offer Sevilla €45m (£37.7m) for the Brazil centre back.Newcastle are currently refusing to pay more than about €30m (£25.1m).Diego Carlos has turned down the offer a new contract at Sevilla.Sevilla offered to almost double his wages to match what he is being offered by Newcastle.Carlos respects Sevilla and is happy at the club but he would like to move to Newcastle.

Newcastle's offer for defender Diego Carlos was "good and respectable" but it was not the right time, says Sevilla's director of football, Monchi.The 28-year-old won the 2020 Europa League with Sevilla and gold at the Tokyo Olympics with Brazil last summer.But Newcastle's reported bid of £30m fell short of the La Liga side's asking price, given the little time they have to find a replacement in January.

Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta is interested in signing Sevilla defender Diego Carlos - according to The Telegraph.Arteta wants the 27-year-old to add extra depth to his defence as he plans a major squad overhaul in the summer transfer window.Liverpool, Manchester City and Tottenham have also been linked with Carlos, who helped Sevilla secure a fourth-place La Liga finish in 2019-20.

Diego Carlos has emerged as a leading centre-half target for Pep Guardiola as the Manchester City manager prepares to overhaul his defence.Twelve months after failing to replace Vincent Kompany, Guardiola is determined to recruit a top-quality central defender to play alongside Aymeric Laporte and serious thought is being given to a move for Carlos as an alternative to Napoli’s Kalidou Koulibaly.Carlos has had a nomadic career but the 27-year-old Brazilian has caught the eye of City, Tottenham Hotspur and numerous other leading European clubs with his outstanding form for Sevilla during his first season in La Liga.

Sevilla defender Diego Carlos is on Liverpool's transfer target list, with the Brazilian having impressed for the Spanish Liga side since his arrival from Nantes in 2019.It is also understood that he has been eyed by Real Madrid as a potential replacement for Sergio Ramos, and comes with a £64m release clause.
Wolves are interested in Sevilla's Lucas Ocampos, who could be an immediate replacement for Adama Traore if the club receives a big offer for the winger.

Everton could sign Marseille winger Lucas Ocampos for as little as £9 million this summer. Everton are one of a number of clubs looking to sign Manchester City midfielder Fabian Delph.Sky Sports News understands there is 'significant interest' in Delph, who has one year remaining on his current deal, and it is believed the 29-year-old has been told he can leave the club this summer.

Arsenal are in talks with Real Madrid over re-signing attacking midfielder Martin Odegaard on a permanent deal.It is thought the Norway international, whose contract at the Bernabeu runs until 2023, would cost in the region of £35-40m.

Arsenal are close to agreeing a deal with Real Madrid for the permanent transfer of Martin Odegaard.Although a deal has not yet been finalised, it is understood that Odegaard did not train with the main first-team group at Real on Tuesday, ahead of a possible transfer which is expected to be in the region of €35 million.

Tottenham have stepped up talks with Atalanta over a deal for centre-back Cristian Romero.Spurs have made an offer of at least £34m (€40m) plus £8.5m (€10) in bonuses - but he is not their only centre-back target and the club will not overpay for the Argentine.
