Real Madrid left-back Sergio Reguilon is in talks to join Chelsea, with discussions already at an advanced stage, sources have told ESPN.The defender, 23, has attracted interest from a number of top European clubs after impressing in La Liga this season on loan at Sevilla.Chelsea's No. 1 left-back target this year has been Leicester's Ben Chilwell, but negotiations have proved difficult. Arsenal are "ahead" in the race to sign Manuel Locatelli from Sassuolo and have made a "concrete offer" for the Italy midfielder, according to the Serie A club's sporting director."It's true that other clubs from abroad are interested, Arsenal are one of these and they are ahead of everyone else because they tabled the only concrete offer we have received so far."

Arsenal have made a £34million offer for Manuel Locatelli, according to the agent of a player who has been linked with a swap deal for the Italy midfielder.The Gunners are among several clubs interested in signing Locatelli from Sassuolo this summer after he impressed during Euro 2020.

Arsenal are targeting a move for £32million-rated Sevilla midfielder Joan Jordan in the January transfer window, according to reports.According to The Sun, Arteta believes versatile central midfielder Jordan can be the answer to his side’s problems and Arsenal are said to be willing to pay Sevilla’s asking price of around £32m.The report states that the Gunners have been tracking Jordan for three years and Arteta is keen on his ‘ability to lead and inspire’.

Joan Jordan insists he is ‘super comfortable’ at Sevilla after being linked with a move to Arsenal.According to reports, Arteta has identified Jordan as a top target, while Arsenal are ready to pay Sevilla’s £32 million asking price.'In the end, these are just things that come out, like the many things that were said, the rumours, when I was at Eibar,’ Jordan told Estadio Deportivo.‘I have always been very clear about the present… the future does not feed me, it takes away from me and does not give me the energy I need.‘My mind is genuinely here in Sevilla and on the derby. I am at a super ambitious club, and I have nothing more to say because I really am super comfortable here, like I was when I arrived here.‘Things can come out, but I tell you my mind today and the people that know me can back me up, it’s not that I’m avoiding the question just that really, my mind is on the derby.’

AC Milan are considering the future of their winger Diego Laxalt. [...]Newcastle have sounded out the player’s availability but Laxalt is not too much attracted by the Magpies. Serie A clubs like Lazio and Atalanta have also set their sights on the Uruguayan star but at the moment there are no concrete offers on the table.Leonardo will consider Laxalt’s sale for a fee in the region of € 12 million.

There is believed to have been interest in Saliba from England, France, Spain, Italy and Germany, with Marseille, Newcastle United and Lille emerging as the leading contenders for his signature.The France youth international is understood to have picked Marseille and the Ligue 1 side will now try to agree a deal with Arsenal, which should not be problematic.Saliba would come straight into contention for a starting position at the Stade Velodrome under the guidance of head coach Jorge Sampaoli, whose men will play Europa League football in 2021-22.
William Saliba has joined Ligue 1 side Marseille on loan for the 2021/22 season.

Arsenal defender William Saliba is set to join Nice on loan until the end of the season.The Ligue 1 club will not have an option to make the move permanent as the Gunners see the 19-year-old as a part of their long-term plans.Arsenal hope Saliba's return to France will provide him with some valuable experience before competing for a first-team place next season.

William Saliba has joined French Ligue 1 side Nice on loan for the remainder of the season.The move is designed to give the 19-year-old French youth international defender the chance for more competitive playing time.Everyone at Arsenal wishes William all the best with Nice.

Arsenal defender William Saliba is attracting interest from Rennes ahead of a late loan move away from Emirates Stadium.[...] The centre-back, however, has not made his debut and now Standard Sport understands Rennes are keen to sign him on loan.Arsenal are now weighing up the early approach as they believe it could be best for the youngster to gain more experience.

Arsenal have been linked with a number of defenders already in the first few days of the summer transfer window.One name that has also stood out has been that of William Saliba.The talented right-footed centre-back starred for Saint Etienne while featuring 16 times during his breakthrough season as he boosted Les Verts to an excellent fourth place in Ligue 1.

Arsenal are in talks to sign Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba.The Gunners are keen to strengthen a back line which conceded 51 goals in the Premier League last season and have identified the 18-year-old as a hugely promising talent for the future.Reports in France suggest Arsenal have already reached a contract agreement with Saliba but it is thought the deal is not in fact that far advanced.

Arsenal are closing in on a deal for Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba.The Ligue 1 club are demanding 30 million euros (£26.5m) and an agreement they will keep the centre-back on loan next season before moving he moves to north London in 2020.

Arsenal are set to sign Saint-Etienne defender William Saliba in a 30m euro (£27m) deal that will see him loaned back to the Ligue 1 club next season.The Gunners will pay for the 18-year-old in instalments, which will not have a major impact on their restricted budget of around £45m for this summer.

The young St-Étienne centre-back William Saliba has decided to join Arsenal despite a late attempt by Tottenham to sign the France Under-20 international.Arsenal agreed a five-year deal with the 18-year-old last week and he looked all set to sign for the Gunners, but late interest from their North London rivals delayed the announcement.

Highly-rated French defender William Saliba is joining us from Ligue 1 club Saint-Etienne on a long-term contract.The much sought after centre half will spend a season back on loan at Saint-Etienne before joining our squad next summer.

ARSENAL face competition from rivals Tottenham in the battle for transfer target William Saliba.[...]However, Tottenham are reportedly trying to swoop in at the 11th hour and steal the youngster from their nearest rivals.RMC report that Mauricio Pochettino's side have contacted Saint-Etienne to inform them of their interest.
Watford are in talks to sign former Arsenal forward Danny Welbeck on a free transfer, Sky Sports News understands.

With nine goalkeepers in its professional workforce this season, Paris Saint-Germain will have to downsize with regard to its last ramparts. It could start in Turkey: according to the Istanbul media photomac, Besiktas could lose his nugget in this post Ersin Destanoğlu, notably courted by OGC Nice. To replace him, the management of the Black Eagles would think of the Spaniard Sergio Rico (27) to replace him.

Bournemouth have accepted a bid which could rise to £9.5m for striker Lys Mousset from Sheffield United, Sky Sports News understands.Mousset joined Bournemouth from Le Havre in 2016 and has made 58 Premier League appearances, mostly as a substitute, scoring three goals.
Lys Mousset is travelling to Yorkshire for a medical with Sheffield United ahead of a move from Bournemouth after a £9m bid was accepted, Sky Sports News understands.

For the third time this summer, the Blades have smashed the club's transfer record.French striker Lys Mousset has signed a three-deal with the Blades after an undisclosed fee with AFC Bournemouth was reached for his services.

CELTIC are weighing up a move for Cherries striker Lys Mousset, according to a report in the Scottish Daily Mail.The 23-year-old has just one year remaining on his contract at Vitality Stadium and the report claims Cherries are looking for around £10million for the Frenchman.

TRT Spor in Turkey have linked the 22-year-old to the 21-time Turkish Champions.Mousset had last month been a reported target of Fulham but Eddie Howe quashed speculation over a move for the former Le Havre man.The Cherries boss described as “a big part of our future” the former France under-21 international.Mousset has scored once for Cherries this season, that goal came against MK Dons in the Carabao Cup back in August.

Tottenham Hotspur are in talks with Fiorentina over a move for midfielder Sofyan Amrabat.The Athletic understands that Fiorentina are preparing for the 25-year-old to leave the club this month, having fallen down the pecking order under head coach Vincenzo Italiano.

Tottenham are in talks with Fiorentina over a loan move for Moroccan midfielder Sofyan Amrabat.Spurs are discussing a loan until the end of the season with La Viola, although any deal may be dependent on their success at offloading Ndombele, Lo Celso or Alli.
Celtic are close to concluding a deal to sign Paris Saint-Germain striker Timothy Weah on loan for the remainder of the season, according to Sky sources.

CELTIC are delighted to announce that Timothy Weah has joined the club on a six-month loan deal from Paris Saint-Germain. The highly-rated 18-year-old has scored two goals in six first-team appearances for PSG, while he has also been capped eight times by the United States.

Fulham are close to completing a deal to sign Torino's Nigeria international defender Ola Aina.The ex-Chelsea youngster is set to join the Cottagers on an initial season-long loan, with the deal expected to be completed by the middle of the week.Fulham will have the option to make Aina's loan a permanent transfer for a figure in the region of £11m.
The Club is delighted to confirm the signing of Ola Aina on a season-long loan from Torino.Fulham also holds an option to make the deal to sign the 23-year-old permanent.

Brighton are poised to complete the capture of Getafe left-back Marc Cucurella.The Athletic understands that the Premier League side have matched the £15 million release clause in Cucurella's contract.The 23-year-old is flying to England later today to finalise the formalities. An announcement is likely tomorrow, on the final day of the transfer window.
Brighton & Hove Albion are delighted to confirm the signing of Marc Cucurella from Getafe on a contract until June 2026, for undisclosed terms and subject to international clearance.

Chelsea are reportedly positioning themselves to sign Marc Cucurella and have identified the Spaniard as their second choice left-back option if they fail to land Ben Chilwell this summer. Blues manager Frank Lampard is planning a squad overhaul this summer and is in the market for defensive reinforcements as he looks to address his side's vulnerability at the back

As Aaron Cresswell begins to approach his thirties, the young ​Barcelona defender would provide competition for the Englishman. Cucurella has impressed on loan at Getafe this season, and can also provide an option at left-midfield.

Getafe full-back Marc Cucurella has emerged as a transfer target for Chelsea this summer, according to a report in Diario Sport.The player will be available for €25m this summer – a price that significantly undercuts the valuations of other Blues targets Alex Telles (€40m) of FC Porto and Leicester’s Ben Chilwell (€90m).
